original: @189b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @189b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ma dhyan nta bi bham ga t'i k'a /
analyzed: ma dhyan nta bi bham ga t'i k'a /
translated: Madhyāntavibhāṅgatikā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad /
translated: Explanation of the Distinction between the Middle and the Extremes

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: ya rabs dag ni phal cher bla ma dang / dad pa'i lha la mchod nas las rnams la 'jug ste /
analyzed: ya rabs dag ni phal cher bla ma dang / dad pa'i lha la mchod nas las rnams la 'jug ste /
translated: Most of the righteous, after making offerings to their gurus and to the deity of faith, engage in their activities.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo rnam par bshad par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo rnam par bshad par 'dod pas /
translated: Desiring to explain the Sūtra of the Distinction between the Middle and the Extremes,

original: bdag la yang 'di ni ya rabs kyi tshul can no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la yang 'di ni ya rabs kyi tshul can no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to make it known that this is the way of the righteous,

original: de mdzad pa dang 'chad pa la mchod nas /
analyzed: de mdzad pa dang 'chad pa la mchod nas /
translated: after making offerings to the one who composed it and to the one who explained it,🔽I will engage in analyzing its meaning.

original: de'i don rnam par dbye bar zhugs so zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don rnam par dbye bar zhugs so zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate this, it says,

original: bstan bcos 'di ni rab mdzad pa //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ni rab mdzad pa //
translated: This treatise was composed

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de ltar byas na yon tan ci zhig thob ce na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na yon tan ci zhig thob ce na /
translated: If it is done in this way, what good qualities are obtained?

original: yon tan dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs 'dogs pa la mchod na bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs 'dogs pa la mchod na bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one worships those who have good qualities and those who are helpful, one's merit increases.

original: bsod nams 'phel na yang dag par rtsom pa la bar chad dang bgegs kyis mi tshugs par tshogs chung ngu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel na yang dag par rtsom pa la bar chad dang bgegs kyis mi tshugs par tshogs chung ngu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If merit increases, one is not harmed by obstacles and hindrances to correct practice, and one's accumulations are quickly completed.

original: yang na mdzad pas gsungs pa dang / 'chad pas bshad pa yang dag par byin par bsnyad pas /
analyzed: yang na mdzad pas gsungs pa dang / 'chad pas bshad pa yang dag par byin par bsnyad pas /
translated: Or, it is said that by the performance, the explanation, and the correct bestowal of the explanation,

original: mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa dang / mdo dang 'brel ba la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa dang / mdo dang 'brel ba la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: respect for the performance, the explanation, and the connection with the sutra is generated.

original: bstan bcos 'di ni rab mdzad pa //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ni rab mdzad pa //
translated: This treatise is well performed

original: zhes bya ba thams cad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba thams cad smos so //
translated: all of this is stated.

original: de la mdzad pas bshad par bstan pas mdo la gus pa skye ste /
analyzed: de la mdzad pas bshad par bstan pas mdo la gus pa skye ste /
translated: There, respect for the sutra is generated by the teaching of the explanation through performance.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa'i mdzad pa po ni 'phags pa byams pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa'i mdzad pa po ni 'phags pa byams pa ste /
translated: Thus, the performer of this treatise in verse is the noble Maitreya,

original: de yang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i phyir /
translated: and because he is obstructed by only one birth,🔽he is called Maitreya, the One with One More Birth to Go.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa dang gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang bzod pa dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa dang gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang bzod pa dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
translated: He is the one who has gone to the culmination of the perfection of all the superknowledges, the powers, the confidences, the unique qualities, the aspects of abandonment, the great love, the great compassion, and all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la sgrib pa yang ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la sgrib pa yang ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has completely abandoned all the obscurations of the bodhisattva stages.

original: @190a * // 'chad pas yang dag par byin pa'i sgo nas 'grel pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @190a * // 'chad pas yang dag par byin pa'i sgo nas 'grel pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: One should have respect for the commentary because it is given by the expounder.

original: 'di la 'chad pa ni slob dpon thogs med do //
analyzed: 'di la 'chad pa ni slob dpon thogs med do //
translated: The expounder here is the master Asanga.

original: de las slob dpon btsun pa dbyig gnyen gyis gsan nas 'di'i 'grel pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de las slob dpon btsun pa dbyig gnyen gyis gsan nas 'di'i 'grel pa mdzad de /
translated: The master of the venerable Vasubandhu heard it from him and composed this commentary.

original: de gnyis kyang shes rab mchog dang ldan pas ma nor bar rtogs pa dang / bzung ba dang ston nus pas 'dir mdo'i don ma nor ba bstan to zhes 'grel pa la gus pa skye ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang shes rab mchog dang ldan pas ma nor bar rtogs pa dang / bzung ba dang ston nus pas 'dir mdo'i don ma nor ba bstan to zhes 'grel pa la gus pa skye ste /
translated: Since both of them have the highest wisdom, they have understood it without error and are able to retain it and teach it. Therefore, one should have respect for the commentary because it teaches the meaning of the sūtra without error.

original: de ltar gang dag gang zag tshad mar byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar gang dag gang zag tshad mar byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, those who take the person as the authority

original: mdo dang 'grel pa la gus pa skye'o //
analyzed: mdo dang 'grel pa la gus pa skye'o //
translated: have respect for the sutras and the commentaries.

original: gang yang chos la ston pa de dag ni mdo dang 'grel pa'i don bzang po khong du chud de /
analyzed: gang yang chos la ston pa de dag ni mdo dang 'grel pa'i don bzang po khong du chud de /
translated: But those who teach the Dharma understand the good meaning of the sutras and the commentaries.

original: nges pa skyes na 'di mdzad pa dang 'chad pa yang rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin gyis /
analyzed: nges pa skyes na 'di mdzad pa dang 'chad pa yang rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin gyis /
translated: When they have gained certainty, they have respect for the author and the expounder, because they understand that the author and the expounder are distinguished by their realization.

original: rtog ge dang lung tsam gyis rab tu phye bar ni zad do zhes mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa la gus pa skye'o //
analyzed: rtog ge dang lung tsam gyis rab tu phye bar ni zad do zhes mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa la gus pa skye'o //
translated: But those who are distinguished by mere logic and mere scripture have respect for the author and the expounder.

original: da ni bstan bcos kyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba dang / ci'i phyir bstan bcos zhes bya ba 'di bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos kyi rang bzhin ci 'dra ba dang / ci'i phyir bstan bcos zhes bya ba 'di bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the nature of the treatise and why it is called a treatise should be explained.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni bstan bcos so //
translated: The consciousnesses that appear as the collection of names, phrases, and letters are the treatise.

original: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i sgra'i khyad par du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams bstan bcos so //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i sgra'i khyad par du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams bstan bcos so //
translated: Or else, the consciousnesses that appear as the special sounds that cause the attainment of supramundane wisdom are the treatise.

original: rnam par rig pa rnams ji ltar mdzad cing brjod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa rnams ji ltar mdzad cing brjod ce na /
translated: How can the statements and actions of the Buddha be explained?

original: mdzad pa dang 'chad pa'i rnam par rig pa las nyan pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams skye bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mdzad pa dang 'chad pa'i rnam par rig pa las nyan pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams skye bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: The statements and actions of the Buddha are the cause of the statements and actions of the disciples.

original: slob ma 'chos pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
analyzed: slob ma 'chos pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
translated: The treatise is for the purpose of disciplining disciples.

original: slob ma'i 'chos pa ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob ma'i 'chos pa ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The discipline of disciples is for the purpose of generating the special qualities of morality, meditative stabilization, and wisdom.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid tshogs par mi 'byung ba'i las las bzlog pa dang / tshogs par 'byung ba'i las la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid tshogs par mi 'byung ba'i las las bzlog pa dang / tshogs par 'byung ba'i las la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the non-concurrent karma of body, speech, and mind and the concurrent karma of body, speech, and mind.

original: yang na bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir bstan bcos te /
translated: Or, it is a treatise because it is suitable as the definition of a treatise.

original: lung mnos pa goms par byas pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang / bar chad med pa yun ring ba'i sdug bsngal drag po sna tshogs kyis 'jigs pa'i ngan song rnams dang / srid pa las skyob pa gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lung mnos pa goms par byas pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang / bar chad med pa yun ring ba'i sdug bsngal drag po sna tshogs kyis 'jigs pa'i ngan song rnams dang / srid pa las skyob pa gang yin pa de ni bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of a treatise is that which eliminates afflictions together with their imprints through receiving and cultivating its teachings, and which protects from the lower realms and cyclic existence, which are feared due to various intense and long-lasting sufferings without interruption.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / ngan 'gro dang srid @190b pa las skyob pas bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang / ngan 'gro dang srid @190b pa las skyob pas bstan bcos kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the definition of a treatise is that which subdues the enemy of afflictions and protects from the lower realms and cyclic existence.

original: de gnyis kyang theg pa chen po thams cad dang / de bshad pa thams cad la yod kyi gzhan la med de de'i phyir 'di ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang theg pa chen po thams cad dang / de bshad pa thams cad la yod kyi gzhan la med de de'i phyir 'di ni bstan bcos so //
translated: Those two exist in all of the Great Vehicle and all of its explanations, but not in others. Therefore, this is a treatise.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, it is said:

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin pa //
translated: That which subdues all enemies, the afflictions, and protects from the lower realms and cyclic existence,

original: chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
analyzed: chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
translated: is a treatise because of the qualities of Dharma protection.

original: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //🔽'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med // 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These two are not found in other systems.🔽This

original: theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas dngos po bdun du bsdus pa /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas dngos po bdun du bsdus pa /
translated: This refers to the seven topics summarized in terms of the three vehicles.🔽This treatise, the Verses Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes, is called this because it is based on the mind and is directly taught.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba thob pa dang / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'di ni sems la gnas pa'i phyir dang 'di zhes mngon sum du bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba thob pa dang / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'di ni sems la gnas pa'i phyir dang 'di zhes mngon sum du bstan to //
translated: The

original: rab mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: rab mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: one who does this is the agent.

original: skad kyi dbyings 'di thob par byed pa yin mod kyi /🔽'on kyang rab kyi sgra dang sgrogs na byed par lta ste /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings 'di thob par byed pa yin mod kyi / 'on kyang rab kyi sgra dang sgrogs na byed par lta ste /
translated: Although this verbal root does express the agent,🔽it is also seen to express the object when it is combined with the prefix pra.

original: skad dbyings don gyi stobs ldan yang //
analyzed: skad dbyings don gyi stobs ldan yang //
translated: Although the verbal root has the power to express the meaning,

original: nye bar bsgyur bas zil non 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar bsgyur bas zil non 'gyur //
translated: it is overwhelmed by the prefix.

original: gang g'a'i chu ni mngar mod kyi //
analyzed: gang g'a'i chu ni mngar mod kyi //
translated: The water of the Ganges is sweet,

original: rgya mtsho'i chu ni ji bzhin no //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu ni ji bzhin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: but it is like the water of the ocean.

original: bde gshegs nyid skyes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde gshegs nyid skyes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is born from the Sugata

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par shin tu gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par shin tu gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone to the non-abiding nirvana, which is free from the afflictive obstructions together with their instincts and from the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de yang bag chags kyi sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa /
analyzed: de yang bag chags kyi sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa /
translated: Moreover, he is the one who has abandoned all the obstructions together with their instincts.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa /
translated: He is the essence of the realization of all aspects of all phenomena, the basis of all mastery,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu mnga' ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu mnga' ste /
translated: and he possesses inconceivable power like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad lhun gyis grub par mdzad par spyod pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad lhun gyis grub par mdzad par spyod pa /
translated: He acts spontaneously for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Well-Gone is the essence of the distinctive nonconceptual gnosis.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i deb zhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i deb zhin nyid de /
translated: The essence of that is the suchness of complete purification.

original: de las rnam bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes rab tu byung ba'i phyir de las sam /
analyzed: de las rnam bar mi rtog pa'i ye shes rab tu byung ba'i phyir de las sam /
translated: Because the nonconceptual gnosis arises from that, it is the source of that.

original: der skye bas na bde gshegs nyid skyes so //
analyzed: der skye bas na bde gshegs nyid skyes so //
translated: He is born from the Sugata, because he is born in that place.

original: yang na bde bar gshegs pa nyid du skyes pas /
analyzed: yang na bde bar gshegs pa nyid du skyes pas /
translated: Or else, he is born as a Sugata,

original: bde gshegs nyid skyes te /🔽mdo gzhan las de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu rnyed pas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung du skyes @191a * //
analyzed: bde gshegs nyid skyes te / mdo gzhan las de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu rnyed pas / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung du skyes @191a * //
translated: because he is born as the very nature of the Sugata.🔽As it is said in another sutra, “He is born in the lineage of the Tathagatas, because he has attained the Dharma that is their very nature.

original: pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is just as has been said.🔽

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la rab tu gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la rab tu gnas pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva who is established in the tenth stage,

original: shes bya'i dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad sgyu ru ra lag mthil du gzhag pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad sgyu ru ra lag mthil du gzhag pa /
translated: like a magician who places all the forms of knowable things on the palm of his hand,

original: dar lva srab mos g-yogs pa'i mig la snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dar lva srab mos g-yogs pa'i mig la snang ba bzhin no //
translated: or like one who sees forms with an eye covered by a thin silk cloth,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ni mig gi sgrib pa bsal ba bzhin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ni mig gi sgrib pa bsal ba bzhin te /
translated: the Lord, having removed the obscurations of the eye,

original: 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: this is the difference.

original: 'dir ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid las skyes pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni bde bar gshegs pa'i bdag nyid las skyes pas /
translated: Here, he is born from the very nature of the Sugata,

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa de kho na thugs su chud pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi lta bar bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa de kho na thugs su chud pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi lta bar bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: This shows the perfection of his understanding of reality, and his perfection of compassion, since he composed the treatise without regard for wealth and honor.

original: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows his perfection of wisdom.

original: 'chad pa ni bshad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa ni bshad par byed pa ste /
translated: To explain means to expound.

original: mngon par mchod ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par mchod ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with he paid homage.

original: kha cig na re bde gshegs nyid las skyes pa zhes kyang bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bde gshegs nyid las skyes pa zhes kyang bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that it means born from the Sugata himself.

original: de ni 'phags pa thogs med do //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa thogs med do //
translated: This refers to the noble Asanga.

original: de la ni 'phags pa byams pa'i byin rlabs kyis na /
analyzed: de la ni 'phags pa byams pa'i byin rlabs kyis na /
translated: Through the blessing of the noble Maitreya,

original: chos kyi rgyun gyis bstan bcos 'di mngon du gyur cing bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun gyis bstan bcos 'di mngon du gyur cing bshad do //
translated: he manifested and expounded this treatise through the stream of the Dharma.

original: su la 'chad pa zhe na /
analyzed: su la 'chad pa zhe na /
translated: To whom did he explain it?

original: bdag sogs la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag sogs la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To me and others, he said.

original: bdag thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag thog mar byas pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who are preceded by me are me and others.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi mi slu ba las lung mnos par ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi mi slu ba las lung mnos par ston to //
translated: This shows that he received the transmission from the infallible himself.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'am //🔽rtsa ba bskangs pa'am /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'am // rtsa ba bskangs pa'am /
translated: “Also” means “in addition. ”

original: lhag pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshig ste /
translated: It is a supplementary word.

original: mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa nyi tshe la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mdzad pa dang / 'chad pa nyi tshe la ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the author and the expounder are to be honored only a little,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gang yang rung ba dag la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gang yang rung ba dag la mchod par bya'o //
translated: but rather that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are to be honored.

original: mngon mchod ces bya ba ni rjed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon mchod ces bya ba ni rjed pa'o //
translated: “Worship” means to revere.

original: mngon par zhes bya ba ni mdun nam mngon sum dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhes bya ba ni mdun nam mngon sum dang 'dra bar gnas pa'o //
translated: “Clearly” means in the presence of, or as if in the presence of.

original: mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rjed pa'o //
translated: “Worship” means to revere with body, speech, and mind.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa dang 'chad pa la mngon par mchod nas ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽don rnams dbye phyir 'bad par bya //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa dang 'chad pa la mngon par mchod nas ci zhig bya zhe na / don rnams dbye phyir 'bad par bya //
translated: Having worshiped the author and the expounder, what will you do?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //🔽don dbye ba'i phyir ram ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so // don dbye ba'i phyir ram ;
translated: He says, “I will strive to analyze the topics. ”🔽“To analyze the topics” means🔽to explain the topics,

original: don dgrol ba'i phyir ram /🔽so sor dbye ba'i phyir bsgrim par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: don dgrol ba'i phyir ram / so sor dbye ba'i phyir bsgrim par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: or to distinguish them individually.🔽This is the causal meaning.

original: don rnam par dbye ba'i rgyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don rnam par dbye ba'i rgyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “in order to be the cause for the analysis of the topics. ”

original: don ni 'dir bstan bcos kyi lus yin te zhes bya ba don bdun po 'di dag bstan bcos 'di las 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i @191b phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni 'dir bstan bcos kyi lus yin te zhes bya ba don bdun po 'di dag bstan bcos 'di las 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i @191b phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is the body of the treatise, because it is said that these seven topics are explained in this treatise.

original: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di bshad ce na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di bshad ce na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is this treatise composed? In order to generate the nonconceptual gnosis of the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: chos la bdag med pa bstan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang / de goms pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa bstan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa dang / de goms pas bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa ma lus par spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By teaching the selflessness of phenomena, nonconceptual gnosis is generated, and by cultivating that, one attains the complete abandonment of all afflictive obscurations and the obscurations to omniscience.

original: chos la bdag med pa yang chos thams cad med pa nyid chos la bdag med pa dang / nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa nyid chos rnams la bdag med pa'o zhes mi mthun par smra ba de dag bkag pas /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yang chos thams cad med pa nyid chos la bdag med pa dang / nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa nyid chos rnams la bdag med pa'o zhes mi mthun par smra ba de dag bkag pas /
translated: Some say that the selflessness of phenomena is the nonexistence of all phenomena, and the selflessness of persons is the absence of an inner agent.

original: chos la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mo //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos brtsam mo //
translated: The treatise is composed in order to teach the selflessness of phenomena just as it is.

original: gzhan dag na re mtshan nyid dang sgrib pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa rnams yang dag par rtogs pa skyed pas ma rtogs pa rnams dang / log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mtshan nyid dang sgrib pa la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / log par rtogs pa rnams yang dag par rtogs pa skyed pas ma rtogs pa rnams dang / log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Others say: In order to generate correct understanding of the non-realization and wrong realization of characteristics, obscurations, and so on.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can dang chos dang 'dul ba dang / thabs kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can dang chos dang 'dul ba dang / thabs kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Or, the five objects of knowledge are the realms of the world, sentient beings, phenomena, discipline, and methods.

original: shes bya rnam lnga re re la yang rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes par bya dka'o snyam du /
analyzed: shes bya rnam lnga re re la yang rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes par bya dka'o snyam du /
translated: Since each of these has infinite subdivisions, it is difficult to know.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems zhum pa gang yin pa de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems zhum pa gang yin pa de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the discouragement of bodhisattvas,

original: mtshan nyid dang sgrib pa dang / de kho na zhes bya ba dag smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang sgrib pa dang / de kho na zhes bya ba dag smos so //
translated: the characteristics, obscurations, and so on are mentioned.

original: de la thog ma kho nar bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba la /🔽de la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don rnam par 'byed pa de la'am /
analyzed: de la thog ma kho nar bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba la / de la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi don rnam par 'byed pa de la'am /
translated: The body of the treatise is set forth at the very beginning.

original: bstan bcos la'o //🔽thog ma kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos la'o // thog ma kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word there refers to the analysis of the meaning of the treatise or to the treatise itself.

original: dang po kho nar ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar ro //
translated: The word very means at the very beginning.

original: bstan bcos ni bshad par zad do //🔽de'i lus ni mdor bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni bshad par zad do // de'i lus ni mdor bsdus pa'am /
translated: The word treatise is self-evident.

original: don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: don bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word body means summary or compendium.

original: gnas kyi don ni lus so //
analyzed: gnas kyi don ni lus so //
translated: The word body means basis.

original: dper na phyi dang nang gi skye mched kyi gnas ni khog pa ste /🔽lus zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na phyi dang nang gi skye mched kyi gnas ni khog pa ste / lus zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the basis of the internal and external sense spheres is the body.

original: don gang dag la gnas te /🔽bstan bcos la 'jug pa'i don de rnams ni de'i lus so //🔽de dag kyang don bdun po dag ste /
analyzed: don gang dag la gnas te / bstan bcos la 'jug pa'i don de rnams ni de'i lus so // de dag kyang don bdun po dag ste /
translated: Just as it is said, The body is the basis of the sense spheres.🔽The word body means that which is based on the meaning.

original: mtshan nyid la sogs pa dag go //🔽rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la sogs pa dag go // rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni bcas pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the treatise is based on those meanings.🔽The word set forth means established.

original: bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bstan bcos khong du chud @192a * //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bstan bcos khong du chud @192a * //
translated: The word explained is synonymous.🔽The word comprehend means understand.

original: pa nyid kyis de'i lus shes par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis de'i lus shes par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Or else, the body itself would not be known by the body itself.

original: de bas na thog ma de rnam par gzhag pa ni don med do //
analyzed: de bas na thog ma de rnam par gzhag pa ni don med do //
translated: Therefore, the initial presentation of the seven topics is meaningless.

original: slob ma rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir don med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not meaningless, because it is for the benefit of disciples.

original: slob mas don khong du chud na rgyas par brjod kyang bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur te dkyus kyis bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin te /
analyzed: slob mas don khong du chud na rgyas par brjod kyang bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur te dkyus kyis bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin te /
translated: If disciples understand the meaning, then even if it is stated extensively, they will easily understand it, just as a horse runs without obstruction on a well-prepared racecourse.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba don bdun po 'di dag bstan bcos 'di las 'chad do zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba don bdun po 'di dag bstan bcos 'di las 'chad do zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is not the case elsewhere. These seven topics are explained in this treatise.

original: bstan bcos kyi lus rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi lus rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the body of the treatise is complete means that the body of the treatise is finished.

original: shes par bya ba yin pas don de khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yin pas don de khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it should be understood, because it is to be known.

original: bdun po zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
analyzed: bdun po zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
translated: The word seven refers to the number.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid la sogs pa smos pa gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid la sogs pa smos pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase these topics refers to the characteristics and so on that have been mentioned.

original: bstan bcos 'di las zhes bya ba ni dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di las zhes bya ba ni dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This treatise is the Madhyāntavibhāga.

original: 'chad ces bya ba ni bstan pa'am gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad ces bya ba ni bstan pa'am gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: To explain means to teach or to determine.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni de'i don khong du chud par byed pa'i tshig gi phrad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni de'i don khong du chud par byed pa'i tshig gi phrad do //
translated: Thus is a connective word that causes one to understand its meaning.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Characteristic means

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid do //
translated: that which is characterized by this.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of defilement and the characteristic of purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Among them, the characteristic of defilement is ninefold, beginning with:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: There is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Up to:

original: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las //
analyzed: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las //
translated: From the seven kinds of unreal imagination,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: there is the characteristic of defilement.

original: lhag ma ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: The rest is taught as the characteristic of purification.

original: gal te 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya na /
analyzed: gal te 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya na /
translated: If it is called a characteristic because it is characterized by this,🔽then it is not tenable that the characteristic of defilement is ninefold.

original: de lta na ni mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni mtshan nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then the characteristics would be different from the defilement and purification.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is not so, because the nature of things is their characteristic.

original: dper na sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni sra ba ste /
analyzed: dper na sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ni sra ba ste /
translated: For example, the characteristic of the earth element is solidity.

original: sra ba nyid las sa'i khams gud na med pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: sra ba nyid las sa'i khams gud na med pa lta bu'o ;
translated: Solidity is not different from the earth element.

original: / yang na des mtshon par bya bas mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: / yang na des mtshon par bya bas mtshan nyid de //
translated: Or, it is a characteristic because it is indicated by that.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid kyis mtshon par bya bas mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid kyis mtshon par bya bas mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, defilement and purification are characteristics because they are indicated by the nature of defilement and purification.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis @192b las mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis @192b las mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, there are two kinds of characteristics from the two, defilement and purification.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are the specific characteristic and the universal characteristic.

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa'am /🔽'dis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgrib pas sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa'am / 'dis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgrib pas sgrib pa ste /
translated: Obscuration means that which obscures the virtuous dharmas.🔽Or, it is an obscuration because it obscures the virtuous dharmas by this.

original: skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa'o //
translated: It is an obscuration because it obstructs the arising of the virtuous dharmas.

original: de yang lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo //🔽de kho na zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid de yin pas de'o //
analyzed: de yang lnga bcu rtsa gsum mo // de kho na zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid de yin pas de'o //
translated: Moreover, it is fifty-three in number.🔽Reality is thatness, thusness.

original: de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
translated: Its nature is reality.

original: phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with non-error.

original: de yang rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Moreover, it is of ten kinds.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the counteragents,

original: phyogs ni gnyen po ste de ni lam mo //
analyzed: phyogs ni gnyen po ste de ni lam mo //
translated: the side is the counteragent, and that is the path.

original: de goms par bya ba ni bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: de goms par bya ba ni bsgom pa'o ;
translated: Cultivation is the repeated practice of that.

original: / gnas skabs ni de nyid rgyun gyis skye ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: / gnas skabs ni de nyid rgyun gyis skye ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The state is the special arising of that continuum.

original: de yang rnam par bcu dgu ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par bcu dgu ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of nineteen kinds,

original: rigs kyi gnas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi gnas la sogs pa'o //
translated: beginning with the state of lineage.

original: 'bras bu thob pa ni 'bras bu rnyed pa'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa ni 'bras bu rnyed pa'o /
translated: Attainment of the result is the acquisition of the result.

original: de yang rnam pa bco lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bco lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of fifteen kinds,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: beginning with the maturation result.

original: theg pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'gro bas theg pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'gro bas theg pa ste /
translated: The vehicle is so called because one goes by it.

original: de ni theg pa yang yin la bla na med pa yang yin pas theg pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni theg pa yang yin la bla na med pa yang yin pas theg pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme vehicle because it is a vehicle and it is supreme.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: bsgrub pa bla na med pa la sogs pa'o //🔽don bdun pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub pa bla na med pa la sogs pa'o // don bdun pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the supreme vehicle, the supreme path, and the supreme result.

original: nges pa'i don dang go rims kyi don du smos pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don dang go rims kyi don du smos pa ste /
translated: The seven topics are mentioned in terms of their meaning as ascertainment and their meaning as sequence.

original: don 'di rnams 'dir bshad kyi de las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di rnams 'dir bshad kyi de las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: These topics are explained here and not others.

original: yang go rims 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang go rims 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, this sequence is in accordance with supramundane wisdom,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa /
translated: because the bodhisattva who is established in the stage of action from faith

original: tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims la rab tu gnas pas /
translated: first, by being well established in morality,

original: thog mar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: should become skilled in the afflicted and the purified.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gang gis sgrib pa gang yin pa de shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gang gis sgrib pa gang yin pa de shes par bya ste /
translated: After that, he should know which obscurations belong to which virtuous qualities.

original: de ma spangs na rnam par grol mi srid la /
analyzed: de ma spangs na rnam par grol mi srid la /
translated: If it is not abandoned, liberation is impossible.

original: rnam par mi shes na yang nyes pa ma mthong bas spong mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par mi shes na yang nyes pa ma mthong bas spong mi nus so //
translated: And if it is not known, it cannot be abandoned, since the fault is not seen.

original: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa de las dmigs pa gang gis sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba de ni de kho na yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrib pa de las dmigs pa gang gis sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba de ni de kho na yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should understand that the object of that obscuration is the reality in which the mind is liberated.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa des sgrib pa de sbyor ba gang gis zad par 'gyur ba de gnyen po bsgom par shes par bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bri ba dang gnyen po @193a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa des sgrib pa de sbyor ba gang gis zad par 'gyur ba de gnyen po bsgom par shes par bya'o // de'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bri ba dang gnyen po @193a * //
translated: After that, one should understand the cultivation of the antidote by which that obscuration is exhausted through the application of that object.

original: 'phel ba la gnas skabs su shes par bya ste /🔽rigs kyi gnas skabs la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon du gyur pa ni 'bras bu rnams te /
analyzed: 'phel ba la gnas skabs su shes par bya ste / rigs kyi gnas skabs la sogs pa'o // de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon du gyur pa ni 'bras bu rnams te /
translated: After that, one should understand the cultivation of the antidote in terms of the decrease of its counteragent and the increase of the antidote.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should understand the supramundane clear realization of the Dharma in terms of the fruits, such as the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de dag thams cad kyang bla ma dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang bla ma dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ste /
translated: All of these are common to the bodhisattvas, sravakas, etc., and to the guru.

original: mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As a sutra declares:

original: rab tu byung ba de nyan thos kyi bslab pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la yang slob po //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba de nyan thos kyi bslab pa dang / cho ga dang spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la yang slob po //
translated: The ordained person trains in the precepts, rites, spheres, and right conduct of the sravakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la slob po //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la slob po //
translated: He trains in the precepts, rites, spheres, and right conduct of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la yang slob po zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / yang dag par spyod pa la yang slob po zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He trains in the precepts, rites, spheres, and right conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bla na med pa thun mong ma yin pa ste don bdun pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bla na med pa thun mong ma yin pa ste don bdun pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas have the unsurpassed, uncommon training. This is the seventh topic, the unsurpassed.

original: gzhan na re kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir thog mar mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan na re kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir thog mar mtshan nyid do //
translated: Another says: First, the characteristics, in order to generate skill in the characteristics of defilement and purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Therein, that which is defilement

original: sgrib pa'o // rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa'o // rnam par byang ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na'o //
translated: is obscuration, and that which is purification is reality.

original: de kho na nyid khong du chud pas sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid khong du chud pas sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By understanding reality, obscuration is abandoned.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa dang de kho na'o //🔽de spang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa dang de kho na'o // de spang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, obscuration and reality are taught.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyen po 'khor dang bcas pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyen po 'khor dang bcas pa ni lam mo //
translated: After that, the path, together with its retinue, is taught as the means for abandoning obscuration.

original: lam de'i thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mal chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rab tu dbye bar bstan pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs so //🔽gnas skabs dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pas /
analyzed: lam de'i thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mal chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rab tu dbye bar bstan pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs so // gnas skabs dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pas /
translated: After that, the states, in order to teach the distinctions of the small, medium and great paths at the beginning, in the middle and at the end.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bras bu'o //
translated: After that, the result, in order to teach the attainment of the result in accordance with the states.🔽After that, the summary, in order to teach the summary of the entire treatise.

original: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ste /
translated: All of these are common to the bodhisattva and to the śrāvaka, etc.

original: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa dang theg pa chen po'i tshul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na thun mong ma yin pa dang theg pa chen po'i tshul rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya'o zer ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the uncommon and the Mahāyāna method, it is called “unsurpassed.”

original: gzhan dag na re yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir thog mar mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir thog mar mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Others say: In order to understand the characteristics of existence and non-existence, the characteristics are explained first.

original: mtshan nyid shes nas sgrib pa spang bar bya ba dang / de kho na mngon sum du bya bas de'i 'og tu sgrib pa dang de kho na'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid shes nas sgrib pa spang bar bya ba dang / de kho na mngon sum du bya bas de'i 'og tu sgrib pa dang de kho na'o //
translated: Having understood the characteristics, in order to abandon the obscurations and actualize reality, the obscurations and reality are explained next.

original: de gnyis spang ba dang mngon du bya ba'i thabs @193b ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis spang ba dang mngon du bya ba'i thabs @193b ni 'di yin te /
translated: The method for abandoning those two and actualizing them is this:

original: gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the antidotes.

original: de'i 'bring dang mchog ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bring dang mchog ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The medium and supreme are distinctions of stages.

original: des spang bar bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: What is to be abandoned by that is the result.

original: de'i 'og tu theg pa bla na med pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni go rims so zhes zer ro //🔽gzhan yang sems pa yod pa dang med pa'i chos la rmongs nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu theg pa bla na med pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni go rims so zhes zer ro // gzhan yang sems pa yod pa dang med pa'i chos la rmongs nas /
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate the unsurpassed vehicle, this is the order.

original: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spang ba'i phyir mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spang ba'i phyir mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Moreover, the characteristics are explained in order to abandon the denial and reification of existent and non-existent phenomena due to confusion.

original: rmongs pa spangs nas sgrib pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa spangs nas sgrib pa la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir sgrib pa'o //
translated: After abandoning confusion, in order to become skilled in the obscurations, there are the obscurations.

original: des de kho na bsgribs pas de kho na la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu de kho na'o //
analyzed: des de kho na bsgribs pas de kho na la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu de kho na'o //
translated: Since reality is obscured by those, in order to become skilled in reality, after that comes reality.

original: de kho na rab tu rtogs pa bsgoms pas sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur bas de kho na'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na rab tu rtogs pa bsgoms pas sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur bas de kho na'i 'og tu gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Since the obscurations are abandoned through cultivating the realization of reality, after reality comes the cultivation of the antidote.

original: de'i dbye ba la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir gnas skabs so //
translated: In order to become skilled in its divisions, there are the states.

original: gnas skabs kyis 'bras bu rab tu phye bas de la mkhas par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir gnas skabs kyi 'og tu 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis 'bras bu rab tu phye bas de la mkhas par bya ba bskyed pa'i phyir gnas skabs kyi 'og tu 'bras bu'o //
translated: Since the result is distinguished by the states, in order to generate skill in that, after the states comes the result.

original: de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la brten pas theg pa bla na med pa tha mar bshad do snyam mo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la brten pas theg pa bla na med pa tha mar bshad do snyam mo //
translated: Since all of these are based on the Great Vehicle, the unsurpassed vehicle is explained last.

original: de la mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: With regard to that, beginning from the characteristic,🔽it is said:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: There is imagination of what is unreal.

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: Therein, duality does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists therein.

original: de la yang ni de yod do //🔽zhes bya bar gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do // zhes bya bar gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also that exists therein.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang / sgrib pa la sogs pa dngos po bdun smos pa dag gi nang nas mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang / sgrib pa la sogs pa dngos po bdun smos pa dag gi nang nas mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: Therein refers to the seven topics such as the characteristic, obscuration, and so on, and beginning from the characteristic, that is, with regard to that,🔽it is said:

original: de'i phyir / yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: There is imagination of what is unreal.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on is stated.

original: ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bshad de /
translated: It is explained just as it is taught.

original: thog mar mtshan nyid bstan pas de'i phyir lhag ma rnams pas de nyid bshad pa sngar brtsam mo //
analyzed: thog mar mtshan nyid bstan pas de'i phyir lhag ma rnams pas de nyid bshad pa sngar brtsam mo //
translated: Since the characteristic is taught first, the explanation of just that is undertaken first among the remaining ones.

original: la la dag chos thams cad ri bong gi rva ltar rang bzhin ye med do //
analyzed: la la dag chos thams cad ri bong gi rva ltar rang bzhin ye med do //
translated: Some think that all phenomena are utterly nonexistent by nature, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: snyam du sems pa de'i phyir thams cad la skur ba dgag pa'i don du /🔽yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: snyam du sems pa de'i phyir thams cad la skur ba dgag pa'i don du / yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: In order to refute that nihilistic view with regard to everything,

original: ces bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya bar gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The imagination of what is unreal exists.”

original: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “nature” is left out for the sake of brevity.

original: de ltar na mdo las chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo las chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes bshad pas /
translated: Thus, since the sūtras explain that all phenomena are empty,

original: mdo dang mi 'gal lam zhe na /
analyzed: mdo dang mi 'gal lam zhe na /
translated: aren’t you contradicting the sūtras?

original: mi 'gal te 'di ltar /
analyzed: mi 'gal te 'di ltar /
translated: There is no contradiction because

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa @194a * //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa @194a * //
translated: the two do not exist there.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ye med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ye med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is empty because it is devoid of the entity of the apprehended and the apprehender. It is not that its nature is utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction with the sūtras.

original: gal te de ltar gnyis po ni ri bong gi rva ltar ye med la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gnyis po ni ri bong gi rva ltar ye med la /
translated: If the two are utterly nonexistent, like the horns of a rabbit,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ni /
translated: and the imagination of what is unreal

original: don dam par rang bzhin gyis yod na /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin gyis yod na /
translated: exists ultimately by nature,

original: de lta na ni stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, emptiness would not exist.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: That is not so, because

original: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists in this.

original: yang dag ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa nyid gang yin pa de stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa nyid gang yin pa de stong pa nyid yin pas stong pa nyid med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject exists in the imagination of what is unreal, emptiness does not not exist.

original: gal te gnyis po med pa stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te gnyis po med pa stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the absence of the duality is emptiness,

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa la yod na /
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa la yod na /
translated: and that exists in the imagination of what is unreal,

original: ci'i phyir bdag cag ma grol /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag cag ma grol /
translated: why are we not liberated?🔽If it exists, why is it not realized?

original: yod na yang ci'i phyir ma rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod na yang ci'i phyir ma rtogs snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, he says:

original: de la yang ni de yod do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And in that, that exists.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod pas de'i phyir khyed ma grol lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod pas de'i phyir khyed ma grol lo //
translated: Since the imagination of what is unreal exists in emptiness, therefore you are not liberated.

original: de bas na dri ma dang bcas pas chu'i khams dangs pa bzhin rtogs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dri ma dang bcas pas chu'i khams dangs pa bzhin rtogs par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, like the pure water element, it is not suitable to be realized because it is contaminated.

original: yang na sems can dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / gzugs dang rdzas nyid du yod par gang dag lta ba de dgag pa'i phyir /🔽yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang na sems can dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / gzugs dang rdzas nyid du yod par gang dag lta ba de dgag pa'i phyir / yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: Or else, in order to refute the view that sentient beings, mental factors, form, and substance exist,🔽it is said: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: ces gsungs te de nyid rdzas su yod do //
analyzed: ces gsungs te de nyid rdzas su yod do //
translated: That is substantially real.

original: gzugs ni de las logs shig na yang med la //
analyzed: gzugs ni de las logs shig na yang med la //
translated: Form does not exist apart from that,

original: rdzas su yang med do //
analyzed: rdzas su yang med do //
translated: nor does it exist substantially.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de la gnyis po yod ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la gnyis po yod ma yin /
translated: Because duality does not exist therein.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni ci la yang 'dzin pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni ci la yang 'dzin pa ma yin /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal does not apprehend anything at all,

original: sus kyang gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sus kyang gzung bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it apprehended by anything at all.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i dngos po tsam nyid de /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i dngos po tsam nyid de /
translated: It is simply a thing devoid of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba med par rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba med par rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: Thus, form, etc., as the apprehended object does not exist externally to consciousness, like dreams, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Consciousness appears as form, etc.

original: gal te rgyu yin na de med par de 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yin na de med par de 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it were a cause, it would not be possible for it to arise without that.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is just non-apprehension.

original: da rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: da rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a dream, etc.

original: gzhan la yang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in other cases as well, consciousness appears as objects from the complete maturation of its own seeds.

original: @194b gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med par 'gyur bas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: @194b gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med par 'gyur bas gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yod par mi rung ste /
translated: Since there is no apprehension without an object, it is not possible for there to be apprehension without an object.

original: de bas na gzugs ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las gud na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las gud na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, form does not exist apart from unreal imagination.

original: gal te gzung ba med na de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa med pas thar pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba med na de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa med pas thar pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is no object, then since there is no pure object, liberation would not exist.🔽That is not so.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
analyzed: 'di ltar / stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //
translated: Emptiness exists here.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “here” means “because.”

original: stong pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: Emptiness is the objective support of purification,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: because it is the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la yod pas thar pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la yod pas thar pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it exists in imagination of what is unreal, liberation is not nonexistent.

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la yod na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la yod na /
translated: If it exists in imagination of what is unreal,

original: de yod pas ci'i phyir mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: de yod pas ci'i phyir mi rtogs she na /
translated: why is it not understood?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas bsgribs pas nam mkha' dri ma med pa bzhin du rtogs par mi rung gi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas bsgribs pas nam mkha' dri ma med pa bzhin du rtogs par mi rung gi med pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: It is not suitable to understand it, like stainless space, because it is obscured by imagination of what is unreal. It is not nonexistent.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “but it exists in that.”

original: yang na thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa dgag pa'i phyir //🔽yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang na thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa dgag pa'i phyir // yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: Alternatively, in order to refute the denial of everything,🔽he says,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “imagination of what is unreal exists.”

original: rnam par shes pa gyur ba'i bdag nyid yod pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur ba'i bdag nyid yod pas /
translated: Since consciousness exists,

original: thams cad med pa yang ma yin bdag nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad med pa yang ma yin bdag nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: everything is neither nonexistent nor does it exist by its own nature.

original: gang dag sems pa gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las logs shig na rang bzhin du yod do zhes /
analyzed: gang dag sems pa gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las logs shig na rang bzhin du yod do zhes /
translated: Those who think that form and so on exist by intrinsic nature apart from the imagination of what is unreal,

original: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa'i don du de'i phyir //🔽de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa'i don du de'i phyir // de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: in order to refute the superimposition of what does not exist,🔽the root text says,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “The duality does not exist therein.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam yod par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam yod par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the mere imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: kha cig gnyis po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du dngos po med de zhes chad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / gzhan dag nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa nyid ni /
analyzed: kha cig gnyis po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du dngos po med de zhes chad pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / gzhan dag nang na byed pa'i skyes bu med pa nyid ni /
translated: Some hold the nonexistence of the duality to be a non-entity, like the son of an infertile woman, and they grasp emptiness as a nihilistic entity.

original: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes smra ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid do zhes smra ba de'i phyir /
translated: Others say that the nonexistence of an inner creator is the emptiness of phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid du skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa'i don dang / bdag med pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa'i don dang / bdag med pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the nihilistic denial of emptiness and in order to correctly teach selflessness,🔽the root text says,

original: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “Emptiness exists in this.”

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la stong pa nyid yod na de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la stong pa nyid yod na de lta na ni /
translated: If emptiness exists in the imagination of what is unreal, then

original: bsgrim mi dgos @195a * //
analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos @195a * //
translated: without any effort

original: par srog chags thams cad thar bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: par srog chags thams cad thar bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: all living beings would be liberated.

original: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: That is not so, because

original: de la yang ni de yod do //
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do //
translated: it exists in that.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par ma sbyangs kyi bar du thar pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par ma sbyangs kyi bar du thar pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Liberation does not exist as long as emptiness is not purified, because

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ni /
translated: the state of affliction

original: 'bad pa chen pos rnam par sbyang dgos pas 'bad pa ma byas par thar pa med do //
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos rnam par sbyang dgos pas 'bad pa ma byas par thar pa med do //
translated: must be purified with great effort. Liberation does not exist without effort.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag gi mtshan nyid brjod pa las gzhan med pas de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag gi mtshan nyid brjod pa las gzhan med pas de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Or else, since the characteristics of affliction and purification are not other than that, therefore, in order to teach the characteristics of affliction and purification,

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: the root text says: “The imagination of what is unreal exists.”

original: ces rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ces rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The root text says that in extensive form.

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because it is the characteristic of error.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rang bzhin ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rang bzhin ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the imagination of what is unreal is the addictive reality.

original: 'di 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be known that this is characterized by error?

original: 'di ltar de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: Because duality does not exist in it.

original: bdag nyid du med par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bas 'khrul ba'i ngo bo nyid du mngon ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid du med par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bas 'khrul ba'i ngo bo nyid du mngon ngo //
translated: It is the nature of error because it appears as the apprehended object and apprehending subject, although it does not exist as such.

original: da ni rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to investigate the nature of the purification, he says:

original: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'di la yod // ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Emptiness exists in this.

original: gnyis po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyis po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it has the nature of the absence of duality.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa byang ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa byang ba'o //
translated: The nature of purification is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis rab tu phye bas lam dang 'gog pa dag kyang 'dir bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis rab tu phye bas lam dang 'gog pa dag kyang 'dir bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The path and cessation should be understood as included here, because they are distinguished by emptiness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs nyid las rnam par byang ba'i phyogs nyid btsal bar bya ba'i rang gi rgyud gud na med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs nyid las rnam par byang ba'i phyogs nyid btsal bar bya ba'i rang gi rgyud gud na med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the aspect of purification is to be sought in the very aspect of affliction, and that the continuum of one's own stream is not something else, he says in this....🔽If the duality does not exist, why is the world mistaken as to its existence? He says, there is that in that....🔽The that refers to the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gal te gnyis po med na ci'i phyir de yod par 'jig rten 'khrul bar gyur zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te gnyis po med na ci'i phyir de yod par 'jig rten 'khrul bar gyur zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The in that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.🔽The there refers to the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.

original: sgyu ma ni gang po che la sogs pas stong yang /🔽glang po che la sogs par snang ba lta bu'o //🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis po de la'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni gang po che la sogs pas stong yang / glang po che la sogs par snang ba lta bu'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis po de la'am /
translated: The there refers to the imagination of what is unreal.🔽The in that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.🔽The there refers to the imagination of what is unreal.

original: des yongs su rtog pas yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis por yongs su rtog pas yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: des yongs su rtog pas yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis por yongs su rtog pas yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa'o //
translated: The that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig gis ni //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig gis ni //
translated: The there refers to the imagination of what is unreal.🔽The in that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.🔽The there refers to the imagination of what is unreal.🔽The that refers to the appearance of the duality of the imagined and the basis of the imagined.

original: ji ltar 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun rtog pa de bzhin du med par ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun rtog pa de bzhin du med par ston to //
translated: It shows that the imagination of the apprehended and apprehender does not exist in this way.

original: kun rtog pa'i tshig gis ni don @195b ji lta bur kun rtog pa don de lta bur yod pa ma yin zhes ston te //
analyzed: kun rtog pa'i tshig gis ni don @195b ji lta bur kun rtog pa don de lta bur yod pa ma yin zhes ston te //
translated: The expression “imagination” shows that the object does not exist in the way it is imagined.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba de'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba de'i mtshan nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of that freedom from the apprehended and apprehender has been explained.
