original: de yang gang yin zhe na sems dang sems las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / khams gsum pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa dan /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na sems dang sems las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dang / khams gsum pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus can dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa dan /
translated: What is that? It is the mind and mental factors of the past, future, and present, which are causes and effects, belong to the three realms, are beginningless and endless,

original: 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa dag ni //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rjes su mthun pa dag ni //
translated: and are in accord with cyclic existence.

original: khyad par med par yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'o //
translated: Without distinction, they are the imagination of what is unreal.

original: khyad par ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The distinction is the imagination of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: de la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa ni ;
analyzed: de la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa ni ;
translated: Among them, the imagination of the apprehended is

original: don dang sems can du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: don dang sems can du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of the appearance of objects and sentient beings.

original: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba'o //
translated: The imagination of the grasped is the appearance of the self and representations.

original: gnyis po ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba de la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba de la gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two are the grasped and the grasper. Therein, the grasped is form, etc.

original: 'dzin pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o // gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba nyid de /
translated: The grasper is the eye consciousness, etc.🔽The absence of the nature of the grasped and the grasper is emptiness.

original: dben pa nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i stong pa nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: dben pa nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i stong pa nyid yin gyi //
translated: Emptiness is the emptiness of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the imagination of what is unreal is not nonexistent.

original: dper na thag pa ni sprul pa'i dngos po stong ste /🔽de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dus thams cad du stong pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na thag pa ni sprul pa'i dngos po stong ste / de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dus thams cad du stong pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: For example, a rope is empty of the nature of a snake,🔽but it is not empty of the nature of a rope.

original: thag pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thag pa'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent at all times,

original: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
translated: and in the same way, the imagination of what is unreal is not nonexistent.

original: de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
translated: And in that, that exists. This is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ltar glo bur gyi sgrib pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar glo bur gyi sgrib pas nyon mongs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of being afflicted by adventitious obscurations,

original: de chu khams la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de chu khams la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is not suitable to be realized as the water element and so on.

original: de ltar gang na gang med pa de ni //
analyzed: de ltar gang na gang med pa de ni //
translated: Thus, where something does not exist,

original: des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des stong par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is seen as empty of that.

original: ci zhig gang na med ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig gang na med ce na /
translated: What does not exist where?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po ste /
translated: In the imagination of what is unreal, duality does not exist.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis kyis stong par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis kyis stong par mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, the imagination of what is unreal is seen as empty of duality.

original: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni yod pa de 'di la lhag ma gang yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'di la lhag ma gang yin pa de ni yod pa de 'di la lhag ma gang yin zhe na //
translated: What remains here? That which remains here is real. What remains here?

original: yang dag ma yin pa kun rtog pa stong pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga yang 'dir yod par ma skur ba dang / sgro btags pa med par mthong na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po @196a * //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin pa kun rtog pa stong pa nyid dang / de gnyi ga yang 'dir yod par ma skur ba dang / sgro btags pa med par mthong na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po @196a * //
translated: If one sees both the imagination of what is unreal and emptiness as not existent and not nonexistent, then one sees reality as it is.

original: med par mthong ba'i phyir sgro mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: med par mthong ba'i phyir sgro mi 'dogs so //
translated: In this regard, one does not falsely impute the non-existence of the duality in the imagination of what is unreal.🔽One does not deprecate the existence of the imagination of what is unreal and emptiness.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang stong pa nyid yod par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang stong pa nyid yod par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: For, on the one hand, one sees the existence of the imagination of what is unreal and emptiness, and, on the other hand, one sees that the imagination of what is unreal is empty of the duality.

original: skur pa mi 'debs te /🔽stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yod pa dang gang gis stong pa de de la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skur pa mi 'debs te / stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yod pa dang gang gis stong pa de de la med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, one does not deprecate.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is taught without error, since emptiness is the non-existence of that in this.

original: thams cad med pa'am thams cad yod pa ni stong pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: thams cad med pa'am thams cad yod pa ni stong pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid phyin ci log yin te /
translated: If everything were non-existent or existent, emptiness would be a false characteristic.

original: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Emptiness would not exist.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba med na stong pa nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba med na stong pa nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: If what is called emptiness does not exist, emptiness is not tenable,

original: chos nyid ni dngos po la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos nyid ni dngos po la rag lus pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because reality depends on things, like impermanence and so on.

original: gnyis po yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis po yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say both exist,

original: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: emptiness would not exist.🔽If you say both exist, emptiness would not exist, because the nonexistence of the duality is emptiness.

original: gal te gnyis po ni ri bong gi ra dang 'dren yang ji ltar des yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa stong ste /
analyzed: gal te gnyis po ni ri bong gi ra dang 'dren yang ji ltar des yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa stong ste /
translated: If you say the duality is like the horns of a rabbit and does not exist, how could the imagination of what is unreal be empty of that?

original: dper na dge slong rnams kyis gtsug lag khang bzhin du gzhan gyis gzhan stong par mthong zhe na ;
analyzed: dper na dge slong rnams kyis gtsug lag khang bzhin du gzhan gyis gzhan stong par mthong zhe na ;
translated: If you say that like monks seeing a temple, others see emptiness in that,

original: dper na thag pa la'am sgyu ma la bdag nyid kyis med par sbrul gyi rnam pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa lta bur snang ba de la kha cig 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la'am sgyu ma la bdag nyid kyis med par sbrul gyi rnam pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa lta bur snang ba de la kha cig 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: just as a rope or an illusion appears as a snake or a person, though they do not exist by their own intrinsic reality, in order to stop some from grasping them as such,

original: sbrul dang skyes bu la sogs pas stong ngo zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sbrul dang skyes bu la sogs pas stong ngo zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: one says they are empty of a snake or a person.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la yang bdag nyid kyis med par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de la byis pa rnams 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa dor bar bya ba'i phyir gnyis kyis ston zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa la yang bdag nyid kyis med par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba de la byis pa rnams 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa dor bar bya ba'i phyir gnyis kyis ston zhes bshad do //
translated: Also, in order to abandon the grasping and attachment of the childish to the appearance of the apprehended and apprehender in the non-existent imagination of what is unreal, it is taught by means of the two.

original: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
translated: Not empty, not non-empty.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na /
translated: Why was this verse composed?

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad gnyis dang bral ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad gnyis dang bral ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to understand that all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are free from duality.

original: de ltar mtha' gcig bkag pas 'di thams cad stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin pa zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang nas bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gcig bkag pas 'di thams cad stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin pa zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang nas bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by refuting one extreme, it is understood that all of this is neither empty nor non-empty, demonstrating the intention explained in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: gzhan du na ltag 'og 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ltag 'og 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a contradiction between the earlier and later statements.

original: gzhan yang dbu ma'i lam rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbu ma'i lam rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is in order to fully demonstrate the middle way.

original: gzhan du na ni gcig tu stong pa kho na'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni gcig tu stong pa kho na'am /
translated: Otherwise, it would be empty in one sense only.

original: mi stong pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be empty in one way or it would be empty in every way.

original: yang na skur pa 'debs pa dang sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa bshad ma thag pa mjug bsdu ba'i don du de brtsams so //
analyzed: yang na skur pa 'debs pa dang sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa bshad ma thag pa mjug bsdu ba'i don du de brtsams so //
translated: Or else, it is composed in order to conclude the refutation of denial and reification, which has just been explained.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'brel pa las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'brel pa las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions,

original: @196b yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni 'dus byas te /
analyzed: @196b yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni 'dus byas te /
translated: the imagination of what is unreal is conditioned.

original: de la mi ltos pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Because it does not depend on that, emptiness is unconditioned.

original: bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The explanation is found in the Perfection of Wisdom and other scriptures.

original: yod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ste /
translated: Because it exists, means the imagination of what is unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dus byas stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dus byas stong pa ma yin no //
translated: The conditioned is not empty of the nature of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: med pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis po ste /
analyzed: med pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis po ste /
translated: Because it does not exist, means the duality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty of the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: stong pa nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la de'i chos nyid du yod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la de'i chos nyid du yod de /
translated: Emptiness exists in the imagination of what is unreal as its reality.

original: stong pa nyid la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa chos can gyi ngo bor yod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa chos can gyi ngo bor yod do //
translated: And the imagination of what is unreal exists in emptiness as the entity of the reality of the former.

original: de ltar 'dus ma byas kyang chos nyid kyi ngo bos stong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dus ma byas kyang chos nyid kyi ngo bos stong pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the unconditioned is not empty of the entity of reality.

original: dngos po med ces bya ba gnyis kyi ngo bos stong pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya ba gnyis kyi ngo bos stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty of the entity of the duality that is said to be non-existent.

original: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa'i nang nas /
translated: This is the middle path, as stated in the Ratnakuṭa and other sūtras:

original: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
translated: Kāśyapa, existence is one extreme.

original: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis te /
analyzed: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis te /
translated: Nonexistence is a second extreme.

original: 'od srungs mtha' gnyis po 'di dag gi dbus gang yin pa 'di ni chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa'o zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs mtha' gnyis po 'di dag gi dbus gang yin pa 'di ni chos rnams la yang dag par so sor rtog pa'o zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, the middle that is the middle between these two extremes is not observed.

original: de ltar dbu ma'i lam de dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma'i lam de dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is in accordance with the middle path.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: “Everything” refers to the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: gcig tu stong pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig tu stong pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not empty of one thing” means

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog dang / de la stong pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog dang / de la stong pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the imagination of what is unreal and emptiness exist there.

original: gcig tu mi stong pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mi stong pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not non-empty of one thing” means that the duality does not exist there.

original: thams cad yod pa'am thams cad med pa ni mtha' nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad yod pa'am thams cad med pa ni mtha' nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If everything existed or if everything did not exist, that would be an extreme,

original: dbu ma'i lam ma yin no //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam ma yin no //
translated: but not the middle way.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid brjod nas zhes bya ba 'di /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid brjod nas zhes bya ba 'di /
translated: Thus, having described the characteristic of the existence and the characteristic of the non-existence of the imagination of what is unreal, he now says:

original: yod par nye bar mtshon pas yod pa nyid /
analyzed: yod par nye bar mtshon pas yod pa nyid /
translated: The existence of the imagination of what is unreal is indicated by the word “existence.”

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of existence is🔽the existence of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod ces bya ba des yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod par ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod ces bya ba des yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod par ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the words “the existence of the imagination of what is unreal,” he shows the existence of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de bzhin du med par nye bar mtshon pas med pa nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du med par nye bar mtshon pas med pa nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Likewise, non-existence is the characteristic of non-existence, because it is indicated as non-existence.

original: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa ste /🔽'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po med @197a * //
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa ste / 'di ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis po med @197a * //
translated: Moreover, it is the non-existence of the entities of the grasped and grasper.

original: pas de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pas de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since duality does not exist in imagination of what is unreal, therefore, imagination of what is unreal also does not exist in the nature of duality.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod de zhes bya ba la yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod de zhes bya ba la yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: The statement, “having stated its own characteristic,” is made because there is a difference between the characteristic of existence and the characteristic of its own nature.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i'o //
translated: The characteristic of existence is general.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni bye brag yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni bye brag yin no //
translated: The characteristic of its own nature is specific.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid ma bshad na ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid ma bshad na ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic of its own nature is not explained, what will happen?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i lus ma bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i lus ma bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: The body of imagination of what is unreal will not be explained.

original: de bas na de'i lus khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de'i lus khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand its body,

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness of the appearance of objects, sentient beings, and self

original: rab tu skye'o de'i don med //
analyzed: rab tu skye'o de'i don med //
translated: arises, but those objects do not exist.

original: de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med //
translated: Because they do not exist, that also does not exist.

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //🔽yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam nyid yod do zhes bstan pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam de la /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so // yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam nyid yod do zhes bstan pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam de la /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Or else, in order to demonstrate that the mere non-existence of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal, exists, and in order to show that the imagination of what is unreal is merely the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: dbang po dang yul dang / rnam par shes pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa mi shes pas yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i snang ba tha dad pa de la rnam par gzhag go zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang / rnam par shes pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa mi shes pas yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i snang ba tha dad pa de la rnam par gzhag go zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, the imagination of what is unreal is established as the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bshad de /🔽don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bshad de /🔽don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that the imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject

original: / yang na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod ces bya ba des de yod pa tsam du shes par byed kyi /
analyzed: / yang na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod ces bya ba des de yod pa tsam du shes par byed kyi /
translated: Or else, the statement “The imagination of what is unreal exists” indicates that it exists merely as such,

original: de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin pa dang gnyis po med par yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu gang yin pa rnam par mi shes pa dang / gang gi phyir gnyis po med par yid ches par bya ba de yang ma bshad pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin pa dang gnyis po med par yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu gang yin pa rnam par mi shes pa dang / gang gi phyir gnyis po med par yid ches par bya ba de yang ma bshad pas de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but not its nature. And since the cause of the adherence to the grasped and grasper in the absence of duality has not been explained, in order to demonstrate that cause, the root text states:

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The appearance of objects, sentient beings, and the self is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In this regard, the imagination of what is unreal is the nature of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par dgongs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang 'dir mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par dgongs te /
translated: And that consciousness is intended here as being associated with mental factors.

original: gtso bor ni rnam par shes pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: gtso bor ni rnam par shes pa gzung ngo //
translated: But consciousness is the primary factor.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa de nyid kyi rgyu ni don dang sems can la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa de nyid kyi rgyu ni don dang sems can la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: The cause of that very adherence to the grasped and the grasper is the appearance as objects, sentient beings, etc.

original: de'i don med de med pas na de yang med ces bya ba ni gnyis po med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i don med de med pas na de yang med ces bya ba ni gnyis po med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The meaning of that is non-existent, and because of non-existence, that also is non-existent. This is the cause of the non-existence of duality.

original: de la don dang sems can du @197b snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dang sems can du @197b snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Therein, the appearance as objects and sentient beings is the store-consciousness together with its associates.

original: de yang rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is indeterminate because it is the maturation.

original: bdag tu snang ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu snang ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The appearance as self is the afflicted mind together with its associates.

original: de yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is obscured and indeterminate.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: It is obscured because it is associated with moral defilement.

original: rnam par rig par snang ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig par snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance as representations is the six consciousnesses together with their associates.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la sogs pa drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la sogs pa drug po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses of the eye, etc., together with their associated mental factors, are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: don dang sems can dang bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba rnam par shes pa brgyad po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa de dag ni kun 'byung ba'i bden par bsdus pa /
analyzed: don dang sems can dang bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba rnam par shes pa brgyad po mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa de dag ni kun 'byung ba'i bden par bsdus pa /
translated: The eight consciousnesses, together with their associated mental factors, which appear as objects, sentient beings, the self, and representations, are included in the truth of origination.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ji ltar mthun mthun du 'gro ba lnga rnams su rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las ji ltar mthun mthun du 'gro ba lnga rnams su rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: They occur in the five realms in accordance with their similarity to the store consciousness, which is dependent on its causal conditions.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyis bag chags 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyis bag chags 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: The store consciousness has certain special transformations of its habitual tendencies that are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: de dbang gis phan tshun tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: de dbang gis phan tshun tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rab tu skye'o //
translated: Consciousness that appears as different things is born from the power of those habitual tendencies.

original: don la sogs pa med pa der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar skye ste /
analyzed: don la sogs pa med pa der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar skye ste /
translated: How can consciousness arise in the absence of objects, etc.?

original: mi med na sdong po mi snang bar mi 'gyur ba lta ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: mi med na sdong po mi snang bar mi 'gyur ba lta ba'o zhe na /
translated: If there are no people, trees do not appear.

original: de ni nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault.

original: don la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la byas pa rnam par shes pa las don gud na yod par mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: don la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa la byas pa rnam par shes pa las don gud na yod par mngon par zhen te /
translated: One imagines that objects, etc., exist apart from consciousness, because consciousness appears as objects, etc.

original: rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the appearance of floating hairs, etc., to one who has eye disease.

original: de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that imagination,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don la sogs par snang bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di nyid don la sogs par snang bar 'byung ste /
translated: we say that consciousness itself appears as objects, etc.,

original: rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba de bzhin du med par yang don dang / sems can la sogs par snang ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba de bzhin du med par yang don dang / sems can la sogs par snang ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: just as the appearance of floating hairs, etc., to one who has eye disease does not exist as it appears, so the appearance of objects, sentient beings, etc.,

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi dngos po can /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi dngos po can /
translated: Thus, we say that consciousness has eight real entities.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The other-dependent is explained as the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos kyi ngo bor snang ba ni de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽sems can du snang ba'i dbang po lngar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gang @198a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / chos kyi ngo bor snang ba ni de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro // sems can du snang ba'i dbang po lngar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gang @198a * //
translated: The appearance as entities such as form, etc. is the appearance as the entities of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and the dharmas, because it arises in their aspect.

original: yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽snang ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni / snang ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The appearance as sentient beings is the five sense faculties in the continuum of oneself and others.

original: dbang po lnga la sems can zhes bya bar lhag par chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa ste /🔽de dag gis sam /
analyzed: dbang po lnga la sems can zhes bya bar lhag par chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa ste / de dag gis sam /
translated: The five sense faculties are the basis of the attachment to sentient beings.

original: de dag la chags pas sems can te /🔽de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag la chags pas sems can te / de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: By them or through attachment to them, there are sentient beings.

original: de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it arises in their aspect, it is called the consciousness that appears as those.

original: bdag tu snang ba zhes bya ba dang / bdag tu snang ba ni bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu snang ba zhes bya ba dang / bdag tu snang ba ni bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The appearance as self is the afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de dag kyang bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bdag tu snang bar rigs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de dag kyang bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bdag tu snang bar rigs so //
translated: The afflicted mind is always associated with delusion about self, view of self, attachment to self, pride in self, and ignorance. Since they all apprehend a self, it is reasonable that the afflicted mind is the appearance as self.🔽The appearance as representations is the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam par rig par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa drug rnams so zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang bas de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rig par snang ba ni rnam par shes pa drug rnams so zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang bas de'i rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa snang ngo //
translated: The appearance as representations is the six consciousnesses because they appear in the aspect of apprehending objects.

original: de'i don med ces bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi char gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i don med ces bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi char gyi'o //
translated: The meaning of that does not exist is that it does not exist in any of the four ways.

original: don dang sems can du snang ba rnam pa med pa dang / bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba ni log par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dang sems can du snang ba gnyis gzung ba'i ngo bor snang bas /
analyzed: don dang sems can du snang ba rnam pa med pa dang / bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba ni log par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dang sems can du snang ba gnyis gzung ba'i ngo bor snang bas /
translated: The two appearances as objects and sentient beings appear as the apprehended entity.

original: log par snang ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log par snang ba mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Since a false appearance is impossible,

original: rnam pa med pa nyid ni don med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid ni don med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the absence of aspects is the cause of the nonexistence of objects.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang bas rnam pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang bas rnam pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Others say that the other two are not devoid of aspects because they appear as the apprehending entity.

original: log par snang ba nyid ni don med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: log par snang ba nyid ni don med pa'i rgyu'o zhes bshad do //
translated: A false appearance is the cause of the nonexistence of objects.

original: rnam pa ni dmigs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam pa ni dmigs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin na /
translated: An aspect is the mode of apprehending an object as impermanent and so on.

original: de yang de dag la med de /
analyzed: de yang de dag la med de /
translated: That also does not exist for those two.

original: gzung ba'i ngo bor snang bas de'i phyir rnam pa med pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba'i ngo bor snang bas de'i phyir rnam pa med pa ni 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore the absence of aspects is not the apprehender.

original: yang na dmigs pa yang dag par tshor ba la rnam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa yang dag par tshor ba la rnam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or an aspect is called the correct feeling of an object.

original: de yang de dag la med pas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa med do //
analyzed: de yang de dag la med pas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa med do //
translated: Since they do not exist in that way, there is no object, and therefore no aspect.

original: gal te gnyis ka yang rnam pa med pa dang / phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka yang rnam pa med pa dang / phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: If both are without aspect, they are different from each other in nature,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like form and eye consciousness.

original: de lta yin na ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las grags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las grags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod na /
translated: If that were so, what is the difference in nature between consciousness and form, etc., and eye, etc., as they are known in the world and in the treatises?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni @198b gsal la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni @198b gsal la /
translated: In that case, they are clear,

original: de dag dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa ni yongs su bzung zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa ni yongs su bzung zhe na /
translated: and consciousness, which is not a different nature from them, is apprehended.

original: de las lhag pa'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no other meaning than that, it is not so.

original: de ni 'di ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i don gyi ngo bo med kyang sems kyi rgyud so sor nges pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa'i don gyi ngo bo med kyang sems kyi rgyud so sor nges pas /
translated: Although there is no different object nature, the mind stream is individually ascertained.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid so sos zin pa tha dad pa'i don la sogs par snang bar rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid so sos zin pa tha dad pa'i don la sogs par snang bar rang gi sa bon las rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: Consciousness itself arises from its own seeds to appear as the separate objects that are grasped by the different sense faculties.

original: 'di ltar yi dags rnams kyis chu rnag dang phyi sa dang / gcin la sogs pas gang ba dang / skyes bu la gan dbyig pa thogs pa rnams kyis dogs gnyis bsrung bar mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi dags rnams kyis chu rnag dang phyi sa dang / gcin la sogs pas gang ba dang / skyes bu la gan dbyig pa thogs pa rnams kyis dogs gnyis bsrung bar mthong la /
translated: In this way, hungry ghosts see a river filled with pus, urine, and excrement, and they see armed men guarding the banks.

original: mi la sogs pas ni chu dang ba dang bsil ba dang bkrur rung ba dang btung du rung ba dang / 'jug tu rung bas gang zhig bgegs byed pa med par shes so //🔽rnal 'byor pa mi sdug pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa goms pas ni /
analyzed: mi la sogs pas ni chu dang ba dang bsil ba dang bkrur rung ba dang btung du rung ba dang / 'jug tu rung bas gang zhig bgegs byed pa med par shes so // rnal 'byor pa mi sdug pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa goms pas ni /
translated: Humans and so on see it as filled with clear, cool, clean water that is suitable for drinking and bathing and they know that it is not obstructed.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par sa la keng rus kyis gang bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par sa la keng rus kyis gang bar mthong ngo //
translated: Yogis and yoginis who are familiar with meditation on repulsiveness see the ground covered with skeletons.

original: de bzhin du sa la sogs pa zad par la thams cad sa la sogs pas khyab par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la sogs pa zad par la thams cad sa la sogs pas khyab par mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, in the meditative absorption of the totality of earth, they see the entire world pervaded by earth.

original: don la rag las te bdag nyid thob pa ni don med par ram /
analyzed: don la rag las te bdag nyid thob pa ni don med par ram /
translated: The object is the basis for the attainment of the self.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for a consciousness to arise with the aspect of a different object.

original: de bas na don med par yang don dang sems can la sogs pa thams cad du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de bas na don med par yang don dang sems can la sogs pa thams cad du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that consciousness itself appears as all objects, sentient beings, and so on, even though they do not exist.

original: gzung ba med par bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba gnyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bas log par snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba med par bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba gnyis 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang bas log par snang ba nyid do //
translated: Without an object, the appearance of the apprehender appears as the appearance of the self and representations.

original: yang na ji ltar rnam par shes pas don yongs su brtags pa de bzhin du bdag dang rnam par rig par don med de stag la sogs pa thob pa ltar /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rnam par shes pas don yongs su brtags pa de bzhin du bdag dang rnam par rig par don med de stag la sogs pa thob pa ltar /
translated: Or, just as an object is imputed by consciousness, so too the self and representations are meaningless, like the apprehension of a tiger and so on.

original: log par dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log par dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are wrongly apprehended,

original: log par snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: log par snang ba nyid do //
translated: they are mere appearances.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa yang rnam par rig pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa yang rnam par rig pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus the treatise declares: “Consciousness is also empty of the imaginary nature imputed by other consciousnesses.”

original: de'i phyir don dang sems can du snang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang sems can du snang ba bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as objects and sentient beings appear,

original: bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba'i don yang med do //
analyzed: bdag dang rnam par rig par snang ba'i don yang med do //
translated: the appearance of a self and representations also do not exist.

original: don med pas rnam par shes pa de yang med do //
analyzed: don med pas rnam par shes pa de yang med do //
translated: Since objects do not exist, consciousness also does not exist.

original: rnam par rig pas na rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pas na rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is a representation.

original: de yang gzung ba med na rnam par shes pa por mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba med na rnam par shes pa por mi rigs te /
translated: If there is no object, it is not reasonable that there is a consciousness.

original: de lta bas na don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa kho nar rnam par shes pa med kyi @199a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa kho nar rnam par shes pa med kyi @199a * //
translated: Therefore, because objects do not exist, consciousness does not exist as consciousness.

original: don dang sems can dang bdag dang rnam par rig par snang bas na med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang sems can dang bdag dang rnam par rig par snang bas na med pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the case that consciousness does not exist because sentient beings, a self, and representations appear.

original: de med du zin na de ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma bstan pa'i phyir ye med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na de ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma bstan pa'i phyir ye med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, it would follow that it is utterly nonexistent because it is not taught that consciousness has a nature that is other than that.

original: de dang tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni de ji ltar rnam par shes par rung /
analyzed: de dang tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni de ji ltar rnam par shes par rung /
translated: If it has a nature that is different from that, how could it be consciousness?

original: ji ltar phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be different from that?

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni med la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yod pas /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni med la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yod pas /
translated: Thus, the apprehended and the apprehender do not exist, but the consciousness that appears as those does exist.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni yod /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni yod /
translated: Therefore, the imagination of what is unreal exists.🔽The two do not exist there. The former thesis is established.

original: gnyis po ni de na yod pa ma yin par sngar dam bcas pa de grub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis po ni de na yod pa ma yin par sngar dam bcas pa de grub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate this, he says:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: de ni de phyir grub pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni de phyir grub pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: is therefore established.

original: rnam par shes pa bzhi po de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhi po de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa grub pa yin no //
translated: The four consciousnesses are established as the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu de'i phyir te /
translated: “Therefore” means for that reason, which has just been explained.

original: don med pas na de yang med ces bya'o //
analyzed: don med pas na de yang med ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is meaningless, it is said to be nonexistent.

original: yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod par bsgrub pa dang / gnyis po med par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod par bsgrub pa dang / gnyis po med par rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the existence of the imagination of what is unreal and to establish the nonexistence of the two, he says:

original: de bzhin ma yin ye med min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin ma yin ye med min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is not like that, nor is it utterly nonexistent.

original: yang na de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, “for that reason” refers to what will be stated below.

original: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de bzhin ma yin ye med min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin ma yin ye med min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is not like that, nor is it utterly nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa dang ye med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa dang ye med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in that way, nor is it utterly nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba de skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba de skye ba ste /
translated: Because the appearance of the apprehended object and apprehending subject arises,

original: de la rnam pa bzhi po de yang rnam pa med pa dang / log par snang ba'i phyir ji ltar mthun par 'dzin pa nyid du med do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi po de yang rnam pa med pa dang / log par snang ba'i phyir ji ltar mthun par 'dzin pa nyid du med do //
translated: and because that is fourfold, it does not exist as the apprehended object and apprehending subject, as is fitting, since it is devoid of aspects and appears erroneously.

original: rnam par rig pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis thams cad stong bas gzung ba nyid du med do //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis thams cad stong bas gzung ba nyid du med do //
translated: Since everything is empty of the imagined nature through the other-dependent cognition, it does not exist as the apprehended object.

original: 'khrul pa tsam 'byung ba'i phyir ye med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis med kyang /
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam 'byung ba'i phyir ye med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis med kyang /
translated: It is not utterly nonexistent, because the occurrence of mere error exists.

original: rnam par snang ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which appears as the error is called “error.”

original: sgyu ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like an illusion.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las lhag ma rnam bar gcad pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de las lhag ma rnam bar gcad pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The word “only” means that the rest are excluded.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa yod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa yod do //
translated: This is what is being said: “There is a consciousness that is mistaken.

original: ye med pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye med pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not utterly nonexistent.”

original: 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa bzhin du med pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rnam par shes pa de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa bzhin du med pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not assert that mistaken consciousness does not exist in the way that it appears, i.e., as an object that is either real or unreal?

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul las @199b 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul las @199b 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is beyond the scope of all consciousnesses,

original: sus kyang de yod pa nyid du brtag par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o zhe na 'di ltar /🔽de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: sus kyang de yod pa nyid du brtag par mi nus so zhes bsams pa'o zhe na 'di ltar / de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
translated: no one can conceive of its existence.

original: de'i phyir de med pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de med pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: But we do not assert that it does not exist,🔽because we believe that one is liberated through the exhaustion of that.

original: de ji lta zhe na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi mthus de yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi mthus de yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: How is that? We infer its existence through the power of the factors of affliction and purification.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te ye med pa nyid du 'dod na ni bcings pa yang med ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te ye med pa nyid du 'dod na ni bcings pa yang med ces bya ste /
translated: Otherwise, if one asserts that it is utterly nonexistent, then there is no bondage.

original: 'khrul pa tsam yang med du zin na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam yang med du zin na /
translated: If even mere error did not exist,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas bcings pa yang med do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas bcings pa yang med do //
translated: then there would be no affliction and thus no bondage.

original: sngar bcings pa las grol lo zhes bya na grol ba yang med par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngar bcings pa las grol lo zhes bya na grol ba yang med par 'gyur /
translated: If one were previously bound and then liberated, then there would be no liberation.

original: yang na de ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa'am /
analyzed: yang na de ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod pa'am /
translated: Or else, why not assert that it exists as it appears,🔽or that it is utterly nonexistent?

original: yang na ye med par ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces gzhan de snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir /🔽de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: yang na ye med par ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces gzhan de snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir / de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
translated: In order to dispel the thought of others,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: it is said:🔽When that is extinguished, one is liberated.

original: de ma zad na bcings pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ma zad na bcings pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that is not extinguished, then it is said that one is bound.

original: de gzhan du na bcings pa dang grol ba med do zhes de skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gzhan du na bcings pa dang grol ba med do zhes de skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if one were to say that there is no bondage and no liberation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one would incur the fault of denying affliction and nirvana.

original: gal te ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du phyugs yan chad la snang ba yang gal te de bzhin du don dam par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du phyugs yan chad la snang ba yang gal te de bzhin du don dam par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If what appears as the grasped and grasper to even cattle were to be ultimate in that way,

original: de ltar yin du zin na rtag par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin na rtag par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: then, if that were the case, there would be perpetual affliction.

original: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be no nirvana.

original: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam med na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa tsam med na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: And if there were no mere error in that way, there would be no affliction.

original: rtag tu rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be perpetual purification.

original: de ltar na gnyi gar yang thar pa tshol ba rnams kyi 'bad pa don med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod pa dang gnyis po med par gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi gar yang thar pa tshol ba rnams kyi 'bad pa don med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod pa dang gnyis po med par gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: In that way, since both would be pointless for those seeking liberation, therefore one should undoubtedly accept the existence of the imagination of what is unreal and the non-existence of duality.

original: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ston te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ston te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of inclusion is taught.

original: bsdu ba nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsdu ba nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: Inclusion itself is the characteristic.

original: yang na gang gis bsdu bar mtshon pa de bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na gang gis bsdu bar mtshon pa de bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Or, that by which inclusion is indicated is the characteristic of inclusion.

original: de yang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'dir ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang brla ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam nyid yod do zhes smras la /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang brla ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam nyid yod do zhes smras la /
translated: Here, it is said that the imagination of what is unreal, which is the duality of the apprehended and the apprehending, exists.

original: mdo gzhan dag las ni /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las ni /
translated: But in other sūtras, the three natures are taught.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum gsungs pas mdo dag dang mi 'gal bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de dag 'dir bsdu bar brjod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum gsungs pas mdo dag dang mi 'gal bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de dag 'dir bsdu bar brjod de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no contradiction with those sūtras, it is said that they are included here.

original: de lta bas na 'grel pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'grel pa mdzad pas /
translated: Thus, the author of the commentary says:

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun @200a * //🔽rtog pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun @200a * // rtog pa tsam du zad na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: If it is just the imagination of what is unreal,🔽and so on.

original: brtag pa dang ni gzhan dbang dang // yongs su grub pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: brtag pa dang ni gzhan dbang dang // yongs su grub pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: don phyir yang dag min rtog phyir //🔽gnyis po med pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: don phyir yang dag min rtog phyir // gnyis po med pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: Because of the object, because of the imagination of what is unreal,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and because of the non-existence of the duality, it is explained.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa las yang dag pa ma yin par yang yod par yongs su rtog pas kun brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pa las yang dag pa ma yin par yang yod par yongs su rtog pas kun brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the emptiness of the apprehended and the apprehending, the imagination of what is unreal is said to be the imagined.

original: de ni rdzas su med kyang tha snyad du yod pas ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzas su med kyang tha snyad du yod pas ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Although it does not exist substantially, it is called “reality” because it exists conventionally.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye bas gzhan gyi kha na las pa'o //🔽smras pa / brtags min rkyen las skyes pa dang // rnam pa kun tu brjod med pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye bas gzhan gyi kha na las pa'o // smras pa / brtags min rkyen las skyes pa dang // rnam pa kun tu brjod med pa //
translated: The other-dependent is called “other-powered” because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions.🔽It is said:🔽The other-dependent reality🔽is not imagined, arises from conditions,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: and is inexpressible in every way.

original: 'jig rten pa yi spyod yul lo //🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid gnyis dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi spyod yul lo // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid gnyis dang bral ba nyid gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is the domain of mundane experience.🔽The perfected reality is the absence of duality in the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas pas mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas pas mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Since it is uncompounded, it is perfected and unchanging.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te //
translated: It is the imagined reality.

original: shin tu stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: shin tu stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: The emptiness of that

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ste //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ste //
translated: is the perfected reality,

original: mi rtog ye shes spyod yul lo //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes spyod yul lo //
translated: the domain of nonconceptual gnosis.

original: don phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: don phyir zhes bya ba ni don gyi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa ste /
translated: “For the sake of the meaning” means that the explanation is given in terms of the import.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i phyir dang gnyis po med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i phyir dang gnyis po med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be said that the imagined nature is due to the imagination of what is unreal, and due to the non-existence of the duality.

original: don ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya la /
analyzed: don ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya la /
translated: The meaning is the imagined nature.

original: don ni 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / bdag dang rnam par rig pa rnams te /
analyzed: don ni 'dir gzugs la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa dang / bdag dang rnam par rig pa rnams te /
translated: The meaning here is form, etc., the eyes, etc., the self, and the representations.

original: de yang rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la med pas /
analyzed: de yang rnam par brtags pa'i rang bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la med pas /
translated: Since that imagined nature does not exist in the imagination of what is unreal, which is the imagined nature,

original: med pa la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: med pa la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: it is said to be the imagined nature in the non-existence.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.

original: rnam rtog rnam par mi rtog ni //🔽rnam rtog gzhan gyis brtags pa ste //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam par mi rtog ni // rnam rtog gzhan gyis brtags pa ste //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.

original: rnam rtog gzhan gyis brtags de yi //
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan gyis brtags de yi //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.

original: rang bzhin de ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin de ni yod ma yin //
translated: The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is unreal is the imagined nature.🔽The nature of that imagination of what is unreal is the perfected nature.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag gi dbang byed pa dang / skyed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba la rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag gi dbang byed pa dang / skyed pa ste /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the dependent nature.🔽The imagination of what is

original: rang mi 'byung bas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //🔽gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang mi 'byung bas gzhan gyi dbang ngo // gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it does not arise by itself, it is dependent on other things.🔽The absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is called the perfected nature. It is perfected because it is perfected as unchanging and because it is perfected as unmistaken.

original: yongs su grub pa pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called perfected because it is perfected as unchanging and because it is perfected as unmistaken.

original: @200b 'dir ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @200b 'dir ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is taught as the freedom from the duality of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gnyis po med pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po med pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the mere absence of duality.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi kha na las pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi kha na las pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Thus, the imagination of what is unreal is dependent on other things because it arises from causes and conditions that are other than itself.

original: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor bdag nyid kyis med kyang snang ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor bdag nyid kyis med kyang snang ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'o //
translated: It is imagined because it appears as the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, although it does not exist by itself.

original: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: It is the perfected because it is free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la ngo bo nyid gsum 'dus so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la ngo bo nyid gsum 'dus so //
translated: Thus, the three realities are included in the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ltar byas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba mngon du bya ba'i dngos po yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba mngon du bya ba'i dngos po yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the imagination of what is unreal is taught as the thing to be understood, the thing to be abandoned, and the thing to be manifested as understood.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristic of the nonexistence of the imagination of what is unreal is not understood,

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par gyur to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par gyur to //
translated: there is the defilement of passion, action, and birth.

original: de lta bas na med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang / de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dmigs pa la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang / de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir / dmigs pa la ni brten nas su //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the understanding of the characteristic of nonexistence and the means to that end,

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: it is said: “Dependent on the imagination of what is unreal,🔽there is the imagination of the self-existence of the grasped and the grasper.🔽”

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa la de mtshon pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog pa la de mtshon pa'am /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the illustration of that.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa nyid ni med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med pa nyid ni med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nonexistence of the duality of the grasped and grasper is the characteristic of unreality.

original: de la 'jug pa ni de khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni de khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The entry into that is the understanding of that.

original: de'i thabs ni thabs gang gis de'i med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni thabs gang gis de'i med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The means for that is the means by which one enters into that characteristic of unreality.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don rab tu rtog par bya bar sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don rab tu rtog par bya bar sbyor ba ni /
translated: Moreover, the application to the thorough understanding of the meaning of the omnipresence of the dharma-dhātu

original: gnas kyi khyad par mkhas par rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gnas kyi khyad par mkhas par rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: is the expertise in the distinctions of the bases.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: This verse was spoken in order to illustrate that.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pa la brten nas don mi dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pa la brten nas don mi dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of objects is produced in dependence upon the apprehension of representation-only.

original: dmigs pa'i don dang bral ba 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i don dang bral ba 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de /
translated: This absence of the apprehended object is representation-only.

original: rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness arises in the appearance of form, etc., from the complete maturation of its own seeds.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin pa dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin pa dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: as existent is the objective support.

original: gzung ba mi dmigs par rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: gzung ba mi dmigs par rab tu 'jug go //
translated: The non-apprehension of the object is the entry.

original: des 'di ltar brtags par bya ste /🔽rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshe'am /
analyzed: des 'di ltar brtags par bya ste / rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshe'am /
translated: One should investigate this as follows:🔽When consciousness arises,

original: skye sa zin pas yul la dmigs @201a * //🔽par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: skye sa zin pas yul la dmigs @201a * // par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or when it has already arisen, does it have an objective support?

original: de la skye ba'i tshe ni med pas skye ba'i tshe yul la dmigs par mi rung ngo //🔽yul du snang ba'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i tshe ni med pas skye ba'i tshe yul la dmigs par mi rung ngo // yul du snang ba'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is when it arises, then it is not tenable that consciousness has an objective support at the time of its arising, because it does not exist at that time.

original: skyes pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it when it has already arisen, because it arises in the aspect of the object.

original: yul du snang ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba ma gtogs par /
analyzed: yul du snang ba'i bdag nyid du skye ba ma gtogs par /
translated: Apart from the arising in the aspect of the object,

original: gang byed na rnam par shes pa yul la dmigs pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba gzhan med do //
