analyzed: gang byed na rnam par shes pa yul la dmigs pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba gzhan med do //
translated: there is no other activity of consciousness that one could say is consciousness having an objective support.

original: gal te yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi dmigs pa byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi dmigs pa byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the present consciousness is the objective support,

original: skye ba'i tshe ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not the one that is arising,

original: de lta na ni dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par shes pa'i skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par shes pa'i skye ba ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the object condition is not the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: der yongs su rtog pa don med do //
analyzed: der yongs su rtog pa don med do //
translated: It is pointless to imagine that it is.

original: da ltar gyi dmigs pa 'dzin na ni skad cig pa 'jig pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dmigs pa 'dzin na ni skad cig pa 'jig pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the present object is grasped, it would be damaged by the momentary destruction.

original: rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa yang med pas snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa yang med pas snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Since there is no change in the nature of the object, it is as before.

original: rnam par shes pas dmigs pa 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas dmigs pa 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that consciousness grasps the object.

original: 'on te dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na /🔽de la rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i dus na / de la rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that at the time of grasping the object,🔽the nature of the object changes,

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa gzhan nyid du snang bas /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa gzhan nyid du snang bas /
translated: then in that case, since the change in the nature of the object appears as another,

original: byung ba gzhan nyid kyis dmigs pa 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung ba gzhan nyid kyis dmigs pa 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that another arising grasps the object.

original: gzhan ni 'gag pa'i tshe'i don nyid skye ba'i tshe'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'gag pa'i tshe'i don nyid skye ba'i tshe'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid yin te /
translated: But another object at the time of cessation is not the object condition of consciousness at the time of arising.

original: de yang rang gi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pas rkyen lhag ma rnams las khyad par can no snyam du sems te /🔽des kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bam /
analyzed: de yang rang gi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pas rkyen lhag ma rnams las khyad par can no snyam du sems te / des kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab bam /
translated: Since it is the cause of consciousness appearing as form, it is distinct from the remaining conditions.🔽But if you imagine that it is the object of observation of the mind that observes form, etc.,

original: de 'dus pa la dmigs pa kho nar kun tu brtag grang na /
analyzed: de 'dus pa la dmigs pa kho nar kun tu brtag grang na /
translated: either the subtle particle or the aggregation of those,

original: de gnyi ga yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then neither of those two is the object of observation.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par snang ba 'byung gi / rdul phra rab tu snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par snang ba 'byung gi / rdul phra rab tu snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Because all consciousnesses arise appearing as a pot, cloth, etc., but not appearing as a subtle particle.

original: don gyi rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The object of observation of a consciousness to which an object appears in one way but is conceived in another way is not different from that object.

original: mig la sogs pa yang dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ta re /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ta re /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the eye, etc., would also be the object of observation.

original: gang gzhan yang rdul phra rab sil bu so so la dmigs pa yin pa snyam du sems pa de'i 'di yang lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan yang rdul phra rab sil bu so so la dmigs pa yin pa snyam du sems pa de'i 'di yang lan du mi rung ste /
translated: Also, it is not suitable to respond that the mind observes individual, discrete subtle particles,🔽because that is also illogical.

original: sil bu de ni de dag so so nyid la dmigs par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: sil bu de ni de dag so so nyid la dmigs par 'dod kyi /
translated: The latter is asserted to focus on each of those.🔽

original: de dag gi 'dus pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dus pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The individual atoms are the objects of the consciousnesses, not their collections.🔽The consciousnesses do not appear as the collections of the atoms.

original: der rdul phra rab so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni mi 'byung gi //
analyzed: der rdul phra rab so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni mi 'byung gi //
translated: The consciousnesses do not appear as the individual atoms.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi 'dus par snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi 'dus par snang ba ste /
translated: They appear as the collections of the atoms.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams la dmigs pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams la dmigs pa mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the atoms are not the objects of the consciousnesses.

original: @201b brtags par yod pa ni rgyur mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @201b brtags par yod pa ni rgyur mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: The imaginary objects are not possible as causes.

original: rdul phra rab 'dus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'dus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin na /
translated: The collections of atoms are not the objects of the consciousnesses.

original: de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen yang dag par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod de /
analyzed: de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen yang dag par shes pa'i rgyur 'dod de /
translated: The object-condition is accepted as the cause of the consciousnesses, like the immediately preceding condition and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'gag pa'i tshe yang dmigs pa'i rkyen du mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gag pa'i tshe yang dmigs pa'i rkyen du mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the object-condition is not possible at the time of cessation.

original: ji ste yang 'gag pa nyid dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ste yang 'gag pa nyid dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If cessation itself were the object,

original: de lta na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yul du 'gyur pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par grub po //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yul du 'gyur pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par grub po //
translated: then the past and future would be objects, and consciousness would be established as having no object even in dreams and so on.

original: la lan re rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la lan re rmi lam la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: And the consciousnesses of dreams and so on are not without objects, because they have signs as their objects.

original: mtshan ma ni don gyi gzugs brnyan te ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni don gyi gzugs brnyan te ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: A sign is an image of an object, and it is of the nature of a nonassociated compositional factor.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa don med pa la de'i mtshan ma mi rung ste /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa don med pa la de'i mtshan ma mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for a sign to be a nonexistent object,

original: bzhin la sogs pa med par de'i gzugs brnyan mi 'grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhin la sogs pa med par de'i gzugs brnyan mi 'grub pa bzhin no //
translated: just as it is not possible for a reflection to occur without the presence of a face or some other reflecting surface.

original: 'byung ba'i tshe'am byung zin pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang mtshan ma la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshe'am byung zin pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang mtshan ma la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is a sign the object of a consciousness that has already arisen or is in the process of arising,

original: med pa dang dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa dang dgag pa sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been shown that these are nonexistent and negated.

original: de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin mtshan mar mi rung bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin mtshan mar mi rung bas /
translated: Therefore, since it is not possible for a sign to be of the nature of a nonassociated compositional factor,

original: rnam par shes ba nyid don du snang ba don gyi gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes ba nyid don du snang ba don gyi gzugs brnyan te /
translated: the appearance of an object in consciousness is the image of an object.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is consciousness itself that must be accepted as the object.

original: rnam pa med na ni de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med na ni de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has no aspect, then the object and subject would not be ascertained.

original: gzhan ni thogs pa med pa'i gzugs nyid rmi lam dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mi sdug pa la sogs par dmigs pa'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan ni thogs pa med pa'i gzugs nyid rmi lam dang / rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mi sdug pa la sogs par dmigs pa'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Others think that unobstructed form itself is the object of the dream and the object of yogis’ perception of foul things and so on.

original: de'i yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: But since it has the nature of color, shape, and so on,

original: thogs pa med pa nyid dang yid 'ba' zhig gi yul du 'gal lo //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa nyid dang yid 'ba' zhig gi yul du 'gal lo //
translated: it is contradictory that it is unobstructed and the object of the mental faculty alone.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam ma gtogs par yang thogs pa med pa'i gzugs gzhan bstan bcos las mi bshad pas /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam ma gtogs par yang thogs pa med pa'i gzugs gzhan bstan bcos las mi bshad pas /
translated: Apart from mere nonindicative form, other unobstructed form is not explained in the treatises.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyang rtog pa tsam nyid do //🔽gzhan dag ni dmus long gi rmi lam na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyang rtog pa tsam nyid do // gzhan dag ni dmus long gi rmi lam na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore that is also mere conjecture.

original: don myong ba ni rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: don myong ba ni rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that the object of dream consciousness is the experience of an object because in a dream of a blind person, form such as blue is not apprehended.

original: dmus long gi rmi lam na gzugs mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: dmus long gi rmi lam na gzugs mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: But a blind person does not apprehend form in a dream.

original: brda mi shes pas ming rnam par mi shes pa'i phyir gzhan la bsnyad mi nus so //
analyzed: brda mi shes pas ming rnam par mi shes pa'i phyir gzhan la bsnyad mi nus so //
translated: Because it does not know the name, it cannot communicate to another.

original: @202a * // gal te yang myong ba nyid rmi lam du mthong na de lta na dmus long gis kyang gzugs mthong bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: @202a * // gal te yang myong ba nyid rmi lam du mthong na de lta na dmus long gis kyang gzugs mthong bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
translated: If you say that the experience itself is seen in a dream, then why do you not accept that even a man born blind sees forms?

original: des kyang tshe rabs snga ma dag la gzugs dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des kyang tshe rabs snga ma dag la gzugs dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Because he has perceived forms in previous lives.

original: de ltar gyi tshe la dmigs pa nyid rmi lam du snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi tshe la dmigs pa nyid rmi lam du snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But in that case, the object of the dream is not something perceived in this life.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'dzin par yang rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log par khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'dzin par yang rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log par khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between the perception of the past, future, and present, whether one is awake or asleep.

original: de lta bas na don myong ba de ni rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba ni kun rtog pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na don myong ba de ni rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa'i yul lo zhes bya ba ni kun rtog pa tsam nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the experience of the object is the object of the consciousness in a dream. This is mere imagination.

original: 'das pa yang med par yul med par rnam par shes pa nyid rmi lam du don du snang ba 'byung bar nges so //
analyzed: 'das pa yang med par yul med par rnam par shes pa nyid rmi lam du don du snang ba 'byung bar nges so //
translated: Even without an object, consciousness itself arises in a dream as the appearance of an object, even though the object does not exist.

original: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pas yul mi dmigs par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pas yul mi dmigs par bsgom mo //
translated: Thus, by observing mere representation, one cultivates the non-observation of the object.

original: don mi dmigs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of the non-observation of the object,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yang mi dmigs pa skye ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yang mi dmigs pa skye ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the non-observation of mere representation also arises.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na kun brtags pa'i gzung ba med pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi stobs kyis gzung ba med par 'jug pa de ltar gzung ba med pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rig pa tsam yang med par khong du chud
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa las phyi rol na kun brtags pa'i gzung ba med pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi stobs kyis gzung ba med par 'jug pa de ltar gzung ba med pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rig pa tsam yang med par khong du chud
translated: Just as, because of the absence of an imagined object external to consciousness, one enters into the non-existence of the object by the power of mere representation, so, by the power of the non-existence of the object, one understands the non-existence of mere representation.

original: do // gzung ba nyid la ltos te de 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: do // gzung ba nyid la ltos te de 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the latter is posited as the apprehender in dependence on the former.

original: gzung ba med na 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba med na 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
translated: If the object does not exist, the subject is not tenable.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag gi med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug gi //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo dag gi med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug gi //
translated: Thus, one enters into the characteristic of the non-existence of the imagined natures of the grasped and the grasper.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But one does not enter into the non-existence of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: ci'i phyir thog ma nyid du rnam par rig pa tsam nyid med par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thog ma nyid du rnam par rig pa tsam nyid med par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is it not established that mere representation does not exist from the very beginning?

original: 'dzin pa ni gzung ba la rag las pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba'i don med na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni gzung ba la rag las pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba'i don med na /
translated: Because grasping depends on the apprehended. If the object of perception does not exist,

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po 'jig pas bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po 'jig pas bde blag tu 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the entity that is the nature of perception is destroyed, and it is easily engaged.

original: gzhan du na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis phan tshun ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, because the apprehended and the apprehender are mutually independent,

original: dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would become a denial of entities.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs rnams la zhugs te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs rnams la zhugs te /
translated: Engaging in the collections uninterruptedly,

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po yongs su rdzogs na ;
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po yongs su rdzogs na ;
translated: when the first incalculable eon is completed,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis 'dir chud de /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis 'dir chud de /
translated: one enters here with the transcendent wisdom that transcends the conception of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam 'di la brten nas /
translated: In this way, based on mere representation,

original: gzugs la sogs pa med par bsgom pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi thog ma'i rang bzhin dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @202b 'khor dang bcas pa mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med par bsgom pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi thog ma'i rang bzhin dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @202b 'khor dang bcas pa mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The meditation on the non-existence of form, etc. is the concentration called the “heat” of the supramundane path, which is the beginning of the path, and which is accompanied by its retinue.

original: de'i 'og tu rtse mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rtse mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: After that, there is the “summit.”

original: de'i 'og tu gzung ba ma lus par mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa dang mthun pa bzod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzung ba ma lus par mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa dang mthun pa bzod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: After that, there is the concentration called “patience,” which is accompanied by its retinue, and which is favorable to the non-apprehension of the apprehender, because the apprehended is not apprehended.

original: de'i 'og tu don mi dmigs pa la brten te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don mi dmigs pa la brten te /
translated: After that, based on the non-apprehension of the object,

original: rnam par shes pa tsam yang mi dmigs par bsgom zhing 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba shes rab la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'khor dang bcas pa mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yang mi dmigs par bsgom zhing 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba shes rab la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'khor dang bcas pa mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: one meditates on the non-apprehension of consciousness itself, and the concentration called “the supreme mundane quality,” accompanied by its retinue, which consists of wisdom, etc., becomes manifest.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: After that, there is the path of vision.

original: de nyid la yang chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtog pas sa dang po la 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la yang chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtog pas sa dang po la 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: In that very [path of vision], one enters the first stage, which is called “the entrance into the light of the Dharma,” because one realizes the all-pervasiveness of the realm of phenomena.

original: 'di ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin gyi /🔽tshad med pa la sogs pa bzhin du mos pa yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin gyi / tshad med pa la sogs pa bzhin du mos pa yid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the attention on reality.🔽It is not the attention on reality as the object of aspiration, as in the case of the immeasurables.

original: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de yi phyir na dmigs pa ni //🔽mi dmigs ngo bo nyid du grub //
analyzed: de yi phyir na dmigs pa ni // mi dmigs ngo bo nyid du grub //
translated: Therefore, the object

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: is established as the nature of non-apprehension.

original: yang na rnam pa 'dis so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa 'dis so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because of the individual intuitive awareness of this aspect,🔽it is said:🔽Therefore, the object🔽is established as the nature of non-apprehension.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis med do zhes gang sngar dam bcas pa de grub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la gnyis med do zhes gang sngar dam bcas pa de grub po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the former thesis, “The unreal imagination exists as duality, but is not dual,” is established,🔽it is said:

original: de yi phyir na dmigs pa ni //🔽mi dmigs ngo bo nyid du grub //
analyzed: de yi phyir na dmigs pa ni // mi dmigs ngo bo nyid du grub //
translated: Therefore, the object

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //🔽de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so // de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is established as the nature of non-apprehension.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i don gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i don gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because the entity of the object to be apprehended does not exist.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang byed pa po dang byed pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu brtag grang na /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang byed pa po dang byed pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu brtag grang na /
translated: If the so-called objective referent is imagined to be any of the three, entity, agent, or action,

original: las med pas de gsum char yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: las med pas de gsum char yang mi rung ste /
translated: then all three are impossible because of the non-existence of action.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, the objective referent is established as having the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa mdzad pas dmigs par bya ba'i don med na dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel pa mdzad pas dmigs par bya ba'i don med na dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, the author of the commentary says, “If the objective referent does not exist, apprehension is impossible.”

original: de lta bas na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mnyam par shes par bya /
analyzed: de lta bas na dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mnyam par shes par bya /
translated: Therefore, one should understand the equality of objective referent and non-apprehension.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur te /
translated: In this way, the objective referent becomes the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de'i phyir mnyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyam mo //
translated: Therefore, it is equal.

original: don mi dmigs pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pa yang med par bye brag med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam du dmigs pa yang med par bye brag med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: And one should understand the equality of the non-apprehension of the objective referent and the apprehension of mere representation, because there is no difference between them.

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i sgra dag phan tshun 'gal ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i sgra dag phan tshun 'gal ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the mutual contradiction of the words “objective referent” and “non-apprehension,”🔽he says,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called an objective mental support because it appears as a non-existent object.

original: don med pas 'dis ni ci yang mi @203a * //
analyzed: don med pas 'dis ni ci yang mi @203a * //
translated: Since it is non-existent, it is not at all apprehended by this.

original: dmigs so // de'i phyir don dam par mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dmigs so // de'i phyir don dam par mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is also the nature of non-apprehension in the ultimate, there is no contradiction.

original: gzhan dag na re byis pa rnams don med pa la don du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa rnams don mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de gnyis mtshan nyid mtshungs pas mnyam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byis pa rnams don med pa la don du dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa rnams don mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de gnyis mtshan nyid mtshungs pas mnyam par shes par bya ste /
translated: Others say that the two, namely, the apprehension of a non-existent object by the childish and the non-apprehension of an object by the āryas, should be understood as equal because they are similar in characteristic.

original: sbrul du 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbrul du 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the non-apprehension of a snake in a rope.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sbrul du 'khrul pa mi dmigs par bshad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sbrul du 'khrul pa mi dmigs par bshad pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the non-apprehension of a snake in a rope is explained,

original: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang /
translated: although it is the nature of non-apprehension,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang ba'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang ba'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: it is explained as an objective mental support because it appears as a non-existent object.

original: gzhan dag na re byis pa rnams kyis 'dzin par dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / don med pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa de gnyis ni gnyi ga yang gzung ba med na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re byis pa rnams kyis 'dzin par dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / don med pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa de gnyis ni gnyi ga yang gzung ba med na /
translated: Others say: The object of observation that is observed by naïve beings and the non-observation that is observed by āryas is non-existent, because it is meaningless.

original: 'dzin pa med par bye brag med pa'i phyir mnyam par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par bye brag med pa'i phyir mnyam par shes par bya ste /
translated: Those two, observation and non-observation, should be understood to be the same, because if there is no object of observation, there is no observation.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas zhes rgya cher smos so zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas zhes rgya cher smos so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore it says, “because of the appearance of unreal objects.”

original: yang kha cig sems pa sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen por de lta bas na dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs mnyam par shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so snyam ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig sems pa sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen por de lta bas na dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs mnyam par shes par bya // zhes gsungs so snyam ste /
translated: Again, some think: The antidote to superimposition and denial is stated as follows: Therefore, observation and non-observation should be understood to be the same.

original: don med pa'i phyir dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du med pas /
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du med pas /
translated: They think that the object of observation does not exist by way of its own nature as an object of observation, because it is meaningless.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis de med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis de med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “non-existent by way of its own nature.”

original: dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bsal bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bsal bar bya ba'am /
translated: The object of observation is to be eliminated as having the nature of an object of observation.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhag par bya ba med de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang gzhag par bya ba med de /
translated: The nature of non-apprehension is also not something to be posited.

original: de gnyis ka yang rnam par brtag tu med pas mnyam pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang rnam par brtag tu med pas mnyam pa nyid do ;
translated: Since both of these are not to be imagined, they are the same.

original: / de lta bas na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa la mi ltos par dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa gnyis so so rang gis mnyam pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / de lta bas na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa la mi ltos par dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa gnyis so so rang gis mnyam pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, without relying on superimposition and denial, the sameness of both apprehension and non-apprehension should be understood by each one individually.🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'di las bsal bya gang yang med //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di las bsal bya gang yang med //
translated: Nothing is to be removed from this

original: gzhag par bya ba'ang ci yang med //🔽yang dag nyid la yang ngag lta /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'ang ci yang med // yang dag nyid la yang ngag lta /
translated: and nothing is to be added.🔽The real is to be seen as real

original: yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba rnam par grol //
translated: and the liberated is to be seen as liberated.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam la dmigs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam la dmigs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why is it called the object of perception of mere representation?

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang /
translated: Even though it is the nature of non-apprehension,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don du snang bas /
translated: it appears as an unreal object.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang de bzhin du grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las kyang de bzhin du grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is known as such in the world and in the treatises.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i @203b mtshan nyid ston te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i @203b mtshan nyid ston te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of differentiation is taught.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The division of the imagination of what is unreal is the nature of the desire, form and formless worlds.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: It is a different aspect.

original: rab tu dbye ba nyid mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba nyid mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the very division is the characteristic,

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: it is the characteristic of the division.

original: rab tu dbye ba 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this division illustrates the imagination of what is unreal.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the characteristic of the division taught?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams mi rigs te /
translated: The desire and form worlds are not tenable in the mere imagination of what is unreal,

original: khams tha dad pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po tha dad pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag la sogs par tha dad pa gang yin pa de thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams tha dad pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po tha dad pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag la sogs par tha dad pa gang yin pa de thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because the different realms would not be different in the case of the adverse elements and their counteragents, and the different noble beings would not be different.

original: de bas na bstan pa la nyes pa chen por 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs ba bsal ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa la nyes pa chen por 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs ba bsal ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore, in order to dispel the doubt that this would be a great fault in the teaching, the defining characteristics of the divisions are explained.

original: yang na / gang rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pa de nyid na /
analyzed: yang na / gang rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pa de nyid na /
translated: Or, it is thought that where there is investigation and analysis,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam ste /
translated: there is the imagination of what is unreal, but not otherwise.

original: de bas na de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to dispel that,🔽the defining characteristics of the divisions are stated:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: zhes rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid brjod de gang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pa nyi tshe la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid brjod de gang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pa nyi tshe la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just where there is investigation and analysis.

original: dper na gzugs ni 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as form is both the elements and what is derived from the elements,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: the imagination of what is unreal is both mind and mental factors,

original: sems 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: but not just mind alone.

original: de dag kyang khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de dag kyang khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: And those are the nature of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa tha dad pas khams gsum pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa tha dad pas khams gsum pa rnams so //
translated: The three realms are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa de las sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyi shu gang dag 'byung ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa de las sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyi shu gang dag 'byung ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm is the twenty types of sentient beings that arise from unreal imagination, such as hell beings.

original: tshangs rigs la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu bdun gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: tshangs rigs la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu bdun gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The form realm is the seventeen types of sentient beings, such as those of the Brahma lineage.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa'i rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The formless realm is the four types of sentient beings, such as those who are limitless space.

original: gzhan na re 'dod pa la 'dod chags ma spangs pa dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //🔽'dod pa la 'dod chags spangs la gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba rnams ni @204a * //
analyzed: gzhan na re 'dod pa la 'dod chags ma spangs pa dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o // 'dod pa la 'dod chags spangs la gzugs kyi 'du shes dang ma bral ba rnams ni @204a * //
translated: Others say: Those who have not abandoned attachment to the desire realm and are not free from the discernment of form are sentient beings who experience the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment to the desire realm but are not free from the discernment of form are sentient beings who experience the form realm.🔽Those who are free from the discernment of form but are not free from the discernment of infinite consciousness are sentient beings who experience the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs la 'dod chags spangs shing gzugs kyi 'du shes dang yang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs la 'dod chags spangs shing gzugs kyi 'du shes dang yang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment to the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, and who are also detached from the notion of form, are in the realm of immateriality.

original: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so /
translated: Others say: Those in whom attachment to the realm of desire is predominant are in the realm of desire.

original: // / gzugs la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so //🔽gzugs med pa la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: // / gzugs la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so // gzugs med pa la 'dod chags rgyas par gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: Those in whom attachment to the realm of fine-materiality is predominant are in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o //
translated: Those in whom attachment to the realm of immateriality is predominant are in the realm of immateriality.

original: kha cig ni rtag tu g-yeng ba dang sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: kha cig ni rtag tu g-yeng ba dang sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'i gnas su gyur pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: Some say: Those who are always distracted and who are in a state of suffering of the mind are in the realm of desire.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: Those who are concentrated and who are free from the suffering of the mind are in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: mnyam par gzhag la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa spangs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa spangs pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who are concentrated and who are free from the states of pleasure and suffering are in the realm of immateriality.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o//
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o//
translated: The formless realm is the sphere of the formless.

original: kha cig ni dri dang ro dang de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ma spangs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: kha cig ni dri dang ro dang de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ma spangs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: Some say: The desire realm is the sphere of those who have not abandoned smell, taste, and the consciousnesses that appear as those two.

original: dri dang ro dang de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa spangs pa rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa spangs pa rnams ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The form realm is the sphere of those who have abandoned smell, taste, and the consciousnesses that appear as those two.

original: khams bco lngar snang ba spangs pa rnams ni gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: khams bco lngar snang ba spangs pa rnams ni gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes smra'o //
translated: The formless realm is the sphere of those who have abandoned the appearance of the fifteen elements.

original: bshad pa de dag thams cad la de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa de dag thams cad la de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are all those explanations?

original: thog mar bshad pa las brjod pa nyid bshad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: thog mar bshad pa las brjod pa nyid bshad par bya ba ste /
translated: First, what is stated should be explained.

original: de ltar na bshad pa 'di dag ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid do //🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i skabs yin bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de ltar na bshad pa 'di dag ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid do // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i skabs yin bzhin du yang /
translated: Thus, these explanations are dependent.🔽Although this is the context of the imagination of what is unreal,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa smos pa ni mi dmigs pas bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa smos pa ni mi dmigs pas bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the mention of the imagination of what is unreal is interrupted by non-apprehension.

original: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid kyang ston te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid kyang ston te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of the synonyms is also taught.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag rab tu bstan pas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag rab tu bstan pas /
translated: By the thorough teaching of the distinctions of mind and mental factors,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid kyang ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid kyang ston to //
translated: the characteristic of the synonyms of the imagination of what is unreal is also taught.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang dag pa ma yi pa kun rtog pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / khyad par la rtog par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yang dag pa ma yi pa kun rtog pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / khyad par la rtog par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mind and mental factors engage in the imagination of the nature and the distinctions of the thing that is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: don gyi rang gi ngo bo dang bye brag mthong ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa @204b ste ;
analyzed: don gyi rang gi ngo bo dang bye brag mthong ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa @204b ste ;
translated: The seeing of the nature and the distinctions of an object is the mind and mental factors. The imagination of what is unreal is a synonym.

original: don la ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: don la ni khyad par med do //
translated: There is no distinction in the object.

original: de la don tsam mthong ba ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: de la don tsam mthong ba ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: Therein, the mere seeing of an object is consciousness. The word “mere” in the phrase “the mere seeing of an object” indicates that

original: khyad par sel ba'i phyir te khyad par mi 'dzin gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tsam dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad par sel ba'i phyir te khyad par mi 'dzin gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tsam dmigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the specific characteristic, it does not apprehend the specific characteristic, but rather it observes the mere intrinsic nature of the entity.

original: don gyi khyad par mthong ba ni sems las byung ba rnams te tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo de dang des der mngon par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par mthong ba ni sems las byung ba rnams te tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo de dang des der mngon par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The observation of the specific characteristic of an object is the mental factors, such as feeling, because they engage with that specific characteristic in that way.

original: de la gang dngos po de'i khyad par sim pa dang / gdung ba nyid yid bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang dngos po de'i khyad par sim pa dang / gdung ba nyid yid bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas pa gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Among them, feeling is the apprehension of the specific characteristic of an entity that is pleasant or painful, which is the basis of mental satisfaction and so on.

original: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs par tha snyad gdags pa'i mtshan ma don gyi khyad par gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs par tha snyad gdags pa'i mtshan ma don gyi khyad par gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of the specific characteristic of an object that is the sign for the designation of a woman, man, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied in the appropriate manner to the others.

original: de ltar de dag kyang gnas pa dang dmigs pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar de dag kyang gnas pa dang dmigs pa dang / dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, they are associated by the sameness of their basis, object, time, and substance.

original: rnam par shes pa dang khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur bas rnam par mtshungs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur bas rnam par mtshungs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not associated by the sameness of their aspect, because that would entail the absurd consequence that they would be indistinguishable from consciousness.

original: kha cig ni 'dir sems kyi bye brag nyid sems las byung bar dgongs par shes te /🔽rma bya'i mdongs ltar rnam par shes pa de nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dir sems kyi bye brag nyid sems las byung bar dgongs par shes te / rma bya'i mdongs ltar rnam par shes pa de nyid /
translated: Some understand that the intention here is that the specific states of mind are mental factors.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo la sogs par snang ba sna tshogs su 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo la sogs par snang ba sna tshogs su 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: Consciousness itself arises as the variety of appearances that have the nature of, for example, a peacock’s tail feather.

original: ji ltar na gcig pu yang yin la sna tshogs kyang yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig pu yang yin la sna tshogs kyang yin /
translated: How can something be both one and a variety?

original: gcig pu du ma'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur du 'ong zhes /
analyzed: gcig pu du ma'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur du 'ong zhes /
translated: It would follow that one thing would have the nature of many.

original: 'jig rten ni gcig la mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni gcig la mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: The world does not accept that one thing has a variety of contradictory characteristics.

original: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub par gyur na ni /
translated: If the nature of a phenomenon were to be established,

original: 'di yang nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then this would be a fault.

original: nor pa tsam la ni nyes pa 'di med de /
analyzed: nor pa tsam la ni nyes pa 'di med de /
translated: But this fault does not apply to mere error.

original: de bzhin ma yin ye med min //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin ma yin ye med min // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that it is not so, nor that it does not exist.🔽This is not so,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: because it contradicts the sutra, which says:

original: mdo las tshor ba gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste chos 'di rnams ni 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: mdo las tshor ba gang yin pa dang / 'du shes gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste chos 'di rnams ni 'dres pa ste /
translated: Whatever is feeling, whatever is perception, whatever is volition, whatever is consciousness, these dharmas are mixed.

original: ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not unmixed.

original: 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa rnams cig car phrad par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa rnams cig car phrad par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: “Mixed” means that existing things come together simultaneously.

original: gang chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub par 'dod pa de la /
analyzed: gang chos kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub par 'dod pa de la /
translated: For one who asserts that the intrinsic reality of dharmas is not established,

original: mdo de ni don 'dir khungs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mdo de ni don 'dir khungs su mi rung ngo //
translated: this sutra is not a valid source for this meaning.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam du zad la gzhan yang med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba rnam par mi shes pas @205a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam du zad la gzhan yang med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba rnam par mi shes pas @205a * //
translated: Since it is mere imagination of what is unreal, and there is nothing else, one does not understand the classification of cause and effect.

original: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston te /
analyzed: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston te /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that, the characteristic of engagement is also taught.

original: 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshon pa'o //
translated: This shows the cause and effect of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: 'jug pa nyid mtshan nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'jug pa nyid mtshan nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Since engagement is the characteristic, it is the characteristic of engagement.

original: 'jug pa yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: And engagement is twofold.

original: skad cig brgyud mar 'jug pa ste /🔽de'i dbang gis da ltar byung ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du 'jug ste /
analyzed: skad cig brgyud mar 'jug pa ste / de'i dbang gis da ltar byung ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan du 'jug ste /
translated: It is the engagement in a continuous series of instants.🔽By its power there is the defilement of the experience of the present, and engagement in another life.

original: de'i dbang gis tshe phyi ma'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis tshe phyi ma'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: By its power there is the defilement of the future, which is the defilement of karma and rebirth.

original: 'dir ni skad cig brgyud mar 'jug pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni skad cig brgyud mar 'jug pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa'o //
translated: Here, the engagement in a continuous series of instants is explained as the characteristic of engagement.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The engagement in another life is explained below as the characteristic of defilement.

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: One is the condition for consciousness.

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la /
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: gcig ces bya ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Here, the one is the storeconsciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lhag ma bdun rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen gyi dngos po'i rgyu yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lhag ma bdun rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen gyi dngos po'i rgyu yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The condition consciousness is the cause of the remaining seven consciousnesses, because it is the substantial cause of the condition.

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second is called the experiencing consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar snyegs te /
translated: The word consciousness is supplied.

original: de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Its result is supplied as the remainder of the sentence.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun no //
translated: It is also of seven kinds.

original: nye bar spyod pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dgos pa yin pas nye bar spyod pa can no //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dgos pa yin pas nye bar spyod pa can no //
translated: The experiencing consciousness is the experiencing consciousness because it is the purpose of the evolving consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa de la sems las byung ba nye bar spyod pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dang 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa dag kyang de'i 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de la sems las byung ba nye bar spyod pa dang / yongs su gcod pa dang 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa dag kyang de'i 'bras bu zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The result of that consciousness is the mental activities that are its experiencing, its determination, and its engagement.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness, its establishment, and its pleasure are the same.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag ni rgyu'i rkyen yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag ni rgyu'i rkyen yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The store-consciousness is the consciousness of the condition because it is the causal condition for the other consciousnesses.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad der 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor ba dang / de yang de dag la rgyu'i dngos por sbyor bas kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad der 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor ba dang / de yang de dag la rgyu'i dngos por sbyor bas kun gzhi'o //
translated: It is the store-consciousness because all dharmas with outflows are connected with it as effects and it is connected with them as a cause.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de ltar snang bas rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de ltar snang bas rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness because it causes the appearance of the world with its living beings and its physical environment.

original: de yang cig tu rnam par smin pas lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba dang / 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu'i rkyen yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang cig tu rnam par smin pas lung du ma bstan pa nyid do // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba dang / 'jug pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu'i rkyen yin pas rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is always morally indeterminate because it is a mere result.🔽It is the consciousness of the condition because it is the causal condition for the other consciousnesses, being connected with the seeds of all dharmas with outflows and being their support.

original: de las byung ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar spyod pa can no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar spyod pa can no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The active consciousnesses are the appropriating consciousnesses because they appropriate the sense-objects.

original: @205b kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: @205b kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the storehouse consciousness.

original: de'i rkyen gyis skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “arises in dependence on” is the same as the phrase “arises from that.”

original: ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de dang rigs gcig pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma byung ba 'byung bar byed pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brtas par byed de /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na de dang rigs gcig pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma byung ba 'byung bar byed pa'i sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brtas par byed de /
translated: When the active forms of consciousness arise, they cause the seeds in the storehouse consciousness to grow, seeds that are of the same class as those active forms of consciousness and that will produce future active forms of consciousness.

original: sa bon brtas nas 'gyur ba'i bye brag rnyed pa de las yang de dang rigs gcig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa bon brtas nas 'gyur ba'i bye brag rnyed pa de las yang de dang rigs gcig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: When those seeds have grown and have attained a certain maturity, they in turn produce active forms of consciousness that are of the same class.

original: de ltar na de'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the active forms of consciousness arise in dependence on the storehouse consciousness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa dang / kun kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgo ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i nye bar spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa dang / kun kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgo ba'i phyir /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the support for the experience of the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, and it is the support for the seeds of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar spyod pa can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang nye bar spyod pa can du 'gyur la /
translated: Also, the foundation consciousness would be a consciousness that experiences objects.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rkyen gyi rnam par shes par 'gyur bar thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rkyen gyi rnam par shes par 'gyur bar thal bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: And it would follow that the active consciousnesses would be conditions for the foundation consciousness.

original: rkyen gyi dngos po ma gtogs par bag chags bsgo ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dngos po ma gtogs par bag chags bsgo ba gzhan med de /
translated: Apart from being conditions, there is no other way to plant imprints.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: The Abhidharma Sūtra says:

original: phan tshun 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // rgyu yi dngos por rtog tu yang //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // rgyu yi dngos por rtog tu yang //
translated: The mutual relationship of cause and effect

original: rnam par shes la chos kun sbyor //
analyzed: rnam par shes la chos kun sbyor //
translated: is applied to consciousness and all phenomena.

original: de yang de bzhin de dag la'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin de dag la'o // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: And that is so for those phenomena as well.

original: thal bar mi 'gyur te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: thal bar mi 'gyur te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That is not a problem. Why?

original: de'i tshor ba shes par dka' bas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du nye bar spyod pa can du mi shes sos //
analyzed: de'i tshor ba shes par dka' bas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin du nye bar spyod pa can du mi shes sos //
translated: Because its feelings are difficult to know, it is not known to be a consciousness that experiences objects, like the active consciousnesses.

original: yang na nyi ma ltar khyad zhugs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na nyi ma ltar khyad zhugs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Or it should be understood to be different from the sun.

original: 'di ltar nyes par spyod pa tshor ba rna pa gsum po'i gnas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes par spyod pa tshor ba rna pa gsum po'i gnas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the basis of the three feelings of faulty action is the actual consciousnesses,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: not the store consciousness.

original: /'dir ni rgyu'i rkyen du 'dod kyi rkyen tsam du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: /'dir ni rgyu'i rkyen du 'dod kyi rkyen tsam du ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the store consciousness is considered the causal condition, not merely a condition.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang gis rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bag chags dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi dbang gis rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bag chags yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang gis rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bag chags dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi dbang gis rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bag chags yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, the store consciousness holds the propensities for the results of retribution and of natural outflow, under the influence of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas, and it holds the propensities for the results of natural outflow, under the influence of neutral dharmas.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ma lus pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ma lus pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: Therefore, the store consciousness is the causal condition of all impure dharmas.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen te /
translated: The actual consciousnesses are the dominant condition of the store consciousness.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ma yin pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du @206a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ma yin pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du @206a * //
translated: Since it is not the causal condition, it is the condition of the engaging consciousness.🔽

original: thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It is not a causal condition, so it is not a condition for the evolving consciousnesses.

original: nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The experience of feeling.

original: rnam pa gsum char yang nye bar spyod pas nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char yang nye bar spyod pas nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of feeling are experiences because they are experiences of pleasure, suffering, and neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: myong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽srid pa'i ro bro ba'i snying po 'dra ba ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: myong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // srid pa'i ro bro ba'i snying po 'dra ba ni tshor ba ste /
translated: The experience of feeling is the experience of the object.

original: de'i phyir byis pa rnams de kun tu myong bar bya ba'i phyir yul rnams la chags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa rnams de kun tu myong bar bya ba'i phyir yul rnams la chags so //
translated: Feeling is like the essence of the taste of existence, because childish beings are attached to objects in order to experience that.

original: kha cig na re tshor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi don la dmigs pa yang nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re tshor ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi don la dmigs pa yang nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: Not only feeling is experience, but also the object that is experienced is called experience.

original: bshad pa las nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bas de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa las nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal bas de ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not so, because it contradicts the explanation in the treatise that experience is feeling.

original: don la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin pas de sems las byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin pas de sems las byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The object that is experienced is not different from consciousness, so it is not suitable as a mental factor.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir tshor ba yongs su spyod pa ni 'du shes nye bar spyod pa dang / 'du shes la rnam par shes pa 'jug par byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir tshor ba yongs su spyod pa ni 'du shes nye bar spyod pa dang / 'du shes la rnam par shes pa 'jug par byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
translated: The formative forces are those that cause consciousness to engage with discrimination.

original: sems pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are intention, attention, etc.

original: yang na nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, enjoyment is feeling.

original: rang gi dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du myong ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du myong ba'am /
translated: It is the experience of its object in accordance with its mode of apprehension.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is the experience of the karma that is to be experienced as pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar yul dang las la spyod pa ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang las la spyod pa ni tshor ba ste /
translated: Thus, feeling is the enjoyment of the object and the enjoyment of karma.

original: de'i phyir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽yul gyi don rtags tha snyad kyi mtshan ma yongs su gcod par byed pas yongs gcod ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o // yul gyi don rtags tha snyad kyi mtshan ma yongs su gcod par byed pas yongs gcod ni 'du shes so //
translated: That is why it is described as enjoyment.🔽Discrimination is the determination of the object-referent, the object-sense and the conventional symbol.

original: rnam par shes pa dmigs pa gzhan la 'jug par byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dmigs pa gzhan la 'jug par byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
translated: The formative forces are those that cause consciousness to engage with the object-referent.

original: de ltar na sems pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa dmigs pa gzhan la brten to //
analyzed: de ltar na sems pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa dmigs pa gzhan la brten to //
translated: Thus, consciousness is dependent on another object through the power of intention, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dun pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dun pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes will, etc.

original: gang nas ci 'dra gang gi phyir 'jug pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang nas ci 'dra gang gi phyir 'jug pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The source, the manner, and the purpose of the engagement have been explained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ji ltar 'byung ba na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston to zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ji ltar 'byung ba na /
translated: The characteristic of defilement is also taught, i.e., how the defilements of action and birth occur.

original: 'gro ba yongs su nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba yongs su nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The complete affliction of the life-cycle is the characteristic of defilement.🔽This is taught in order to demonstrate that the life-cycle is expanded from the mere imagination of what is unreal, even though there is no self.

original: de ni bdag med par yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam las 'khor ba rgyas par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de ni bdag med par yang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa tsam las 'khor ba rgyas par 'gyur ba /
translated: The life-cycle is expanded from the mere imagination of what is unreal, even though there is no self.

original: rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bshad de /🔽sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bshad de / sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
translated: It is said:🔽Because of obscuration, because of planting,

original: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
translated: because of leading, and because of grasping.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: It is said extensively.

original: rten cing 'brel bar @206b 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'di yang 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar @206b 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'di yang 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad do //
translated: This twelvefold dependent origination is also stated in terms of the forward order.

original: de la sgrib pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, it is said that the twelve members are afflictions because they obscure.

original: 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes tha mar smos pa ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes tha mar smos pa ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: The final statement, “afflictions because they afflict the world,” is to be applied to all.

original: gang gis sgrib pa ji ltar sgrib pa'i phyir nyon mongs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis sgrib pa ji ltar sgrib pa'i phyir nyon mongs par byed ce na /
translated: By what and how are they afflictions because they obscure?

original: de'i phyir ma rig pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because ignorance obstructs seeing things as they are in reality.”

original: ma rig pa ni mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas yang dag pa mthong ba'i yul la rab tu sgrib pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas yang dag pa mthong ba'i yul la rab tu sgrib pa'i phyir /
translated: Since ignorance has the nature of non-seeing, it completely obscures the object of seeing things as they are in reality.

original: yang dag pa mthong ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa mthong ba mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, seeing things as they are in reality does not arise.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa mthong ba skye ba la bgegs byed pas ma rig pa ni yang dag pa mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa mthong ba skye ba la bgegs byed pas ma rig pa ni yang dag pa mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it obstructs the arising of seeing things as they are in reality, ignorance obstructs seeing things as they are in reality.

original: yang dag pa mthong ba yang dngos su ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: yang dag pa mthong ba yang dngos su ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The correct view is, in fact, supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i rjes las byung ba'i phyir de'i rjes las thob pa dang / de'i rtogs pa'i phyir de sbyong bar byed pa thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba yang yang dag pa mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes las byung ba'i phyir de'i rjes las thob pa dang / de'i rtogs pa'i phyir de sbyong bar byed pa thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba yang yang dag pa mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it arises subsequent to that, the attainment subsequent to that, and since it is the realization of that, the correct view is also the purification of that, which is derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: yang dag pa mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pas /
translated: Since it is an obstruction to the correct view,

original: ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen zhes bya ste /
translated: ignorance is the condition of the formative forces.

original: de ltar sgrib pa'i phyir ma rig pas 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa'i phyir ma rig pas 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Thus, because it obscures, ignorance afflicts the world.

original: 'debs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'debs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “because it instigates” should be connected with the phrase “afflicts the world.🔽” By what is the world instigated?

original: gang gis gang du ci 'dabs she na ;
analyzed: gang gis gang du ci 'dabs she na ;
translated: In what way is the world instigated?
