original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the formative forces plant the latent impressions of action in consciousness.

original: de la 'du byed rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.

original: de ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pas 'du byed de /
analyzed: de ni yang srid pa mngon par 'du byed pas 'du byed de /
translated: They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.

original: ma btab pa 'debs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nyid du 'du byed kyi sgrar bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //🔽de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis yang srid pa 'debs nus par 'gyur gyi /🔽yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma btab pa 'debs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid du 'du byed kyi sgrar bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no // de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis yang srid pa 'debs nus par 'gyur gyi / yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin pas /
translated: They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.🔽They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste /🔽'di ltar ma rig pa ma skyes na de dag yang srid pa 'du byed kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste / 'di ltar ma rig pa ma skyes na de dag yang srid pa 'du byed kyi /

original: rig pa skyes na ni ma yin no //🔽bdag po tsam gyis ni ma rig pa 'du byed kyi rkyen zhes mi bya'i //
analyzed: rig pa skyes na ni ma yin no // bdag po tsam gyis ni ma rig pa 'du byed kyi rkyen zhes mi bya'i //
translated: They are called formations because they form or create a new existence.

original: spyi'i rkyen yin pas kun nas 'byung ba na yang yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i rkyen yin pas kun nas 'byung ba na yang yin te /
translated: They are called formations because they form or create a

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir /🔽ji ltar nyon @207a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir / ji ltar nyon @207a * //
translated: Thus, ignorance is the general condition of all the defilements.

original: mongs pa kun nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du de las byung ba'i sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: mongs pa kun nas 'byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du de las byung ba'i sems pa rnams kyi yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is the general condition of the defilements, so it is of the volitions that arise from the defilements.

original: bsod nams kyi 'du byed srid pa dang longs spyod bye brag can la smon pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'du byed srid pa dang longs spyod bye brag can la smon pa'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams kyi yang yin te /
translated: It is also the general condition of the meritorious volitions that are associated with the aspiration for a particular existence and enjoyment.

original: kun nas 'byung ba ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: kun nas 'byung ba ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The defilements are the general condition of the volitions that arise from them, and the ignorance that is associated with them is the general condition.

original: mi g-yo ba de la nges par 'byung bar lta ba kun 'byung ba rnams kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba de la nges par 'byung bar lta ba kun 'byung ba rnams kyi yang yin te /
translated: It is also the general condition of the volitions that arise from the view of release in the unmanifest,

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin pas /🔽'du byed kyi rkyen zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ma rig pa ni spyi'i rkyen yin pas / 'du byed kyi rkyen zhes bshad do //
translated: and the ignorance that is associated with them is the general condition.🔽Thus, it is said that the volitions have ignorance as their condition.

original: rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the statement, “consciousness has volitions as its condition,”

original: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: the consciousness that is intended here is the store-consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the active consciousnesses,

original: rgyun chad pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su khrid mi srid pa dang / dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gnyis 'grogs mi srid pas /
analyzed: rgyun chad pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su khrid mi srid pa dang / dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gnyis 'grogs mi srid pas /
translated: because it is impossible for the active consciousnesses to lead to the place of rebirth when the continuum is interrupted, and because it is impossible for the two, the virtuous and the afflicted, to accompany each other.

original: 'du byed rnams kyis de la las kyi bag chags gzhom mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyis de la las kyi bag chags gzhom mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is impossible for the formative forces to destroy the latent impressions of action in it.

original: las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba la las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba la las kyi bag chags zhes bya ba 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called latent impression of action?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sa bon te rgyu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sa bon te rgyu'i dngos po'o //
translated: It is the seed of the future, the causal entity.🔽For example, it is like the seed which is the causal entity for the arising of the sprout from the fruit of the rice plant, in dependence on the conditions of earth, ash, moisture, etc.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.

original: dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu sa dang thal ba dang / lung la sogs pa rkyen gyi bye brag la ltos te /
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i 'bras bu sa dang thal ba dang / lung la sogs pa rkyen gyi bye brag la ltos te /
translated: The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.

original: 'gyur ba las myu gu 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po ni sa bon zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'debs pa nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba las myu gu 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po ni sa bon zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'debs pa nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan bshad pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the seed of the future.🔽The establishment of the latent impressions of action is the establishment of the

original: 'jog pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyud 'di la des thog ma kho na'i sa bon de rgyas par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jog pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyud 'di la des thog ma kho na'i sa bon de rgyas par byed pa yin te /
translated: And it is the continuum of consciousness that expands the seed of that in the very beginning.

original: zag pa med pa'i ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni 'ga' tsam gyis kyang sa bon sngon ma bskyed pa med de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni 'ga' tsam gyis kyang sa bon sngon ma bskyed pa med de /
translated: In the same way, no contaminated phenomenon whatsoever generates a seed that did not exist previously.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la yang srid pa'i sa bon skyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la yang srid pa'i sa bon skyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Thus, because the formations cause consciousness to plant the seed of existence, they afflict migration.

original: khrid pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang khrid pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang khrid pa mi shes nas /
translated: Since it is not known by whom, where, and how one is led,

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “because consciousness causes one to arrive at the place of rebirth.”

original: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas 'chi'o //
analyzed: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun chags su 'jug pas 'chi'o //
translated: Consciousness, imbued with the impressions of action, continues in a series.

original: gnas nas skye ba'i gnas su yang srid pa'i sa bon du gyur ba'i bag chags phyin par byed /
analyzed: gnas nas skye ba'i gnas su yang srid pa'i sa bon du gyur ba'i bag chags phyin par byed /
translated: It causes the propensities that are the seeds of existence to be transferred from the place of death to the place of rebirth.

original: khrid par byed do //
analyzed: khrid par byed do //
translated: It is the condition for the consciousness that links to a new existence.

original: de ltar byas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam @207b par shes pa'i rkyen ni 'du byed ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam @207b par shes pa'i rkyen ni 'du byed ma yin gyi /
translated: If this were not so, then the formations would not be the condition for the consciousness that links to a new existence,

original: sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rkyen 'du byed yin par rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rkyen 'du byed yin par rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: but would be the condition for the consciousness of the prior existence.

original: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for an effect to arise from a cause that has ceased.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnyed pa rnams ni gang shi ba de nyid du skye bas gzugs med pa rnams su ji ltar skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnyed pa rnams ni gang shi ba de nyid du skye bas gzugs med pa rnams su ji ltar skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed ce na /
translated: How does one who has attained the formless meditative attainments proceed to the place of rebirth in the formless realm, since one is reborn in the very place where one dies?

original: de ni ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as appropriate.

original: ming dang gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like name-and-form.🔽It is the condition for the process of rebirth because it seizes the rebirth state.

original: kun 'dzin phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang yongs su 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'dzin phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang yongs su 'dzin zhe na /
translated: By what is it seized? In what way is it seized?

original: de'i phyir ming dang gzugs kyi lus so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming dang gzugs kyi lus so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: the body of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lnga'o //
translated: Name-and-form is the five aggregates.

original: de dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From the moment of conception,

original: nur nur po dang mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang gor gor po dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i dus dang / skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nur nur po dang mer mer po dang / nar nar po dang gor gor po dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i dus dang / skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: the condition of consciousness is called name-and-form, which is the state of the embryo in the mother’s womb, from the time of the kalala, arbuda, peśin, ghana, and praśākhā stages, until the six sense bases have formed.

original: 'di ltar de la bsgos pa'i bye brag gis rigs mthun pa gzhan dag tu de bye brag can du grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la bsgos pa'i bye brag gis rigs mthun pa gzhan dag tu de bye brag can du grub po //
translated: Because of the specific imprints on that consciousness, it is established as a specific type in other similar classes.

original: de skyes nas kyang mi dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa tha dad pa'i phyir lus kyang tha dad pas ming dang gzugs kyis lus yongs su 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skyes nas kyang mi dang dud 'gro la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa tha dad pa'i phyir lus kyang tha dad pas ming dang gzugs kyis lus yongs su 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: And, after birth, the body is also different because of the different classes of humans, animals, etc. Therefore, name-and-form is said to “uphold the body.”

original: yang na 'chi ba la thug gi bar du lus thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba la thug gi bar du lus thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Or, it upholds the entire body until death.

original: de thog ma kho nar thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of all at the very beginning.

original: yang na dbyer med kyang ming gzugs kyis lus yongs su 'dzin to zhes 'di tha dad par ston to //
analyzed: yang na dbyer med kyang ming gzugs kyis lus yongs su 'dzin to zhes 'di tha dad par ston to //
translated: Or else, although inseparable, name-and-form is said to “uphold” the body, in order to show that they are distinct.

original: dper na 'dus byas thams cad phung po lnga rnams kyis kun bsdus so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas thams cad phung po lnga rnams kyis kun bsdus so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said that all conditioned things are included in the five aggregates.

original: rdzus te skye ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug nyid do //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug nyid do //
translated: In the case of beings born spontaneously, the six sense bases are conditioned by consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ci rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that name-and-form is conditioned by consciousness in the appropriate cases.🔽The six sense bases cause the completion of the body, and they cause the defilement of the world.

original: rdzogs byed phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir zhe na /🔽skye mched drug gis ming dang gzugs su bsdus pa'i lus te 'di ltar ming dang gzugs kyi tshe ni /
analyzed: rdzogs byed phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba gang gis gang du gang rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir zhe na / skye mched drug gis ming dang gzugs su bsdus pa'i lus te 'di ltar ming dang gzugs kyi tshe ni /
translated: By what is the body completed? In what way?🔽The six sense bases complete the body that is included in name-and-form.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched med pa'i phyir lus ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched med pa'i phyir lus ma rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the stage of name-and-form, the sense bases of the eye, etc., do not yet exist, and therefore the body is said to be incomplete.

original: de'i tshe na lus kyi skye mched dang yid kyi skye mched yod mod kyi 'on kyang brten pa dang / gnas yongs su rdzogs par med @208a * //🔽ba'i phyir yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na lus kyi skye mched dang yid kyi skye mched yod mod kyi 'on kyang brten pa dang / gnas yongs su rdzogs par med @208a * // ba'i phyir yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: At that time, the body sense-sphere and the mental sense-sphere do exist, but they are not complete because their support and their location are not complete.

original: skye mched drug gi dus na ni mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pas gnas yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi dus na ni mig la sogs pa mngon par grub pas gnas yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: At the time of the six sense-spheres, the eye sense-sphere, etc., are fully formed, so the location is complete.

original: mig la sogs pa de la brten pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pas lus kyi skye mched kyang yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de la brten pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pas lus kyi skye mched kyang yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The body sense-sphere is also complete because the factors that depend on the eye sense-sphere, etc., are complete.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa la brten zhe na de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa la brten zhe na de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How do they depend on the eye sense-sphere, etc.? They arise in dependence on them.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa drug gis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa drug gis bsdus pa ste /
translated: The mental sense-sphere is included in the six consciousnesses.

original: de'i tshe gnas ma lus par yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas ma lus par yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the location is complete because it is complete in every way.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir skye mched drug gi dus nyid na /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir skye mched drug gi dus nyid na /
translated: At the time of the six sense-spheres, the sense-spheres are complete because the major and minor limbs are complete.

original: gnas yongs su rdzogs pas skye mched drug gis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas yongs su rdzogs pas skye mched drug gis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed ces bya'o //
translated: The six sense bases afflict due to the complete development of the site.

original: gsum gcod phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsum gcod phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The three afflictions are due to the complete development of the three.

original: gsum ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus so //
analyzed: gsum ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus so //
translated: The three are the coming together of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum gang yin pa de yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum gang yin pa de yongs su gcod pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the complete development of the three that is conducive to the arising of the feeling of pleasure, etc.

original: de bas na dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar reg par byed pas reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rnam pa dang 'dra bar reg par byed pas reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, contact is so called because it makes contact with the object in a form that corresponds to the sense faculty.

original: yang na skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa ni bde ba la sogs par tshor ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum skyed do ;🔽/ nye bar spyod pa ni tshor bas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa ni bde ba la sogs par tshor ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum skyed do ; / nye bar spyod pa ni tshor bas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, contact that has the six sense bases as its condition generates the three types of sense faculty transformation that are conducive to the feeling of pleasure, etc.🔽Feeling is due to contact.

original: tshor ba ni srid pas nye bar spyad pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni srid pas nye bar spyad pa ste /
translated: Feeling is the experience of existence.

original: ro myong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro myong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “experience” is the same as “to experience.”

original: yang na bsod nams la sogs pa'i las la nye bar spyod pas tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams la sogs pa'i las la nye bar spyod pas tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, feeling is called “experience” because it is the experience of the karma of merit, etc.

original: yang na 'dir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba myong ba ste /
translated: Or else, here “experience” is the experiencing of feeling.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba na der bde ba la sogs pa rgyas par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba na der bde ba la sogs pa rgyas par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: When one experiences pleasure, etc., it is because pleasure, etc., have been experienced.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang gti mug rnams kyis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang gti mug rnams kyis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: The world is defiled by attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: sdud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gis gang sdud pa mi shes so //
analyzed: sdud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gis gang sdud pa mi shes so //
translated: As for “because of grasping,” it is not known what is grasped by what.

original: de'i phyir las kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa sred pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa sred pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Craving is the planting of karma-impregnated seeds.”

original: 'du byed rnams kyis yang srid pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa la gso ba'i phyir btab pa /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyis yang srid pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa la gso ba'i phyir btab pa /
translated: The seeds of future rebirth are planted in consciousness by the formative forces.

original: yang srid par 'gyur ba'i sa bon chu dang 'dra ba'i sred pa /
analyzed: yang srid par 'gyur ba'i sa bon chu dang 'dra ba'i sred pa /
translated: Craving is like water that nourishes the seeds of future rebirth.

original: 'gro ba thams cad du bye brag med par lus 'dod pa zhes bya bas brlan nas yang srid pa 'byung bar nye bar sbyor zhing 'byung ba nges par 'jog @208b pa gang yin pa de ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du bye brag med par lus 'dod pa zhes bya bas brlan nas yang srid pa 'byung bar nye bar sbyor zhing 'byung ba nges par 'jog @208b pa gang yin pa de ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The moistening of all beings by the desire for a body, without distinction, is the appropriation which is the cause of the production of a new existence.

original: sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la gang gis gang du gang zhig sbyor ba dri bar bya ba'i skabs su bdag nyid kyis len pa rnams kyis rnam par shas pa skye ba dang / mthun pa 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la gang gis gang du gang zhig sbyor ba dri bar bya ba'i skabs su bdag nyid kyis len pa rnams kyis rnam par shas pa skye ba dang / mthun pa 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams su'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: As for the question, By what means, in what place, and for what reason is one bound? the root text states, By the four appropriations, in the desire realm, and so on, for the sake of experiencing pleasure and so on.

original: mngon par zhan pa dang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid nye bar len pa bzhi po dag gis las kyis btab pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu lta ba dag tu sbyor bar byed 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par zhan pa dang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid nye bar len pa bzhi po dag gis las kyis btab pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu lta ba dag tu sbyor bar byed 'jog par byed de /
translated: The four appropriations, which are characterized by manifest craving and desire, cause the consciousness that is stamped with karma to be bound to the desire realm, the form realm, the formless realm, and so on, for the sake of experiencing pleasure and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa der gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa der gnas so //
translated: Thus, consciousness abides there due to the power of desirous attachment.

original: mngon du'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang gzhan gyis yongs su dri bar bya ba'i skabs su bdag nyid kyis las byas pa'i rnam par smin pas yang srid par 'byin par mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon du'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang gzhan gyis yongs su dri bar bya ba'i skabs su bdag nyid kyis las byas pa'i rnam par smin pas yang srid par 'byin par mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, in the passage beginning with “because of manifestation,” the author of the commentary himself explains that the statement “because of the manifestation of the karma that one has done” means that the karma that one has done manifests in the form of the result of evolution in the new existence.

original: ji ltar sngon byas pa'i las rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yang 'byung bas bag chags kyi dus su gyur pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon byas pa'i las rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yang 'byung bas bag chags kyi dus su gyur pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir /
translated: Since the karma that one has done in the past arises as the cause of consciousness, the latent impressions that are the seeds of the karma that one has done manifest as the result of evolution.

original: 'jug pa rnyed pas srid pa yod par gyur cing srid pa btab pa 'grub par mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed pas srid pa yod par gyur cing srid pa btab pa 'grub par mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, the existence of the new existence is established because of the acquisition of the new existence.

original: de ltar na srid pas mngon du'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pas mngon du'i phyir 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Thus, the world is afflicted by existence because of manifestation.

original: sdug bsngal phyir ni skye ba dang rga shis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir ni skye ba dang rga shis 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The world is afflicted by birth and aging and death because of suffering.

original: de ltar srid pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yod pa thog ma nyid du mngal du zhugs pa na khu ba dang khrag gi nang na rnam par shes pa myos pas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar srid pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yod pa thog ma nyid du mngal du zhugs pa na khu ba dang khrag gi nang na rnam par shes pa myos pas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Thus, the existence of a new existence is accomplished from existence. First of all, the consciousness is tormented by intoxication in the midst of semen and blood when it enters the womb.

original: de bzhin du ma'i mngal du zhu ba dang ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na 'gre ldog pas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma'i mngal du zhu ba dang ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na 'gre ldog pas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Likewise, it is tormented by rolling about in the womb in the midst of the digested and undigested food of the mother.

original: yang de ltar ma'i kha zas dang spyod pa nyam nga ba dang / ya nga ba ma spangs pas kyang nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: yang de ltar ma'i kha zas dang spyod pa nyam nga ba dang / ya nga ba ma spangs pas kyang nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Also, it is tormented by the mother's food and behavior that are not avoided as dangerous and fearful.

original: de bzhin du dog pa mi gtsang ba'i lam nas 'byung bas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dog pa mi gtsang ba'i lam nas 'byung bas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Likewise, it is tormented by emerging from the narrow, impure passage.

original: skyes nas kyang spyi cer dang skra skya ba la sogs pa rga ba'i mtshan nyid dang ming dang gzugs 'jig pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / lang tsho dang srog phangs pa las nyams pas 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: skyes nas kyang spyi cer dang skra skya ba la sogs pa rga ba'i mtshan nyid dang ming dang gzugs 'jig pa'i 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / lang tsho dang srog phangs pa las nyams pas 'gro ba nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Even after birth, it is tormented by the characteristics of old age, such as wrinkles and gray hair, and by the characteristics of death, the destruction of name-and-form, and by the loss of cherished youth and life.

original: 'gro bar byed pas na 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas na 'gro ba ste /
translated: Going is the act of going.

original: rigs mthun pa'i gnas skabs nas skad cig gi gnas skabs su rab tu 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i gnas skabs nas skad cig gi gnas skabs su rab tu 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the act of going from a prior state of non-existence to a subsequent state of existence.

original: nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is affliction because

original: @209a * // skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas khams gsum du skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'ong zhing 'gro bar gyur pas nyen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @209a * // skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas khams gsum du skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa 'ong zhing 'gro bar gyur pas nyen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it afflicts by causing one to go and come in a continuous series of moments in the three realms of existence through birth, old age, disease, and death.

original: kha cig na re rnam par byang ba'i ma yin pas nyon mongs pa zhes bya zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par byang ba'i ma yin pas nyon mongs pa zhes bya zhe'o //
translated: Some believe that it is called affliction because it is not purification.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'di ni sgrib pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rnam pa bcu gcig gis rnam par byang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'di ni sgrib pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rnam pa bcu gcig gis rnam par byang ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this twelvefold dependent origination, which is characterized by affliction, is the counteragent to purification in eleven ways, as the verse declares: “because it is obscuration, etc.”

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i go rims ni snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i go rims ni snga ma snga mas phyi ma phyi ma skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order of ignorance, etc. is because the former give rise to the latter.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'dis yang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa rnam pa du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa 'dis yang mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa rnam pa du bstan zhe na /
translated: In brief, how many kinds of afflictions are indicated by this twelvefold dependent origination?🔽Thus, it is said:

original: de'i phyir 'di skad ces rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad ces rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The twelvefold dependent origination

original: de yang rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang //
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang //
translated: is threefold and twofold,

original: nyon mongs rnam bdun zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs rnam bdun zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and also seven kinds of affliction.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba dang go bsnor ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba dang go bsnor ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “also” means “inclusive” and “mutually interchangeable.”

original: nyon mongs pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Afflictions are the affliction of afflictions, because afflictions are themselves afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The affliction of karma and the affliction of birth are also like this.

original: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba na bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'byung ba na bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: It is thoroughly afflicted because when the afflictions arise, they harm oneself and others.🔽As a sutra declares:

original: mdo las kyang ji skad du chags pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa bdag la yang gnod par sems /
analyzed: mdo las kyang ji skad du chags pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa bdag la yang gnod par sems /
translated: One who is thoroughly bound by attachment thinks of harming oneself,

original: gzhan la yang gnod par sems /
analyzed: gzhan la yang gnod par sems /
translated: one thinks of harming others,

original: gnyi ga la yang gnod par sems so //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang gnod par sems so //
translated: one thinks of harming both.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang rmongs pa yang shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang rmongs pa yang shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // las dang tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: One should understand anger and ignorance in the same way.🔽It is also thoroughly afflicted because the karma and life of the afflicted are produced.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis tshe 'phen te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis tshe 'phen te /
translated: Thus, due to the power of the afflictions, karma projects life.

original: bden pa mthong ba las yod kyang srid pa 'phen pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yang srid pa'i sa bon srid par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir /🔽tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba las yod kyang srid pa 'phen pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas yang srid pa'i sa bon srid par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yang srid pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: Also, a defiled mind is the cause of the defilement of life, because it projects existence even though one has seen the truth, and because it makes the seed of existence grow by the arising of the defilements.🔽

original: de bas na dgra bcom pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i @209b phyir /🔽nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na dgra bcom pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i @209b phyir / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: The mind that is defiled is the cause of the defilement of life because it is the cause of the projection of existence, even though one may have seen the truth, and because it is the cause of the production of the seed of existence by the arising of the defilements.

original: las kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: las kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: The action is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: de nyid kyi tshe na lus dang sems sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa yang 'byin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe na lus dang sems sdug bsngal ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa yang 'byin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is defiled because it is the cause of the suffering of body and mind at that time and because it produces the future result.

original: tshe yang gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas nyon mongs pa'o ;
analyzed: tshe yang gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pas nyon mongs pa'o ;
translated: Life is defiled because it is the basis of all harm.

original: / rgyu rnam pa gnyis su bye ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: / rgyu rnam pa gnyis su bye ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum mo //
translated: The three defilements are made into two causes.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa rnams te /
translated: The defilement of defilement is ignorance, craving, and grasping,

original: gsum char yang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum char yang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these three are of the nature of defilement.

original: las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams dang srid pa la bya ste /
analyzed: las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams dang srid pa la bya ste /
translated: The defilement of action is the formative forces and becoming,

original: gnyi ga yang las kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang las kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are of the nature of action.

original: 'di ni bye brag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bye brag yin te /
translated: This is the distinction.

original: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i las ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa'i las ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The formative forces are action that is present as the essential nature of the action itself.

original: sa bon du gnas pa ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon du gnas pa ni srid pa'o //
translated: Becoming is action that is present as the seed.

original: tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: The defilement of birth is the remaining limbs, i.e.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang / skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba yan lag lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang / skye ba dang rga shi zhes bya ba yan lag lhag ma rnams te /
translated: consciousness, name/form, the six sense bases, contact, sensation, birth, and old-age and death,

original: de dag ni tshe'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni tshe'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these are included within birth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam gnyis ni rgyu mi dbye bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam gnyis ni rgyu mi dbye bar byas pa ste /
translated: The two kinds of defilement are made without differentiating the cause.

original: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams kyis so //
translated: The defilement of cause is by the members of moral defilement and karma.

original: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The defilement of result is by the remaining members.

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa skye pa'i bdag nyid can dang / rga shi'i nyes dmigs can gyi tshe skyed par rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa skye pa'i bdag nyid can dang / rga shi'i nyes dmigs can gyi tshe skyed par rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this respect, karma and moral defilement are the cause of the members beginning with consciousness and concluding with feeling, because they are engaged in generating the life which has the nature of birth and is characterized by the misfortune of old-age and death.

original: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lhag ma rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lhag ma rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: The defilement of result is by the remaining members, i.e. consciousness, etc.,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the result of karma and moral defilement.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun zhes bya ste /
translated: This dependent origination is described as being defiled in seven ways.

original: phyin ci log dang 'debs pa dang / nye bar khrid pa dang kun 'dzin pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / sdud pa dang / skyo ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang 'debs pa dang / nye bar khrid pa dang kun 'dzin pa dang / nye bar spyod pa dang / sdud pa dang / skyo ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The seven causes are: the cause of error, the cause of planting, the cause of leading, the cause of grasping, the cause of enjoyment, the cause of accumulation, and the cause of weariness.

original: rgyu bdun po de lta ma rig pa ni phyin ci log gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu bdun po de lta ma rig pa ni phyin ci log gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement, “Ignorance is the cause of error,”

original: ma rig par gyur pa ni de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig par gyur pa ni de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i phyir /
translated: it is called “error” because it is confused about reality.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la rtag pa'i ngo bor mthong bas phyin ci log @210a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa la rtag pa'i ngo bor mthong bas phyin ci log @210a * //
translated: It is called “error” because it sees impermanence, etc., as permanence, etc.

original: ces bya'o // 'du byed rnams ni 'debs pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'du byed rnams ni 'debs pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement, “The formative forces are the cause of planting,”

original: rnam par shes pa la yan lag bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi tshe'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la yan lag bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi tshe'i sa bon 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed of life with its four members is planted in consciousness.🔽As for the statement, “Consciousness is the cause of leading,”

original: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la 'dir shi 'phos nas skye ba'i yul du nye bar khrid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la 'dir shi 'phos nas skye ba'i yul du nye bar khrid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the place of rebirth after death.

original: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug ni kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni khrid par gyur pa ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug gi ris mthun pa kun 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug ni kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni khrid par gyur pa ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug gi ris mthun pa kun 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Name-and-form and the six sense bases are the cause of grasping because they grasp the continuity of name-and-form and the six sense bases that have already been led.

original: sngar mngal nas skye ba la sogs pa'i skye gnas la dgongs nas ming dang gzugs kyis kun 'dzin par bshad do //
analyzed: sngar mngal nas skye ba la sogs pa'i skye gnas la dgongs nas ming dang gzugs kyis kun 'dzin par bshad do //
translated: Previously, with reference to birth from a womb, etc., it was explained that name-and-form grasps.

original: da ni brdzus te skye ba'i dbang du mdzad de skye mched drug gis kyang 'dzin to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: da ni brdzus te skye ba'i dbang du mdzad de skye mched drug gis kyang 'dzin to zhes bshad do //
translated: Now, with reference to apparitional birth, it is explained that the six sense bases also grasp.

original: yang na ming dang gzugs kyis thog ma nyid du lus tsam 'dzin par brjod par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ming dang gzugs kyis thog ma nyid du lus tsam 'dzin par brjod par bzhed pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is because it is intended to state that name-and-form initially grasps just the body.

original: 'dir ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa 'dzin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa 'dzin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Here, there is no contradiction because it grasps what is incomplete and what is complete.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Contact and feeling are the cause of enjoyment.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i myong bas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i myong bas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa la nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it experiences the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma together with its cause.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Craving, grasping, and existence are the cause of attraction.

original: byis pa las kyi rnam par smin pa la spyod pa de tshor ba de dang de la sred par byed de srid pa 'phel nas /
analyzed: byis pa las kyi rnam par smin pa la spyod pa de tshor ba de dang de la sred par byed de srid pa 'phel nas /
translated: The childish, who experience the maturation of karma, crave for this and that feeling. Craving increases.

original: yang de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pas 'dod pa la sogs pa len to //🔽de blangs pas kyang de'i las sngon byung ba yang srid pa /
analyzed: yang de dang ldan zhing mi 'bral bar sred pas 'dod pa la sogs pa len to // de blangs pas kyang de'i las sngon byung ba yang srid pa /
translated: They crave to be united with and not separated from that. They grasp for desire realm objects and so on.🔽Through grasping, the karma they previously performed that is still latent

original: bag chags su gnas pa yongs su gyur na ji ltar btab pa bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i 'byin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: bag chags su gnas pa yongs su gyur na ji ltar btab pa bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i 'byin pa'i phyir ;
translated: is transformed and ripens in accordance with the seeds that were planted.

original: 'jug pa rnyed nas srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed nas srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having obtained entry, they exist.

original: de yang 'du byed kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'du byed kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, through formation, they establish the existence of rebirth.

original: srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis sdud cing mngon par 'du byed ces bya bas /
analyzed: srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis sdud cing mngon par 'du byed ces bya bas /
translated: Existence and grasping are the cause of attraction, because they attract and form.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Craving, grasping, and existence are the cause of attraction.

original: yang na sred pa'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang mthun pa gang yang rung ba'i las kyi bag chags mngon du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na sred pa'i dbang gis 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang mthun pa gang yang rung ba'i las kyi bag chags mngon du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because craving manifests the latent impressions of karma that are in conformity with the craving for any of the desires,

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni bsdus pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni bsdus pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: craving, grasping, and existence are the cause of attraction.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni skye ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni skye ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Birth and old age and death are the cause of birth.

original: de ltar 'di ni tshe drangs bas sems can gyi rigs de dang der skye ba dang @210b rga shi'i sdug bsngal dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa gzhan yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni tshe drangs bas sems can gyi rigs de dang der skye ba dang @210b rga shi'i sdug bsngal dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa gzhan yang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of the prolongation of this life, one experiences the suffering of birth and old age and death in this and that class of sentient beings, and the other infinite categories of suffering, such as sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and disturbance.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum du brjod pas nyon mongs pa dang las ni /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum du brjod pas nyon mongs pa dang las ni /
translated: The three aspects of complete affliction are mentioned.🔽

original: tshe'i rgyu thun mong dang thun mongs ma yin pa rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: tshe'i rgyu thun mong dang thun mongs ma yin pa rab tu bstan to //
translated: The three kinds of afflictions are mentioned in order to show that karma and the afflictions are the common and uncommon causes of the sprout of life.

original: nyon mongs pa ni sa la sogs pa ltar tshe'i myu gu'i thun mong gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sa la sogs pa ltar tshe'i myu gu'i thun mong gi rgyu'o //
translated: The afflictions are the common causes of the sprout of life, like the earth, etc.

original: las ni thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: las ni thun mong ma yin te /
translated: Karma is uncommon,

original: myu gu'i sa bon ltar de tha dad pas tshe tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu'i sa bon ltar de tha dad pas tshe tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the differences in the sprout of life are due to the differences in karma, like the differences in seeds.

original: yang na 'dir sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar gyi mtha' zhes bya ba rabs gsum du ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na 'dir sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / bar gyi mtha' zhes bya ba rabs gsum du ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Or else, here the three periods of time are not called the prior limit, the posterior limit, and the middle period,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang 'bras bu yid zhes rab tu ston to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang 'bras bu yid zhes rab tu ston to //
translated: but rather karma, affliction, and result.

original: rnam pa gnyis su brjod pas 'di nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad de /🔽'di la byed pa po'am /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su brjod pas 'di nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad de / 'di la byed pa po'am /
translated: By mentioning two kinds of afflictions, it is shown that this is just cause and effect,🔽because there is no other afflicted agent or

original: tshor ba po kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhan med do zhes rab tu ston to //
analyzed: tshor ba po kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhan med do zhes rab tu ston to //
translated: experiencer here.

original: yang na 'dir las dang nyon mongs pa tsam nyid rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dir las dang nyon mongs pa tsam nyid rgyu ste /
translated: Or else, only karma and affliction are the cause here,

original: de dag yod pa dang med pas tshe yod pa dang med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yod pa dang med pas tshe yod pa dang med par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because life appears to exist and not exist due to their existence and non-existence.

original: de'i phyir tshe ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe ni de'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, life is their effect.

original: de lta bas na 'di la rgyu 'am 'bras bu ni med kyi dus skabs thams cad du yang phung po lnga nyid do zhes rab tu ston to //🔽rgyu rnam pa bdun bshad pas ni 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid du yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis su rab tu bstan to //🔽de la 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gis 'phen pa dang / ji ltar 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la rgyu 'am 'bras bu ni med kyi dus skabs thams cad du yang phung po lnga nyid do zhes rab tu ston to // rgyu rnam pa bdun bshad pas ni 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid du yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis su rab tu bstan to // de la 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang gis 'phen pa dang / ji ltar 'phen pa dang / gang 'phen pa de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is taught that neither cause nor effect exist here, but only the five aggregates at all times.🔽By explaining the seven types of causes, dependent origination is taught to have two aspects: the characteristic of projecting and the characteristic of actualizing.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bdun gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bdun gyis bstan to //
translated: Regarding that, the seven factors of dependent origination teach the characteristic of projecting in order to teach by what it is projected, how it is projected, and what is projected.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa de gang gis mngon par 'grub pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'grub pa dang / gang mngon par 'grub pa dang / de'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir yan lag lngas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa de gang gis mngon par 'grub pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'grub pa dang / gang mngon par 'grub pa dang / de'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir yan lag lngas so //
translated: The characteristics of actualization are fivefold: by what is actualized, how it is actualized, what is actualized, and the teaching of the faults of actualization.

original: gang gis 'phen zhe na ma rig pa las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gang gis 'phen zhe na ma rig pa las byung ba'i 'du byed rnams kyis te /
translated: By what is actualized? By the formative forces that arise from ignorance.

original: ji ltar de kho na la rmongs nas phyin ci log tu shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na la rmongs nas phyin ci log tu shes te /
translated: How is it actualized? By becoming confused about reality and by knowing falsely,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams mngon par byed do //
translated: one creates the formative forces that are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or unmoving.

original: 'du byed de dag gis ji ltar 'phen zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gis ji ltar 'phen zhe na /
translated: How are the formative forces projected?

original: rnam par shes pa las sa bon gsos pas skye bar nus par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las sa bon gsos pas skye bar nus par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the consciousness, because the seed is nourished and becomes capable of producing rebirth.

original: ci gzhig 'phen zhe @211a * //
analyzed: ci gzhig 'phen zhe @211a * //
translated: What is projected?

original: na / yang srid pa ba'i ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: na / yang srid pa ba'i ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: Name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling, in the order in which they occur.

original: de ltar 'phangs pa de gang gis mngon par 'grub par byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar 'phangs pa de gang gis mngon par 'grub par byed ce na /
translated: What is the projecting cause of the rebirth that is thus projected?

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rim gyis snga ma 'phangs pas 'dir skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyed pa gang yin pa de dag byung ba'i len pas so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rim gyis snga ma 'phangs pas 'dir skyes pa'i tshor ba la brten nas sred pa skyed pa gang yin pa de dag byung ba'i len pas so //
translated: The craving that arises in dependence upon the feeling that is born here in this life, by the previously mentioned process, is the appropriating cause.

original: ji ltar des mngon par 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar des mngon par 'grub ce na /
translated: How is the rebirth thus projected?

original: rnam par shes pa la bag chags su gnas pa'i las de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bag chags su gnas pa'i las de /
translated: The karma that is present as a latent impression in consciousness

original: des srid par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'du byed sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags rnam pa mang po gnas te /
analyzed: des srid par byed pa'i phyir ro // 'du byed sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir / rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags rnam pa mang po gnas te /
translated: is the projecting cause, because it projects the rebirth.🔽The latent impressions of karma are present in consciousness in many different forms, because it is imbued with various karmic predispositions.

original: len pa'i bye brag gis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: len pa'i bye brag gis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: The latent impressions of karma are present in consciousness in many different forms, because it is imbued with various karmic predispositions.

original: gang gis 'di las yang srid pa gnyis par 'gyur ba de ni 'dir srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'di las yang srid pa gnyis par 'gyur ba de ni 'dir srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The rebirth that is projected by that karma is called existence, because it brings about existence.

original: mngon par 'grub pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the actualizing cause of the rebirth that is thus projected?🔽The actualizing cause is the karma that is present as a latent impression in consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phangs pa des phyis skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phangs pa des phyis skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The actualization of the rebirth that is thus projected is the birth that occurs later, consisting of name and form, etc.

original: de yod pas nyes par 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pas nyes par 'gyur ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the fault that arises from its existence?

original: rga shi de lang tsho dang srog phangs pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi de lang tsho dang srog phangs pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because aging and death destroy youth and life.

original: 'dir nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu ni don med do zhe na don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu ni don med do zhe na don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the cause of being led is meaningless.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa chad nas skye ba'i srid pa 'byung bar rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa chad nas skye ba'i srid pa 'byung bar rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not meaningless, because it eliminates the conception that the life of birth arises from the life of death.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All these afflictions arise from unreal imagination.🔽The mind and mental factors are the basis of affliction,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is explained:

original: de yang / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //🔽sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: de yang / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: Unreal imagination

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i don bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i don bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The summary of the meaning of unreal imagination is:

original: don rgyas par bshad pa bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba dang / mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir don bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: don rgyas par bshad pa bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba dang / mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir don bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The summary is taught in order to easily understand the extensive explanation of the meaning and to not forget it.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni don gnyi ga yang bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni don gnyi ga yang bshad do //
translated: Therefore, here both meanings are explained.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of existence is:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: ces bya'o // med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: ces bya'o // med pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of nonexistence is:

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The duality does not exist therein.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the own-being is:

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Consciousness appears as objects, sentient beings, and self.

original: rab tu skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu skye'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It arises.

original: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the collection is:

original: rtag ba dang ni gzhan dbang dang // yongs su grub pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: rtag ba dang ni gzhan dbang dang // yongs su grub pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The imaginary, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: zhes bya'o // med pa'i mtshan nyid @211b la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // med pa'i mtshan nyid @211b la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid ni / dmigs pa la ni brten nas su //
translated: The characteristic of the means of entering into the characteristic of nonexistence is:

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: Nonapprehension arises in dependence on apprehension.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of differentiation is

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //🔽sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is mind and the mental factors of the three realms.

original: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of synonyms is

original: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: de la don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: The seeing of objects is consciousness.

original: de yi bye brag sems las byung //
analyzed: de yi bye brag sems las byung //
translated: Its differentiation is the mental factors.

original: zhes bya'o // 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of engagement is

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: One is the consciousness of conditions.

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
translated: The second has the nature of experience.

original: zhes bya'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of defilement is

original: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of obscuration, because of planting,

original: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
translated: Because of leading, because of grasping,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgur brjod nas stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ston te zhes bya ba 'dir ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgur brjod nas stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ston te zhes bya ba 'dir ji ltar sbyar zhe na /
translated: Thus, having described the characteristic of the imagination of what is unreal in nine aspects, it is asked: How should emptiness be understood?

original: 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang ba dang / chos khong du chud pa la brten nas chos nyid nges par 'dzin par 'gyur ba gnyis dam bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa la rnam par byang ba dang / chos khong du chud pa la brten nas chos nyid nges par 'dzin par 'gyur ba gnyis dam bcas pa yin te /
translated: This is the double promise: that one will come to apprehend reality in dependence on the understanding of the imagination of what is unreal, emptiness, the thorough afflictions of the former, and the thorough purities of the latter.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa bshad pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa bshad pa'i 'og tu /
translated: Therefore, after the explanation of the imagination of what is unreal,

original: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ltar 'chad de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ltar 'chad de /
translated: the way in which emptiness is to be understood is explained.🔽The characteristic, the synonyms,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni rnam grangs dang // zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni rnam grangs dang // zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: and so forth.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dgag pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dgag pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Therein, the characteristic is the nature of the negation of both entity and nonentity,

original: stong pa nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because emptiness pervades all the divisions.

original: ming gzhan ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: ming gzhan ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Another name is a synonym.

original: rnam grangs dang mthun pa rnam grangs 'jug pa'i rgyu ni rnam grangs kyi don to //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang mthun pa rnam grangs 'jug pa'i rgyu ni rnam grangs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of a synonym is the reason for the application of a synonym, which is consistent with the synonym.

original: nam mkha' ltar tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it is not different from space.

original: rnam par mi rtog kyang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang phrad pa dang / bral ba'i dus tha dad pas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog kyang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang phrad pa dang / bral ba'i dus tha dad pas dbye ba'o //
translated: Although it is non-conceptual, it is distinguished by the difference in time of contact with and separation from adventitious afflictions.

original: gzhan yang gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa tha dad pas dbye ba rnam pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa tha dad pas dbye ba rnam pa bcu drug go //
translated: Moreover, it is distinguished by the sixteen aspects of the difference in the superimposition of persons and phenomena.

original: sgrub pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ston par byed pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ston par byed pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: Proof is the reasoning that demonstrates the divisions of emptiness.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis stong pa nyid shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis stong pa nyid shes par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should emptiness be known by those aspects?

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pas na /
translated: Because it is the object of purification,

original: rnam par dag pa 'dod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'dod pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be known by those who desire purification.

original: mdo gzhan dag las rnam grangs bshad pa rnams la mi rmongs par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs so //🔽rnam @212a * //
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las rnam grangs bshad pa rnams la mi rmongs par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs so //🔽rnam @212a * //
translated: Enumeration is for the purpose of not being confused about the explanations in other sūtras.🔽Aspect is for the purpose of not being confused about the divisions of emptiness.

original: grangs kyi don khong du chud par gyur na stong pa nyid la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi don to //
analyzed: grangs kyi don khong du chud par gyur na stong pa nyid la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa nyid du nges pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyi don to //
translated: When one has understood the meaning of the enumeration, then one should understand the meaning of the synonyms, because emptiness is ascertained as the pure object.🔽When one has understood the meaning of the synonyms, then one should understand the meaning of the classification, because when one has eliminated the defilements,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal na /🔽de rnam par dag go zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa de spangs pa'i phyir 'bad pa skyed pa'i don du dbye ba'o //🔽dbye ba'i sgrub pa khong du chud na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal na / de rnam par dag go zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa de spangs pa'i phyir 'bad pa skyed pa'i don du dbye ba'o // dbye ba'i sgrub pa khong du chud na /
translated: one should generate effort in order to eliminate the defilements.🔽When one has understood the meaning of the classification, then one should understand the establishment of the classification,

original: 'gyur ba med kyang dbye ba bde blag tu rig pa'i phyir dbye ba'i sgrub pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med kyang dbye ba bde blag tu rig pa'i phyir dbye ba'i sgrub pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: because the classification is easily understood even though there is no change.

original: mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How should one understand the characteristics?

original: mtshan nyid sngar smos pas de'i phyir de nyid dang por 'dri ste /🔽gnyis dngos med pa'i dngos po yi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sngar smos pas de'i phyir de nyid dang por 'dri ste / gnyis dngos med pa'i dngos po yi //
translated: Since the characteristics were mentioned previously, therefore they are asked about first.🔽The characteristic of the emptiness of things is

original: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: the non-existence of duality in things.

original: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Duality is the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la'am /
translated: It is the imagined nature, which is imagined by unreal imagination.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin pas dngos po'i ngo bor med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin pas dngos po'i ngo bor med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist as the entity of a thing.

original: gnyis pa dngos po med pa de'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa dngos po med pa de'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The second is the characteristic of emptiness, which is the reality of that non-existence.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par byas pa'i phyir 'dir yang dngos po'i rkyen ma smos par bstan par lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par byas pa'i phyir 'dir yang dngos po'i rkyen ma smos par bstan par lta ba'o //
translated: In order to conform with the verse, here the condition of a thing is not mentioned, but it should be seen as taught.

original: dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba de dag gang yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba de dag gang yin /
translated: What are those called the reality of non-existence?

original: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of non-existence is existence.

original: gzhan du na de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po stong pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po stong pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, because the reality of that non-existence would be empty, it would not exist.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The reality of both would exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that in this way, the characteristic of emptiness of the nature of non-existence is fully taught.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid du ni ma yin no //
