translated: But it is not the characteristic of the nature of a thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i sgra ni dngos po dgag pa'i tshig yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i sgra ni dngos po dgag pa'i tshig yin na /
translated: The word “non-existence” is a term that negates a thing.

original: dngos po'i sgra med kyang don 'di khong du chud par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dngos po'i sgra med kyang don 'di khong du chud par 'gyur bas /
translated: Even without the word “thing,” this meaning would be understood,

original: dngos po'i sgra ni 'dir lhag go //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgra ni 'dir lhag go //
translated: so the word “thing” is redundant here.

original: lhag ma ma yin te gnyis kyi dngos po med pa stong pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes de tsam zhig bshad na /
analyzed: lhag ma ma yin te gnyis kyi dngos po med pa stong pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes de tsam zhig bshad na /
translated: It is not redundant. The characteristic of the emptiness of the non-existence of the duality is explained as just that.

original: gtsor gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid du ri bong gi rva dngos po med pa dang 'dra bar khong du chud de /
analyzed: gtsor gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid du ri bong gi rva dngos po med pa dang 'dra bar khong du chud de /
translated: If it were explained as just that, it would be understood primarily as the non-existence of the duality, like the non-existence of the horn of a rabbit,

original: sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa ltar chos nyid kyi ngo bor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pa ltar chos nyid kyi ngo bor mi rung ngo //
translated: and it would not be suitable as the nature of reality, like suffering and so on.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of the duality is emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la yod de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la yod de /
translated: That non-existence exists in the imagination of what is unreal.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste dngos po med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid @212b yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos nyid kyi ngo bor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste dngos po med pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid @212b yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chos nyid kyi ngo bor bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reality of the emptiness of emptiness is taught as the reality of the nature of things, in order to take up the characteristic of the thing that is the non-existence of things.

original: yang na gnyis kyi dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na gnyis kyi dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: Or, the non-existence of duality is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: med pa'i sgra ni thun mong yin pas 'dir med pa zhes bya ba gang las dgongs pa mi shes pas /🔽gtan med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la /
analyzed: med pa'i sgra ni thun mong yin pas 'dir med pa zhes bya ba gang las dgongs pa mi shes pas / gtan med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa la /
translated: Since the word “non-existence” is common, here, it is not known from what it is intended.

original: gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: In order to teach utter non-existence, the non-existence of the thing that is the duality is stated in the imagination of what is unreal.

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa gnyis ni rang gi nye bar len pa las gzhan du bshad par mi rigs so //🔽gcig la gcig med pa yang gnyi ga gnas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa gnyis ni rang gi nye bar len pa las gzhan du bshad par mi rigs so // gcig la gcig med pa yang gnyi ga gnas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not correct to explain the non-existence prior to and the non-existence after as different from their own appropriator.

original: gcig tu gnas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gcig tu gnas par mi rigs so //
translated: Also, the non-existence of one in the other is not correct as one abode, because both are abodes.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar bzung bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar bzung bas /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the non-existence of the thing that is a thing is taken up.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gtan dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar de shes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gtan dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya bar de shes par byas pa yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the non-existence of things is to be understood as the ultimate non-existence of the duality of the grasped and grasper.

original: gal te med pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te med pa'i bdag nyid stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: If emptiness is the non-existence of the nature of things,

original: don dam pa zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: how can it be called the ultimate?

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du ste /
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pas mi rtag pa nyid bzhin du ste /
translated: Because it is the object of the highest knowledge, like impermanence,

original: dngos po'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because it is a thing.

original: de lta mod kyi de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the non-existence of the nature of things,

original: 'di ltar de'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: because the non-existence of the nature of things

original: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
translated: is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not existent?

original: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa ste /🔽yod pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po gtan med par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa ste / yod pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po gtan med par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because it is the non-existence of the duality.🔽If it were existent, the non-existence of the duality would not be an ultimate,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i chos nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i chos nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the reality of imagination would not be non-existent.

original: ji ltar med pa'ang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa'ang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not non-existent?

original: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: Thus, the non-existence of the two is the non-existence of the entity of the two.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bor med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bor med pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-existence of the two is not non-existent as the entity of the non-existence of the two.

original: de med du zin na gnyis yod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de med du zin na gnyis yod pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it were non-existent, the two would exist.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i chos nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i chos nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it would not be the reality of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: dper na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: It would be like impermanence and painfulness.

original: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pas sgro btags pa'i rtag pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pas sgro btags pa'i rtag pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po'i dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is the non-existence of the entity of the permanent and the blissful that is imagined by beings who are subject to error,

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to be neither existent nor non-existent.

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i stong pa nyid chos nyid yin na /🔽ci ste de las gzhan zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa'i stong pa nyid chos nyid yin na / ci ste de las gzhan zhes bya ba'am /
translated: If the emptiness of the imagination of what is unreal is its reality,

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: is it different from it or is it not different?🔽Therefore, he says,

original: de'i phyir de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is as follows.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: It is only the nature of non-entity.

original: @213a * // yang na dngos po kho na dngos po med pa dgag pa'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: @213a * // yang na dngos po kho na dngos po med pa dgag pa'i bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: Or, entity itself is non-entity, having the nature of negation.

original: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min /
translated: Therefore, imagination of what is unreal is neither characterized by identity with nor difference from.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni chos nyid las chos nyid gzhan yin pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni chos nyid las chos nyid gzhan yin pa mi rung ste /
translated: If it were different, it would not be tenable that reality is different from the nature of things.

original: ji ltar mi rung zhe na chos las mtshan nyid tha dad pas chos nyid chos gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung zhe na chos las mtshan nyid tha dad pas chos nyid chos gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: How is it not tenable? Because the characteristic is different from the thing, reality would be a different thing.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos bzhin no //
translated: It would be like another thing that is different from it.

original: chos gzhan ni chos gzhan gyi chos nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: chos gzhan ni chos gzhan gyi chos nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that another thing is the reality of another thing.

original: de la yang chos gzhan btsal dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang chos gzhan btsal dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because another thing would have to be sought in that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like impermanence and painfulness.

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pa rnams las gzhan ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal ba las gzhan ma yin pa de ltar stong pa nyid kyang stong pa las gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pa rnams las gzhan ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal ba las gzhan ma yin pa de ltar stong pa nyid kyang stong pa las gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as impermanence is not other than the impermanent, and suffering is not other than the suffering, so too emptiness is not other than the empty.

original: gcig pa yin du zin na ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pa yin du zin na ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were identical, the object of purification would not be a universal characteristic.

original: 'dis rnam par dag par byed pas rnam par dag pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par dag par byed pas rnam par dag pa ni lam mo //
translated: Purification is the path, because it makes pure.

original: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not other than the intrinsic reality of the phenomena.

original: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du lam gyi dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du lam gyi dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of the path would not be the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because it is not other than the intrinsic reality,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not suitable as a universal characteristic.

original: de yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar phan tshun tha dad pas mnyam pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar phan tshun tha dad pas mnyam pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because it is different from the intrinsic reality of phenomena, sameness would be impaired.

original: yang na rang gi mtshan nyid de las gzhan ma yin pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: yang na rang gi mtshan nyid de las gzhan ma yin pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med do //
translated: Or else, since it is not other than its own characteristic, the entity’s own nature is not different.

original: de'i phyir spyi yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the universal also does not exist,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni tha dad pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of the universal is dependent on difference.

original: yang na rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the object of observation for purification is the object of observation for purification, because it is for the sake of purification.

original: dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pas rnam par dag pa thob pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pas rnam par dag pa thob pa med de /
translated: Since an entity is observed as its own characteristic, it does not obtain purification,

original: sems can thams cad rnam par dag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rnam par dag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that all sentient beings would be purified.

original: gal te gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par mi brjod na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par mi brjod na /
translated: If it is not said to be either the same or different,

original: gcer bu ba smra ba la 'chel bar de ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gcer bu ba smra ba la 'chel bar de ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: then it would be like the Jains’ attachment to speech.

original: dngos po yod pa la de nyid dam gzhan du lung mi ston pa gang yin pa de gcer bu pa'i smra ba la 'chel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la de nyid dam gzhan du lung mi ston pa gang yin pa de gcer bu pa'i smra ba la 'chel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not propound a scripture as the same or different with regard to an existent entity would be like the Jains’ attachment to speech.

original: stong pa nyid ni dngos po med pas skyon du 'gyur ba 'di med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni dngos po med pas skyon du 'gyur ba 'di med do //
translated: Since emptiness is not an entity, this fault does not apply.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid 'di ni med pa'i mtshan nyid dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi gnyis @213b pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid 'di ni med pa'i mtshan nyid dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi gnyis @213b pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Thus, this emptiness has the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of the nature of non-existence, and the characteristic of non-duality.

original: de nyid dang gzhan las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it has the characteristic of being free from identity and difference.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness has been explained.

original: de ni rnam grangs brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam grangs brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, its synonyms will be stated.

original: stong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: Emptiness, in brief,

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
translated: is suchness, the perfect end,🔽the signless, the ultimate,

original: mtshan ma med dang don dam dang // chos kyi dbyings ni rnam grangs so //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med dang don dam dang // chos kyi dbyings ni rnam grangs so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the Dharma-element, in its various synonyms.

original: rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni don gcig la sgra tha dad par grag pa ste rnam grangs kyi don brjod pas rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni don gcig la sgra tha dad par grag pa ste rnam grangs kyi don brjod pas rnam grangs zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, “synonyms” means that the same thing is expressed by different words. It is called “synonym” because it expresses the meaning of a synonym.

original: brjod pa de rnams ni mdo gzhan dag las stong pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: brjod pa de rnams ni mdo gzhan dag las stong pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Those expressions teach emptiness in other sūtras.

original: rnam grangs lnga po de dag gtso bo yin par tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad smos pa de bzhin du rnam grangs gzhan 'dir ma smos te /
analyzed: rnam grangs lnga po de dag gtso bo yin par tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad smos pa de bzhin du rnam grangs gzhan 'dir ma smos te /
translated: These five categories are the principal ones, as stated in the verse. Other categories are not mentioned here.

original: gsung rab las khong du chud par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsung rab las khong du chud par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The scriptures should be understood in this way.

original: mi gnyis pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / mi 'gag pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / mi 'gag pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are: non-duality, the non-conceptual realm, reality, the inexpressible, the unceasing, the unconditioned, nirvana, and so on.

original: rnam grangs kyi don ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi don ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the meaning of the categories be understood?

original: de ston te sgra de dag ni brtags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ston te sgra de dag ni brtags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is taught: Those terms are not imagined,

original: don dang ldan pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: but are said to be meaningful.

original: gzhan min phyin ci log ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan min phyin ci log ma yin //
translated: Not other, not erroneous,🔽ceasing, the domain of the noble,

original: de 'gag 'phags pa'i spyod yul dang // 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: de 'gag 'phags pa'i spyod yul dang // 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yi phyir //
translated: and the cause of the noble Dharma.

original: rnam grangs don de go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rnam grangs don de go rims bzhin //
translated: These are the meanings of the categories, in order.

original: zhes bya'o // de la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “unchanging” is the meaning of “thusness.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rtag tu de bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rtag tu de bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “because it is always just that way.”

original: rtag par dus thams cad 'dus ma byas pa yin pas mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag par dus thams cad 'dus ma byas pa yin pas mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is permanent, at all times it is unconditioned. The meaning of “unchanging” is the meaning of “permanent.”🔽Because it is not erroneous, it is the limit of reality.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni bden pa dang ma nor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste zhes bya ba la yang dag pa ni bden pa dang ma nor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Reality” is the meaning of “truth” and the meaning of “non-erroneous.”

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu med pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mu med pa ste /
translated: “ Limit” is the meaning of “extreme.”

original: gang phan chad nas shes par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: gang phan chad nas shes par bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: Because there is no other object of knowledge beyond it, it is the limit of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i mu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mu zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “extreme of reality.”

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid shes par bya ba mu zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid shes par bya ba mu zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is thusness called the “extreme of the object of knowledge”?

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro // phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the domain of the intuition that is the purification of the knowable.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not erroneous, because it is not reified or depreciated.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa phyin ci log gi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa phyin ci log gi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the cause is mentioned: because it is not the basis of error.

original: phyin ci log ni rnam par @214a * //🔽rtog pa'o // rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pas phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni rnam par @214a * // rtog pa'o // rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pas phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Error is discursive thought;🔽since it is not the objective support of discursive thought, it is non-erroneous.

original: mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is signless because it stops signs.

original: 'dir mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma 'gog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma 'gog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, signlessness is called the stopping of signs.

original: 'dir rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says: because of the non-existence of all signs.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma thams cad kyi stong pa nyid stong pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma thams cad kyi stong pa nyid stong pas mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Signlessness is so called because of the emptiness of the emptiness of all signs, both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: It is signless because all signs are absent.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Signlessness itself is signless.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas don dam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas don dam pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the ultimate because it is the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The ultimate is the supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i don ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Its object is the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the dharma-element because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: chos kyi sgra ni 'dir 'phags pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra ni 'dir 'phags pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The word dharma here refers to the noble dharmas,

original: yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba dang / ye shes la thug pa rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba dang / ye shes la thug pa rnams la bya ste /
translated: from right view up to right knowledge and right liberation.

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pas dbyings so //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pas dbyings so //
translated: It is the element because it is their cause.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni de la dmigs pas byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni de la dmigs pas byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, “because the noble dharmas arise with reference to it.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa la yang khams kyi sgra 'di 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa la yang khams kyi sgra 'di 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: The term element is also used for the apprehension of form that is characterized by itself and form that is derived from the elements.

original: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said here that the meaning of the term element is the meaning of cause.

original: dper na gser khung dang zangs khung bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser khung dang zangs khung bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a gold mine and a copper mine.

original: mdo gzhan las rnam grangs gsungs pa gzhan dag kyang 'di'i tshul du don bdag gis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las rnam grangs gsungs pa gzhan dag kyang 'di'i tshul du don bdag gis brtag par bya'o //
translated: Other enumerations of emptiness that are mentioned in other sūtras should be understood by the method of this [treatise] through the meaning of their terms.

original: stong pa nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas tha dad pa mi srid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo yin pas tha dad pa mi srid de /
translated: Emptiness does not have a different nature because it is the nature of the absence of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'dri ba'am yang na rnam grangs kyi don gyi 'og tu dbye ba shes par bya bar bstan pas /
analyzed: 'dri ba'am yang na rnam grangs kyi don gyi 'og tu dbye ba shes par bya bar bstan pas /
translated: After the meaning of the terms, it is taught that the divisions should be understood.

original: de'i phyir de bshad pa'i 'og tu stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bshad pa'i 'og tu stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: Therefore, after that explanation, it is asked, “How should the divisions of emptiness be understood?”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the thoroughly afflicted.

original: de spangs na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de spangs na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When that is abandoned, it is called the completely purified.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang stong pa nyid ma rtogs par gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa'i dus na yang stong pa nyid ma rtogs par gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Also, when there is defilement and purification, without realizing emptiness, there is no defilement and no purification.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gzhan med do //
translated: Even at the time of defilement and purification, there is no other defilement or purification apart from emptiness.

original: de lta bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi dus na yang /🔽stong pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi dus na yang / stong pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, even at the time of defilement and purification,🔽it is taught that emptiness is defilement and purification.

original: kun nas nyon @214b mongs rnam par dang // ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon @214b mongs rnam par dang // ces bya ba ste /
translated: The verse says, “Defilement and purification.”

original: de'i rab tu dbye'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The commentary explains, “The analysis of that.”

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs la /
translated: When is there defilement?

original: gang gi tshe dri ma med pa khong du ma chud nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dri ma med pa khong du ma chud nas /
translated: When is there purity?

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs la /
translated: When is there defilement?🔽When is there purification?

original: gang gi tshe rnam par dag ce na zhes dris pa dang / de ni dris bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par dag ce na zhes dris pa dang / de ni dris bcas dri ma med //
translated: The answer is, “It is asked whether it is defiled or pure.”

original: ces rgya cher ro //
analyzed: ces rgya cher ro //
translated: The rest is as in the above extensive explanation.

original: gnas gyur pa dang ma gyur pa la ltos pas /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa dang ma gyur pa la ltos pas /
translated: In dependence on the transformation and non-transformation of the basis,

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as being with stains and as being without stains.

original: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa'i nyes pas mi mkhas pa gang dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa'i nyes pas mi mkhas pa gang dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: Those who are not skilled, who are attached to the grasped and the grasper due to the faults of non-understanding and wrong understanding,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas sems kyi rgyud dri ma can du gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas sems kyi rgyud dri ma can du gyur pa la /
translated: and whose mind-streams are defiled by afflictions such as attachment,

original: stong pa nyid mi snang ba de dag dri ma dang bcas pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mi snang ba de dag dri ma dang bcas pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: for whom emptiness does not appear, are posited as being with stains.

original: 'phags pa gang dag de kho na mkhyen pas phyin ci log gi sems med pa la stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar rdul med pa ste rgyun mi 'chad par snang ba de dag ni dri ma spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa gang dag de kho na mkhyen pas phyin ci log gi sems med pa la stong pa nyid nam mkha' ltar rdul med pa ste rgyun mi 'chad par snang ba de dag ni dri ma spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those noble ones who, by knowing reality, have no mistaken mind, for whom emptiness appears like space, free from dust, uninterrupted, are said to be without stains.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa la ltos pa can yin par blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa la ltos pa can yin par blta ste /
translated: Thus, emptiness should be seen as dependent on afflictions and purification,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid dri ma can du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid dri ma can du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as having a nature with stains, because it is naturally luminous.

original: gal te dri ma dang bcas par gyur la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dri ma dang bcas par gyur la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni /
translated: If it were associated with defilement, etc.

original: 'gyur ba med par gnas skabs tha dad pa ma mthong la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par gnas skabs tha dad pa ma mthong la /
translated: The state of the unchanging is not seen to be different.

original: 'gyur ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba ste /
translated: Change is connected with arising and destruction.

original: de'i phyir 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas ji ltar mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas ji ltar mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “How could it not be impermanent, since it has the quality of change?”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs las stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba gzhan med kyi /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs las stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba gzhan med kyi /
translated: There is no other change from the state of defilement to the state of the purity of emptiness.

original: de kho na nyid du gnas par rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du gnas par rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: In reality, it abides as it is, without changing its nature.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral pa'i phyir 'di ltar /
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral pa'i phyir 'di ltar /
translated: Because it is free from adventitious defilement, it is like this:

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: The water element, gold, and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod /
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod /
translated: are accepted as pure, like the purity of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not impermanent.

original: dper na chu'i khams dang gser dang / nam mkha' rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na chu'i khams dang gser dang / nam mkha' rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the elements of water, gold, and space are not by nature impure.

original: dri ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par ma gyur kyang /
analyzed: dri ma'i ngo bo nyid yin par ma gyur kyang /
translated: Even though they are not by nature impure,🔽they are only impure due to adventitious defilements.

original: glo bur gyi dri mas dri ma can kho na dang glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral na yang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba med bzhin du rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri mas dri ma can kho na dang glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral na yang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba med bzhin du rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: Even though they are free from adventitious defilements, they do not change their nature.

original: de bzhin du stong pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur yang /
translated: In the same way, even though they are afflicted by adventitious defilements of emptiness,

original: 'gyur pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la /🔽de dang @215a * //
analyzed: 'gyur pa med pa'i ngo bo yin la / de dang @215a * //
translated: they are by nature unchanging.

original: bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When they are free from those, they are said to be pure.

original: dngos po de nyid sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyis rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gang rnam par 'jog pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po de nyid sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phyis rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gang rnam par 'jog pa de ni /
translated: The very same thing is posited as having the character of affliction before and the nature of purity later.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du gyur bas 'gyur ba'i chos bzlog par ma gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du gyur bas 'gyur ba'i chos bzlog par ma gyur gyi /
translated: This is not the reversal of the phenomenon of change due to the transformation of the nature.

original: gang la de gnyi ga yang glo bur yin pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la de gnyi ga yang glo bur yin pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is accidental in regard to that which is both.

original: de lta bas na de 'gyur ba'i chos nyid la reg pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de 'gyur ba'i chos nyid la reg pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not touch the reality of change.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i skabs yin pas stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba thams cad brjod dgos te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i skabs yin pas stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba thams cad brjod dgos te /
translated: Since this is the section on the analysis of emptiness, all the analyses of emptiness must be stated.

original: de'i phyir gzhan yang rab tu dbye ba ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yang rab tu dbye ba ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Moreover, the analysis is of sixteen kinds of emptiness.”

original: dngos po tha dad pas rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pas rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: The analysis is of sixteen kinds due to the differentiation of entities.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo la ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no differentiation in the insubstantiality of the duality.

original: nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ngo //
translated: The sixteen kinds of emptiness, beginning with the emptiness of internal things and ending with the emptiness of own-being of non-things, are derived from the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de yang mdor bsdu ba zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu ba zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that they are summarized in the following.

original: za ba bza' dang de yi lus //
analyzed: za ba bza' dang de yi lus //
translated: The eater, the eaten, and the body,

original: gnas kyi gzhi yi stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gnas kyi gzhi yi stong pa nyid //
translated: The emptiness of the basis of the abode,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: chos thams cad gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the universal characteristic is the emptiness of all phenomena, because all phenomena are of the nature of non-duality.

original: gzhan du na de ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan du na de ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Otherwise, it could not be taught as a separate emptiness.

original: de'i phyir gzhi tha dad pas de tha dad par ston to//
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi tha dad pas de tha dad par ston to//
translated: Therefore, it is taught as a separate emptiness because it is the basis of the separate emptinesses.

original: gzhan du na de ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan du na de ni tha dad par bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Otherwise, it could not be taught as a separate emptiness.

original: de la chags pa dang mngon par zhen pa de spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la chags pa dang mngon par zhen pa de spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon attachment and clinging to that,

original: thog mar zab gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar zab gzhig par bya'o //
translated: first, the profound is to be taught.

original: de la chags pa dang mngon par zhen pa de ni sangs rgyas su 'grub pa dang / rnam par thar pa thob pa'i bgegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa dang mngon par zhen pa de ni sangs rgyas su 'grub pa dang / rnam par thar pa thob pa'i bgegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Attachment and clinging to that is an obstacle to attaining Buddhahood and to attaining liberation.

original: de'i 'og tu de'i bza' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i bza' ba'o //
translated: After that, the food of that.

original: de'i 'og tu de gnyis kyi gnas te lus so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de gnyis kyi gnas te lus so //
translated: After that, the abode of those two, the body.

original: de'i 'og tu za ba la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu za ba la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to benefit the eater,

original: bdag gir chags pa dang 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gir chags pa dang 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to stop attachment and clinging to the self,

original: de'i gnas te lus kyi rten snod kyi 'jig rten gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas te lus kyi rten snod kyi 'jig rten gzhig par bya'o //
translated: The basis is the body, the physical world, which is to be destroyed.

original: gzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i stong pa nyid de ni gzhi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i stong pa nyid de ni gzhi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of that basis is called the emptiness of the basis.

original: de la za ba stong pa nyid ni nang gi skye mched rnams las brtsams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la za ba stong pa nyid ni nang gi skye mched rnams las brtsams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The emptiness of the enjoyer is in regard to the internal sense bases, beginning with the eye.

original: de dag kyang mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mig la sogs pa nas yid la thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The internal sense bases are from the eye up to the mind.

original: za ba de las gzhan med pas mig la sogs pa yul la nye bar spyod par 'jug par mthong nas mig la sogs pa nyid kyis za bar @215b 'jig rten mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: za ba de las gzhan med pas mig la sogs pa yul la nye bar spyod par 'jug par mthong nas mig la sogs pa nyid kyis za bar @215b 'jig rten mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas de'i phyir /
translated: The enjoyer is none other than that, so when one sees that the eye, etc. engage in the experience of objects, one thinks that the eye, etc. are the enjoyer.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched stong pa nyid la za ba stong pa nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched stong pa nyid la za ba stong pa nyid ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the sense bases of the eye, etc. is called the emptiness of the enjoyer.

original: bza' ba stong pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bza' ba stong pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The emptiness of the enjoyed is in regard to the external sense objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos la thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas chos la thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The external sense objects are from form up to entities.

original: de dag la yul gyi dngos por bza' bar bya bas na bza' ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la yul gyi dngos por bza' bar bya bas na bza' ba ste /
translated: Since they are to be eaten as objects, they are food.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi skye mched stong pa nyid ni bza' ba stong pa nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi skye mched stong pa nyid ni bza' ba stong pa nyid ces bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the external sense-fields is explained as the emptiness of food.

original: za ba dang bza' ba de gnyis ni lus dang phan tshun tha dad du mi 'jug par gnas /
analyzed: za ba dang bza' ba de gnyis ni lus dang phan tshun tha dad du mi 'jug par gnas /
translated: The eater and the food do not exist as different bodies.

original: de'i lus ni khog pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i lus ni khog pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: His body is called the belly.

original: de bas na de'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called its emptiness.

original: gnas kyi gzhi ni snod kyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: gnas kyi gzhi ni snod kyi 'jig rten te /
translated: The basis of the abode is the world-receptacle.

original: thams cad du sems can rnams kyi gnas kyi gzhi rab tu 'dogs pas /
analyzed: thams cad du sems can rnams kyi gnas kyi gzhi rab tu 'dogs pas /
translated: Since it is everywhere designated as the basis of the abode of sentient beings,

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rgya che ba'i phyir de stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rgya che ba'i phyir de stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: therefore, it is called the emptiness of the great, because it is great due to that.

original: gzhi'i sgra ni re re dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i sgra ni re re dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term basis should be connected with each.

original: de ltar shes bya'i dngos po rnams gzhi'i stong pa nyid la rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas yid la byed pa na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor ba de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa gzhan 'di nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes bya'i dngos po rnams gzhi'i stong pa nyid la rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas yid la byed pa na / byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor ba de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa gzhan 'di nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes🔽The emptiness of the beginningless and endless🔽The emptiness of nonrejection🔽The emptiness of nature🔽The emptiness of all phenomena🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the inconceivable🔽The emptiness of the imperceptible🔽The emptiness of the unobservable

original: stong pa nyid shes bya gang gis nang dang phyi'i skye mched la sogs pa 'di stong par mthong ba de la /🔽gang gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang / ji ltar de'i stong pa nyid shes pas mthong ba 'di nyid kyang 'dir don dam pa'i rnam pa'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa la rnal 'byor gyi sa'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa de gnyis gzhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes bya gang gis nang dang phyi'i skye mched la sogs pa 'di stong par mthong ba de la / gang gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang / ji ltar de'i stong pa nyid shes pas mthong ba 'di nyid kyang 'dir don dam pa'i rnam pa'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa la rnal 'byor gyi sa'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa de gnyis gzhig pa'i phyir /
translated: The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of entities🔽The emptiness of the other🔽The emptiness of the inexpressible🔽The emptiness of the expressed🔽The emptiness of the expression🔽The emptiness of the ultimate🔽The emptiness of the conditioned🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang don dam pa stong pa nyid de go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang don dam pa stong pa nyid de go rims bzhin no //
translated: The emptiness of the beginningless and endless🔽The emptiness of nonrejection🔽The emptiness of nature🔽The emptiness of all phenomena🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the inconceivable🔽The emptiness of the imperceptible🔽The emptiness of the unobservable🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of entities🔽The emptiness of the other🔽The emptiness of the inexpressible🔽The emptiness of the expressed🔽The emptiness of the expression🔽The emptiness of the ultimate🔽The emptiness of the conditioned🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned🔽The emptiness of what is beyond extremes🔽The emptiness of the beginningless and endless🔽The emptiness of nonrejection🔽The emptiness of nature🔽The emptiness of all phenomena🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of non-entities🔽The emptiness of the inconceivable🔽The emptiness of the imperceptible🔽The emptiness of the unobservable🔽The emptiness of non-entities🔽The emptiness of entities🔽The emptiness of the nature of entities🔽The emptiness of the other🔽The emptiness of the inexpressible🔽The emptiness of the expressed🔽The emptiness of the expression🔽The emptiness of the ultimate🔽The emptiness of the conditioned🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned🔽The emptiness

original: shes pa dang rnam pa ni ma smos par byas te bshad do //
analyzed: shes pa dang rnam pa ni ma smos par byas te bshad do //
translated: Consciousness and the aspects are not mentioned.

original: yang na stong pa nyid yul yin pas shes pa dang stong pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid yul yin pas shes pa dang stong pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or else, since emptiness is the object, it is explained as the knowledge of emptiness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos de stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos de stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that with respect to the nature of object and subject is emptiness of emptiness.

original: nang gi skye mched la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid shes pa des ji ltar mthong ba de /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid shes pa des ji ltar mthong ba de /
translated: The internal sense bases, etc., are also empty of that knowledge of emptiness, as it is seen.

original: 'dir don dam pa'o snyam pa'i rnam pa des stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir don dam pa'o snyam pa'i rnam pa des stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that with respect to the aspect of thinking, “This is the ultimate,” is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa ste kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni don dam pa ste kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate is emptiness, i.e., the emptiness of the imagined nature.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gzhan 'di ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i nyes par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gzhan 'di ni stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i nyes par gyur pa ste /
translated: This other grasping of signs is a fault in the cultivation of emptiness.

original: gang gi phyir byang @216a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang @216a * //
translated: For what reason?

original: chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid sgrub pa de yang dngos po'i ngo bor sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid sgrub pa de yang dngos po'i ngo bor sgro btags pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who establishes emptiness superimposes the nature of an entity.

original: de gzhig pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la thug pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de gzhig pa'i phyir 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la thug pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid bshad do //
translated: In order to destroy that, he explains emptiness, from the emptiness of the compounded up to the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir sgrub par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrub par byed ce na /
translated: Why does he establish it?

original: dge ba gnyis thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge ba gnyis thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In order to attain the two virtues, up to

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams dag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams dag bya'i phyir //
translated: in order to purify the Buddha dharmas.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis stong pa nyid la sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis stong pa nyid la sgrub par byed de /
translated: He establishes emptiness in that way,

original: stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: with the meaning of “one should cultivate emptiness.”

original: dge ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas te lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas te lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Virtue is compounded and uncompounded, the path and nirvana.

original: de gnyis ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽rtag tu sems can phan bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro // rtag tu sems can phan bya'i phyir //
translated: Those two are connected in order, with the emptiness of the compounded and the emptiness of the uncompounded.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to always benefit sentient beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rtag par bdag gis sems can la phan par bya'o snyam pa de'i stong pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rtag par bdag gis sems can la phan par bya'o snyam pa de'i stong pa nyid ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the unlimited.

original: 'khor ba mi gtang bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khor ba mi gtang bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order not to abandon samsara.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du bdag gis 'khor ba yongs su gtang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du bdag gis 'khor ba yongs su gtang bar mi bya ste /
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings, I should not abandon samsara.

original: 'khor ba yongs su btang na byang chub ma rnyed par /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su btang na byang chub ma rnyed par /
translated: If I were to abandon samsara, I would not attain enlightenment,

original: nyan thos kyi sar gnas par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar gnas par 'gyur bas /
translated: and I would remain in the stage of the śrāvakas.

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: ci'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid bshad ce na /
translated: Why is its emptiness explained?

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid du ma mthong na skyo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid du ma mthong na skyo ste /
translated: Therefore, if one does not see samsara as the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, one becomes weary

original: 'khor ba yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and abandons samsara.

original: dge ba mi zad bya ba'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba mi zad bya ba'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order not to exhaust virtue.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi zad par bya'o snyam pa ste /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mi zad par bya'o snyam pa ste /
translated: And when I attain nirvana without remainder, I will not exhaust my roots of virtue.

original: mi gtong zhes bya ba ni de mi 'dor bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtong zhes bya ba ni de mi 'dor bar bshad pa'o //
translated: Not abandoning means not relinquishing.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can one attain nirvana in the realm without remainder?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa'i lus ni med kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dngos po'i chos kyi sku ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa'i lus ni med kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dngos po'i chos kyi sku ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur
translated: The body that is the ripening of contaminated phenomena does not exist, but the reality of the uncontaminated dharmakaya of the bhagavat buddhas is not interrupted in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: ro zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ro zhes grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the tenets.

original: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore its emptiness is called the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: rigs kyang rnam par dag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rigs kyang rnam par dag bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to purify the lineage,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the bodhisattva

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs ni @216b rang bzhin zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs ni @216b rang bzhin zhes bshad do //
translated: For that very reason, the lineage is explained as intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What is it like? Therefore, it is said to be due to its intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid ni thog ma med pa'i dus can te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni thog ma med pa'i dus can te /
translated: Intrinsic reality is beginningless,

original: glo bur du byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is not adventitious, this is the meaning.

original: ji ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na la la ni sems dang bcas /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na la la ni sems dang bcas /
translated: Just as in beginningless cyclic existence, some have minds,

original: la la ni sems med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang skye mched drug po kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs /
analyzed: la la ni sems med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang skye mched drug po kha cig ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs /
translated: some do not, so too here, some of the six sense spheres are the lineage of the Buddha,

original: kha cig ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: some are the lineage of the śrāvaka and so on.

original: rigs ni grog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pas sems dang sems med pa'i bye brag bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs ni grog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pas sems dang sems med pa'i bye brag bzhin te /
translated: The lineage is like the distinction between those with minds and those without minds, coming from one to another without interruption,

original: glo bur du byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not adventitious.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin pas /
translated: Others say: Since all sentient beings are of the Tathagata's lineage,

original: 'dir rigs zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dir rigs zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du shes par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: here lineage should be understood in that sense.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad thob bya'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad thob bya'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to obtain the major and minor marks,

original: de'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams dpe byad bzang po rnams dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams dpe byad bzang po rnams dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the emptiness of the major marks and minor signs together with the major marks of a great being is called the emptiness of defining attributes.

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas chos rnams dag bya'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas chos rnams dag bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to purify the Buddha dharmas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
translated: the bodhisattva practices.

original: sgrub par byed pa tha mar brjod //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa tha mar brjod //
translated: Practice is expressed in the end.

original: dge gnyis thob par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dge gnyis thob par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain the two virtues,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
translated: the bodhisattva practices.

original: rtag tu sems can phan bya'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can phan bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to always benefit sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed //
translated: the bodhisattva practices.

original: ces thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: All of this is applied.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are those Buddha dharmas?

original: de'i phyir stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities, and so on.”

original: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, one should strive to attain all the qualities of a Buddha. Thus, it is called “cultivation.”

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Its emptiness is called “the emptiness of all phenomena.”

original: 'dir rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par bsgom pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhen /
translated: Here, what is called “cultivation”?

original: shes par bya ba la shes pa bar chad med par 'jug pa ste /🔽de ltar re zhig nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: shes par bya ba la shes pa bar chad med par 'jug pa ste / de ltar re zhig nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa nas /
translated: It is the uninterrupted engagement of cognition in what is to be cognized.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la thug gi bar du stong pa nyid bcu bzhi rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la thug gi bar du stong pa nyid bcu bzhi rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, up to here, one should understand the presentation of the fourteen emptinesses, beginning with the emptiness of internal phenomena and concluding with the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: za ba po la sogs pa 'di la stong pa nyid gang yin /
analyzed: za ba po la sogs pa 'di la stong pa nyid gang yin /
translated: What is the emptiness of the enjoyer and so on in this regard?

original: ngo bo nyid ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: de'i phyir / gang zag dang ni chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zag dang ni chos rnams kyi //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dngos po med 'dir stong pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po med 'dir stong pa nyid //
translated: Here, the emptiness of the non-existence of persons and things

original: de dngos po med pa'i dngos yod pa //
analyzed: de dngos po med pa'i dngos yod pa //
translated: And the existence of the non-existence of that

original: de la de nyid stong nyid gzhan //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la de nyid stong nyid gzhan // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Is another emptiness.

original: @217a * // de la ji skad de bshad pa'i zab po la sogs pa la gang zag dang chos kyi dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: @217a * // de la ji skad de bshad pa'i zab po la sogs pa la gang zag dang chos kyi dngos po med pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the non-existence of the person and things as they have been explained is emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa de'i dngos po yod pa yang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de'i dngos po yod pa yang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The existence of the non-existence of that is another emptiness.

original: da la gang zag dang chos dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: da la gang zag dang chos dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the non-existence of the person and things is the emptiness of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa de'i dngos po yod pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de'i dngos po yod pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The existence of the non-existence of that is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: 'di dag gi nang nas stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis ci'i phyir tha mar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang nas stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis ci'i phyir tha mar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the two kinds of emptiness set forth at the end among these?

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the characteristic of emptiness, he says:

original: stong pa nyid bstan pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bstan pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is emptiness taught?

original: de'i phyir gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid la skur pa 'debs pa bsal ba'i phyir go rims bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid la skur pa 'debs pa bsal ba'i phyir go rims bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the superimposition of persons and phenomena and the denial of their emptiness, he says, respectively.

original: gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i don du dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos su sgro 'dogs pa bsal ba'i don du dngos po med pa stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In order to eliminate the superimposition of persons and phenomena, the emptiness of non-things is presented.

original: de'i stong pa nyid la skur pa 'debs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid la skur pa 'debs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the denial of their emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of the non-entity of non-things is taught.

original: gal te dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ma brjod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ma brjod na /
translated: If the emptiness of non-things is not mentioned,

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo chos dang gang zag gnyis yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo chos dang gang zag gnyis yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the imagined nature of both persons and phenomena would exist.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma bshad na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ma bshad na /
translated: If the emptiness of the non-entity of non-things is not explained,

original: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the non-existence of emptiness would occur.

original: de med na yang gang zag chos gnyis snga ma bzhin du dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na yang gang zag chos gnyis snga ma bzhin du dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: If that does not exist, then both persons and phenomena would be things, as before.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nang gi skye mched byis pa rnams kyis za bar bsams pa rnams la /🔽za ba'i gang zag dang / brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa rnams med pa dang de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nang gi skye mched byis pa rnams kyis za bar bsams pa rnams la / za ba'i gang zag dang / brtags pa'i mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa rnams med pa dang de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the internal refers to the fact that the internal sense-fields, which are of the nature of the consciousness as retribution, are thought of by the childish as being the experiencer, and that the individual characteristics of the imaginary nature, such as the eye, etc., do not exist and that the existence of the non-entityness of that does exist.

original: phyi'i skye mched gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rig pa snang ba'i ngo bo nyid byis pa rnams kyis spyad par bya bar bsams pa rnams la bdag gis za ba dang / yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rig pa snang ba'i ngo bo nyid byis pa rnams kyis spyad par bya bar bsams pa rnams la bdag gis za ba dang / yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa dang /
translated: The emptiness of the external refers to the fact that the external sense-fields, such as form, etc., which are of the nature of the appearance of consciousness, are thought of by the childish as being the object of experience, and that the non-entityness of the imaginary nature, such as form, etc.,

original: de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: and the existence of the non-entityness of that does exist.

original: de'i lus te khog pa la za ba'i gang zag dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / lus kyi dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i lus te khog pa la za ba'i gang zag dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / lus kyi dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni phyi nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The person who eats the body, that is, the torso, the form, etc. that are imagined by the childish, the non-existence of the entity of the body, and the existence of the entity of that non-existence is the emptiness of external and internal phenomena.

original: snad kyi 'jig rten la sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po med pa dang / kun brtags pa @217b de rang gi ngo bos dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: snad kyi 'jig rten la sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po med pa dang / kun brtags pa @217b de rang gi ngo bos dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni chen po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of the entity of the world of sentient beings in the world of the environment, the non-existence by own nature of that imagined, and the existence of the entity of that non-existence is the emptiness of the great.

original: stong pa nyid shes pa dang don dam pa'i rnam pa la yang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa dang don dam pa'i rnam pa la yang /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is as follows:

original: shes pa po dang rnam pa 'dzin pa po'i gang zag dang / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid shes pa dang / don dam pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: shes pa po dang rnam pa 'dzin pa po'i gang zag dang / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid shes pa dang / don dam pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The person who knows emptiness and the aspects of the ultimate, the imagined characteristic of the knower of emptiness and the aspects of the ultimate, the non-existence of the entity of that, and the existence of the entity of that non-existence is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid de go rims bzhin no //🔽de ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed pa 'dus byas la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid de go rims bzhin no // de ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sgrub par byed pa 'dus byas la sogs pa nas /
translated: The ultimate is emptiness.🔽The emptiness of the conditioned and so on is to be understood in order,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la thug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bsgrub dgos pa rnams la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la thug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' bsgrub dgos pa rnams la /
translated: because the bodhisattva must accomplish the bodhisattva practices, from the conditioned and so on up to all the buddha qualities.

original: gang zag dang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni 'dus pas stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: gang zag dang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa dang / de'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po yod pa ni 'dus pas stong pa nyid nas /
translated: The non-existence of persons and the imagined nature in phenomena, and the existence of the non-existence of that in phenomena, is the emptiness of the composite and so on up to

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du go rims bzhin te /
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas la bdag po'am sbyor ba po'i gang zag kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas la bdag po'am sbyor ba po'i gang zag kyang med de /
translated: Thus, there is no person as the owner or the appropriator of the conditioned,

original: 'dus byas kyang byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med do //
translated: and the conditioned does not exist in the nature imagined by foolish beings.

original: mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzin pa thams cad kyi gnyen po dang / mdo sde'i dgongs pa thams cad lung bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzin pa thams cad kyi gnyen po dang / mdo sde'i dgongs pa thams cad lung bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In brief, it is the antidote to all conceptual grasping, and it is taught in order to reveal the intention of all the sūtras.

original: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa /
translated: It is not shared with the śrāvakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stong pa nyid bcu drug po 'di dag bshad do //
