analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stong pa nyid bcu drug po 'di dag bshad do //
translated: These sixteen kinds of emptiness of the bodhisattvas are explained.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid kyi yul dang / stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i dgos pa yang rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid kyi yul dang / stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i dgos pa yang rab tu bstan to //
translated: Here the Lord has also taught the domain of emptiness, the nature of emptiness, and the purpose of meditating on emptiness.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi yul ni za ba la sogs pa'i don nas sangs rgyas kyi chos la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi yul ni za ba la sogs pa'i don nas sangs rgyas kyi chos la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: Therein, the domain of emptiness is from the meaning of “eating” up to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de rab tu bstan pa yang stong pa nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rab tu bstan pa yang stong pa nyid kyis chos thams cad la khyab par shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And its revelation is in order to make known that emptiness pervades all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of emptiness is the nature of the insubstantiality of things and the nature of the substantiality of the insubstantial.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu bstan pa yang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen por lta ba thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i dgos pa ni dge ba gnyis thob par bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin rab tu bstan pa yang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen por lta ba thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du shes par byed pa'i phyir ro // stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i dgos pa ni dge ba gnyis thob par bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The teaching of the nature of emptiness is to be understood as the very transcendence of all views, as the antidote to the superimposition of existence and the denial of the reality of emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thob par bya ba'i bar du'o //🔽de bstan pa yang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzugs dang / chos kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog ni stong pa nyid @218a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thob par bya ba'i bar du'o // de bstan pa yang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzugs dang / chos kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog ni stong pa nyid @218a * //
translated: The purpose of cultivating emptiness is to attain the two virtues, beginning with the attainment of the virtues of the Disciples and the Rhinoceros-like, and continuing up to the attainment of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bsgom pa las 'thob po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa las 'thob po zhes rab tu bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The teaching of that is to be understood as the teaching that the supreme perfection of the Form Body and Dharma Body is attained from the cultivation of emptiness.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i dus na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus na rnam par dag go zhes bya ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa bcu drug tu gyur pa'i dbye ba bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i dus na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus na rnam par dag go zhes bya ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa bcu drug tu gyur pa'i dbye ba bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the classification of emptiness should be understood. This means that when it is associated with defilements, it is defiled, and when it is free of defilements, it is pure. And the sixteen aspects, such as emptiness of internal phenomena, etc., should be understood as the classification that has just been explained.

original: dbye ba smos pa'i 'og tu de sgrub pa smos pas dbye ba bshad pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: dbye ba smos pa'i 'og tu de sgrub pa smos pas dbye ba bshad pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After the classification, the establishment is mentioned. Therefore, after the explanation of the classification,

original: sgrub pa ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: sgrub pa ji ltar shes par bya zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: it is asked: “How should the establishment be understood?”

original: 'dir ci zhig pa sgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig pa sgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: Here, what is to be established?

original: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: Defilement due to adventitious secondary defilements and natural purity.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid bsgrub pa'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of establishing defilement,

original: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs de ma gyur //
translated: it is said: “If that defilement did not exist,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam par grol ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa de yang lam bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa de yang lam bsgoms pas so //
translated: And that abandonment of affliction is due to the cultivation of the path.

original: de la gal te gnyen po ma skyes par yang chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gal te gnyen po ma skyes par yang chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that regard, if the emptiness of phenomena were to occur without the arising of the antidote, then, as stated in the verse, “afflictions would not occur even when present, and liberation would occur without effort.”

original: yang gi sgra ni skyes pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni skyes pa dang 'dra bar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: The word “even” indicates that they would not be afflicted as if they had arisen.

original: de ltar gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas 'bad pa med par sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas 'bad pa med par sems can thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then because there would be no affliction, all sentient beings would be liberated without effort.

original: 'bad pa med par zhes bya ba ni gnyen po med pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa med par zhes bya ba ni gnyen po med pa nyid du ste /
translated: “Without effort” means without an antidote.

original: gnyen po med par ni srog chags rnams thar pa med do //
analyzed: gnyen po med par ni srog chags rnams thar pa med do //
translated: Without an antidote, living beings would not be liberated.

original: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i dus na /
translated: Therefore, at the time of being an ordinary being,

original: de bzhin nyid la glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la glo bur gyi dri ma rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
translated: Thus, it is definitely to be accepted that the suchness is thoroughly afflicted by the adventitious afflictions.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba kun nas nyon mongs pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba kun nas nyon mongs pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the differentiation of emptiness is established as the thoroughly afflicted.

original: da ni rab tu dbye ba rnam par dag pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rab tu dbye ba rnam par dag pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to establish the differentiation as the completely purified,🔽it is said:

original: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
analyzed: gal te rnam dag de ma gyur //
translated: If that were not purified,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽lus can rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so // lus can rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: then effort would be fruitless.

original: ci ste gnyen po skyes kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci ste gnyen po skyes kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word “if” is to be connected with “beings” and “arise” and “purified.”

original: kyang gi sgra ni ma skyes pa dang 'dra bar rnam par dag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni ma skyes pa dang 'dra bar rnam par dag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the afflictions were not purified even though the antidote arose,

original: de ltar gyur na ni thar par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni thar par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: then effort to attain liberation would be fruitless,

original: gnyen po bsgoms kyang dri ma de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dri ma dang bcas pa ni grol bar mi 'thad pa'i @218b phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgoms kyang dri ma de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dri ma dang bcas pa ni grol bar mi 'thad pa'i @218b phyir ro //
translated: because even though the antidote is cultivated, one would not be separated from those defilements, and it is not tenable that one is liberated while possessing defilements.

original: thar par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu med par mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: thar par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu med par mi 'dod pas /
translated: Because it is not maintained that the result is nonexistent in order to attain liberation.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po goms par byas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po goms par byas na /
translated: Therefore, when one cultivates the antidote,

original: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas /
analyzed: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas /
translated: one becomes free from adventitious secondary defilement.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
translated: Hence, one must certainly accept the purity of emptiness.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par dag pa bsgrubs pa yin no //🔽'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nye bar bzung bas kun nas nyon mongs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par dag pa bsgrubs pa yin no // 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos nye bar bzung bas kun nas nyon mongs pa la /
translated: Thus, the pure classification of emptiness is established.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos nye bar bzung ba rnam par dag gi / stong pa nyid la mngon du kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos nye bar bzung ba rnam par dag gi / stong pa nyid la mngon du kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am /
translated: Here, in regard to defilement, the dharmas of defilement are taken as the basis, and in regard to purity, the dharmas of purity are taken as the basis.🔽But emptiness is not maintained to be either defiled or

original: rnam par dag par mi mi 'dod de //
analyzed: rnam par dag par mi mi 'dod de //
translated: pure.

original: chos nyid ni chos kyi kha na las pas /🔽de'i phyir / lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos kyi kha na las pas / de'i phyir / lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: Because the reality of dharmas is not defiled by dharmas.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: All embodied beings will be liberated.

original: 'dir lus can zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lus can zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Here, “embodied beings” is explained as the cause of that.

original: gzhan du na gal te stong pa nyid la mngon du kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te stong pa nyid la mngon du kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, if emptiness were defiled

original: rnam par dag par gyur du zin na ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag par gyur du zin na ni /
translated: or purified,

original: de'i phyir lus can rnams dang 'brel pa ci yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus can rnams dang 'brel pa ci yod na /
translated: then what connection would it have with embodied beings?

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid rnam par dag pas lus can rnams rnam par dag pa dang / stong pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid rnam par dag pas lus can rnams rnam par dag pa dang / stong pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang /
translated: Thus, because emptiness is purified, embodied beings are purified, and because emptiness is defiled,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya /🔽gal te so so'i skye bo'i dus na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya / gal te so so'i skye bo'i dus na /
translated: they are defiled.

original: stong pa nyid nyon mongs la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyon mongs la /
translated: If emptiness were defiled when one is an ordinary being

original: 'phags pa'i dus na dag pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dus na dag pa yin na ni /
translated: and purified when one is a noble being,🔽then the following would be established:

original: de'i phyir / nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyon mongs ma yin mi mongs min ;
translated: It is neither defiled nor undefiled,

original: / de ni dag dang ma dag min //🔽zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ni dag dang ma dag min // zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: nor is it both pure and impure.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin la ma dag pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin la ma dag pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it neither defiled nor impure?

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis skabs su khong du chud par byed pas dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis skabs su khong du chud par byed pas dag pa nyid de /
translated: It is purified because it is understood through two negations.

original: 'dir lus dang sems rang bzhin gyis 'do gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir lus dang sems rang bzhin gyis 'do gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, it is said that the body and mind are naturally luminous.

original: 'dir ni sems kyi chos nyid la sems kyi sgar bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir ni sems kyi chos nyid la sems kyi sgar bshad de /
translated: Here, the reality of the mind is called the mind.

original: sems nyid ni dri ma'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽ji ltar nyon mongs par ma gyur pa ma yin pa yang ma yin la rnam par dag pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems nyid ni dri ma'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro // ji ltar nyon mongs par ma gyur pa ma yin pa yang ma yin la rnam par dag pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: The mind itself is the characteristic of the defilements.🔽How is it neither defiled nor purified?

original: nyon mongs pa nyid yin par dgag pa gnyis kyis khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid yin par dgag pa gnyis kyis khong du chud par byed do //
translated: It is understood through two negations, that it is not defiled and not purified.

original: de yang glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin zhes ston to //
analyzed: de yang glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin zhes ston to //
translated: Moreover, it is defiled by adventitious defilements, but not by its intrinsic nature.🔽It is taught that it is defiled by adventitious defilements.

original: de yang lung las glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang lung las glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said in the scriptures that it is defiled by adventitious secondary defilements.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa gnyis su bye ste bshad na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa gnyis su bye ste bshad na /
translated: Having distinguished and explained defilement and purification,

original: ci'i phyir dbye ba rnam pa bzhir bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbye ba rnam pa bzhir bshad ce na /
translated: why are they explained as having four divisions?

original: @219a * // kha cig na re 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @219a * // kha cig na re 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Some say: It is taught as distinct from the mundane and transcendent paths.

original: 'jig rten gyi lam ni rang gi sa'i dri ma rnams kyi nyon mongs kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lam ni rang gi sa'i dri ma rnams kyi nyon mongs kyi /
translated: The mundane path is the antidote to the defilements of its own stage,

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyir 'og mas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyir 'og mas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to those of lower stages.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni chung ngu dang / 'bring po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni ma dag gi / zag pa med pas ni dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni chung ngu dang / 'bring po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis ni ma dag gi / zag pa med pas ni dag pa ste /
translated: The transcendent path is pure, since it is uncontaminated, not impure, since it is distinguished by the categories of small, medium, etc.

original: stong pa nyid ni de lta ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de lta ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: But emptiness is not like that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa la /
translated: It is said that emptiness is not afflicted.

original: gzhan dag na re mig la sogs pa dang bye brag yod pas ma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mig la sogs pa dang bye brag yod pas ma dag pa yin no //
translated: Others say: It is impure, since it has distinctions such as eyes, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa ni ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pas nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
translated: Eyes, etc., are unobscured neutral states and thus are not affliction.

original: de dag gi zag pa dang bcas pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gi zag pa dang bcas pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since they are contaminated, they are not naturally pure.

original: ma dag pa yang ma yin zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ma dag pa yang ma yin zhes bshad do //
translated: and it is not impure.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa med pa yang ma yin zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa med pa yang ma yin zhes bshad pa la /
translated: Similarly, it is not without afflictions.

original: dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba dang bye brag yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not pure, because it is distinguished from contaminated virtue.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'khor bar gtogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa ma yin la /
translated: Since contaminated virtue belongs to cyclic existence, it is not without afflictions.

original: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong bas dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong bas dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure because its karmic maturation is pleasant.

original: chos nyid ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But reality is not like that.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa can yin la ma dag pa nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa can yin la ma dag pa nyid ces bshad do //
translated: It is said to be afflicted when it is in the state of affliction, and impure.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa bstan pa 'di bsgrubs pa yin no //🔽stong pa nyid kyi don bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa bstan pa 'di bsgrubs pa yin no // stong pa nyid kyi don bsdus pa ni /
translated: Thus, this teaching on the classification of emptiness as thoroughly afflicted and completely pure is established.

original: mtshan nyid dang rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary meaning of emptiness should be known as its characteristics and its arrangement.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la gnyis kyi dngos po med do zhes bshad pas dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la gnyis kyi dngos po med do zhes bshad pas dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic is the characteristic of non-existence and the characteristic of existence. Of these two, since it is said “non-existence,” it is the characteristic of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bshad pas dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i dngos po zhes bshad pas dngos po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since it is said “existence of non-existence,” it is the characteristic of existence.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin med pa'ang ma yin zhes bshad pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin med pa'ang ma yin zhes bshad pas /
translated: Since it is said “the characteristic of existence is neither existent nor non-existent,”

original: dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang / de nyid dang gzhan la rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid dang / de nyid dang gzhan la rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid de 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic is liberated from existence and non-existence, and liberated from identity and difference. This is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa dang tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not the characteristic of identity or difference with the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de ltar na mtshan @219b nyid kyi don bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan @219b nyid kyi don bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the characteristic is summarized.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i don bsdus pa ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i don bsdus pa ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one summarize the meaning of the establishment?

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam grangs la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam grangs la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “The establishment should be known as the establishment of the enumeration, etc.”

original: rnam grangs dang de'i don dang de'i dbye ba dang de sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang de'i don dang de'i dbye ba dang de sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the establishment of the enumeration, the meaning of that, the classification of that, and the proof of that.🔽By teaching these four aspects of the characteristics, the antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions is stated.🔽The antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions is stated as the antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions.

original: mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag bstan pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag bstan pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por /

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rigs pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin no // de la rnam par rtog ba'i gnyen por rang gi mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: de ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga dang / tha dad gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions is stated as the antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions.🔽The antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions is stated as the antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions.🔽The antidote to the four types of secondary mental afflictions is stated as the antidote to the four types of secondary mental

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid thos nas ma mos pa rnams kyis skrag par 'gyur ba de'i gnyen por las kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid thos nas ma mos pa rnams kyis skrag par 'gyur ba de'i gnyen por las kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of karma is the antidote for those who, having heard the characteristic of emptiness, are frightened by it.

original: ma nor bde bzhin nyid kyi las dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i las dang / mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa'i las dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi yul nyid du gnas pa'i las dang / dmigs pa na 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'i dngos po'i las so //
analyzed: ma nor bde bzhin nyid kyi las dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i las dang / mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa'i las dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thams cad kyi yul nyid du gnas pa'i las dang / dmigs pa na 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'i dngos po'i las so //
translated: It is the karma of non-erroneous reality, the karma of non-inverted reality, the karma of the abandonment of all signs, the karma of the domain of all supramundane gnoses, and the karma of the cause of the Dharma of the noble ones in the object.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang las thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa le lo can rnams kyi le lo bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang las thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa le lo can rnams kyi le lo bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, in order to remove the laziness of the lazy who are satisfied with merely hearing the essence and karma of emptiness,

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: there is the characteristic of the divisions.

original: de ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur rnam par dag par 'gyur snyam pa'i som nyi za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir rigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur rnam par dag par 'gyur snyam pa'i som nyi za ba rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir rigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In order to remove the doubts of those who doubt, “How is it that it becomes afflicted? How does it become pure?” there is the characteristic of reasoning.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pas mtshan nyid kyi le'ur bcad pa ste dang por 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pas mtshan nyid kyi le'ur bcad pa ste dang por 'grel bshad do /
translated: The first chapter of the treatise, the Madhyantavibhanga, is called the chapter on the characteristics.

original: // / mtshan nyid bshad pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / mtshan nyid bshad pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa bshad pa'i skabs yin te /
translated: The section on the explanation of the practice comes after the explanation of the characteristics.

original: de'i 'og tu snos pas de'i phyir sgrib pa'i dbang du mdzad de zhes bya ba smos so//🔽khyab dang nyi tshe lhag pa dang // mnyam pa dang len pa dang spong ba ni //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snos pas de'i phyir sgrib pa'i dbang du mdzad de zhes bya ba smos so// khyab dang nyi tshe lhag pa dang // mnyam pa dang len pa dang spong ba ni //
translated: Since it is the next one, it is said, “in terms of the obscurations.”

original: gnyis kyi sgrib par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis kyi sgrib par bstan pa yin //
translated: The obscurations of the two are taught as🔽pervading, limited, additional,🔽equal, accepting, and rejecting.

original: gnyis po dag gi sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po dag gi sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The practice of the two is the obscurations of those who have the lineage of the bodhisattva and those who have the lineage of the śrāvaka and so on.

original: bsgrib par bya ba'i don tha dad pas sgrib pa tha @220a * //
analyzed: bsgrib par bya ba'i don tha dad pas sgrib pa tha @220a * //
translated: Since the objects to be obscured are different, the obscurations are taught as different.

original: dad par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir le'u 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: dad par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir le'u 'di brtsams so //
translated: This chapter is composed for that purpose.

original: de la khyab pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pas khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de la khyab pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pas khyab pa ste /
translated: As for the pervasion, it is the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience of those who belong to the lineage of bodhisattvas.🔽It is a pervasion because it pervades,

original: don mtha' dag la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mtha' dag la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obstructs all objects.

original: don mtha' dag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: don mtha' dag gi don dang gzhan gyi don to //
translated: All objects are the object of the self and the object of others.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam gnyis btags pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa la khyab par byed pas khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam gnyis btags pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa la khyab par byed pas khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the two obstructions, the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, are called pervasions because they pervade the obstructions of bodhisattvas.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pas ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pas ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: They are obstructions because they are obstructions.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid kyi chos kho nar 'dra bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid kyi chos kho nar 'dra bas /
translated: They are obstructions because they are afflictions.

original: 'dir ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrar gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrar gzung ngo //
translated: Here, secondary afflictions are also included in the term afflictions.

original: gzhan du na ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu zhes bya bar phrag dog dang ser sna gnyis gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu zhes bya bar phrag dog dang ser sna gnyis gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the phrase “the nine aspects of the characteristics of the afflictions” would not include both envy and avarice.

original: de gnyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are secondary defilements.

original: shes bya ba la sgrib pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya ba la sgrib pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: It is an obscuration of the knowable because it obscures the knowable.

original: des shes bya rab tu bsgribs pas shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //🔽yang na shes bya la ye shes kyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: des shes bya rab tu bsgribs pas shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro // yang na shes bya la ye shes kyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Since it obscures the knowable, it does not become the object of knowledge.

original: shes spar bya ba la ye shes skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes spar bya ba la ye shes skye ba'i bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, it is an obscuration of the knowledge of the knowable because it is an impediment to the arising of knowledge in regard to what is to be known.

original: shes bya dang sgrib pa'i bar gyi tshig ma smos par mar gyi bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes bya dang sgrib pa'i bar gyi tshig ma smos par mar gyi bum pa bzhin no //
translated: The words “of the knowable” and “obscuration” are omitted, just as in the expression “jar of butter”.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o ;
translated: Moreover, it is a non-defiled nescience.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyis /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyis /
translated: For those who belong to the spiritual lineage of the bodhisattva,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun du byung ba thob pas sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnams pa thams cad kun la nan tan du bya ba de la gnyi ga yang bgegs su gyur bas de'i phyir de byang chub
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun du byung ba thob pas sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnams pa thams cad kun la nan tan du bya ba de la gnyi ga yang bgegs su gyur bas de'i phyir de byang chub
translated: the accumulation of merit and knowledge in regard to the practice of all the aspects is an aid to the attainment of Buddhahood because it brings about the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals. Since both of these are obstructed by nescience, it is said that nescience is an obscuration in regard to the accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The obscurations of those who belong to the spiritual lineage of the bodhisattva are described as being all-pervading.

original: de la khyab pa ni thams cad yul yin la mtha' dag ces bya ba ni rnam par thams cad la bya na /
analyzed: de la khyab pa ni thams cad yul yin la mtha' dag ces bya ba ni rnam par thams cad la bya na /
translated: If the term 'all' refers to the entire range of objects and the term 'pervading' to the entire range of aspects,

original: ji ltar mtha' dag gis khyab par shes par byed par 'gyur zhe na /🔽mtha' dag gi phyir de khyab pa'i sgrib par brjod de rgyur bstan pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mtha' dag gis khyab par shes par byed par 'gyur zhe na / mtha' dag gi phyir de khyab pa'i sgrib par brjod de rgyur bstan pas 'gyur ro //
translated: how can it be known that the entire range of objects is pervaded by the entire range of aspects?🔽It is said that it is pervaded by the entire range of aspects because it is taught as the cause of the entire range of aspects.

original: yang na khyab pa'i sgra ni ma lus pa'i don du bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dag gi phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: yang na khyab pa'i sgra ni ma lus pa'i don du bstan pa'i phyir mtha' dag gi phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Alternatively, the term 'all' is mentioned because the term 'pervading' is taught to have the sense of 'entire'.

original: nyi tshe ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The obscurations of those who belong to the spiritual lineage of the śrāvaka etc. are partial.

original: bdag gi don tsam la sgrib pas sgrib par btags pa dang khyab pa @220b ma yin pa'i phyir nyi tshe ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don tsam la sgrib pas sgrib par btags pa dang khyab pa @220b ma yin pa'i phyir nyi tshe ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are described as 'partial' because they are designated as obscurations since they obscure only the benefit of self and because they are not all-pervading.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa med dam zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa med dam zhe na /
translated: Do sravakas and pratyekabuddhas not have nonafflicted ignorance?

original: 'di ltar de dag la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If so, then how can they be posited as having only the afflictive obstructions?

original: yod mod kyi de ni de dag gi sgrib pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod mod kyi de ni de dag gi sgrib pa ma yin te /
translated: They do have that, but it is not an obstruction for them,

original: de yod bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod bzhin du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they attain the enlightenment of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas while it still exists.

original: mi shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul la /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i yul la /
translated: Ignorance is not an obstruction to the knowledge of suffering, etc.🔽It is not an obstruction to the knowledge of suffering, etc.,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i bgegs su gyur pa yang ma yin nam /🔽de bas na de dag la yang sgrib pa gnyi ga yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'i bgegs su gyur pa yang ma yin nam / de bas na de dag la yang sgrib pa gnyi ga yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it does not prevent the arising of the knowledge of suffering, etc., in sravakas, etc.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kho na'o zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kho na'o zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it should not be said that sravakas and pratyekabuddhas have only the afflictive obstructions.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te ma rig pa ni nyon mongs spar gyur pa dang / rig pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te ma rig pa ni nyon mongs spar gyur pa dang / rig pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: That is not so, because ignorance is a root of the defilements, it is a root of the wholesome, and it is the root of cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: Therefore, it is established as the obscuration that is the defilements.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the obscuration that is the knowable.

original: so ma nyi bzhin no //
analyzed: so ma nyi bzhin no //
translated: It is like the example of the sun.

original: dper na sdug bsngal gyi tshogs kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal gyi tshogs kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, because of the differentiation of the collection of suffering,

original: de dag gi sgrib pa ni shes nyon mongs pa zhes bya'i yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi sgrib pa ni shes nyon mongs pa zhes bya'i yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: the obscuration to those is called the defilement obscuration, but not the obscuration to another object.

original: yul gzhan la ni som nyi nyid de /
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni som nyi nyid de /
translated: Doubt is in regard to another object.

original: nyon mongs pa yang ma yin the tshom yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang ma yin the tshom yang ma yin no //
translated: It is neither a defilement nor doubt.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i yul gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i yul gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, ignorance and the defilements are in regard to the objects of the truth of suffering, etc., but not in regard to another object called the obscuration that is the knowable.

original: yul gzhan la ni mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni mi shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: Ignorance is in regard to another object.

original: ma rig pa'am ma yin nyon mongs pa'am ma yin no //🔽de lta bas na de ni shes par bya ba la ye shes tsam 'jug pa la sgrib pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'am ma yin nyon mongs pa'am ma yin no // de lta bas na de ni shes par bya ba la ye shes tsam 'jug pa la sgrib pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not ignorance, nor is it the afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the obstacle to that which is to be known, because it obstructs the mere entry of knowledge into that which is to be known.

original: ma rig pa ltar nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe rnams kyang 'byung rba ni yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ltar nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe rnams kyang 'byung rba ni yin no //
translated: It is not like ignorance, nor is it the karma and life of those who are afflicted.

original: gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib par rnam par mi gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib par rnam par mi gzhag go zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the obstacle to that which is to be known is not posited as an obstacle for bodhisattvas.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thos pa'i tshogs kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thos pa'i tshogs kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: because bodhisattvas are distinguished by their collection of hearing.

original: de dag gi sgrib pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrib pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Their obstacle is the obstacle to that which is to be known.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
translated: Without striving in the five sciences,

original: 'phags mchog cis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'phags mchog cis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
translated: the supreme aryas will not become omniscient.

original: de bas gzhan dag tshar gcod rjes su gzung phyir ram //
analyzed: de bas gzhan dag tshar gcod rjes su gzung phyir ram //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute others and to be understood🔽by oneself,

original: rang gis shes par bya @221a * //
analyzed: rang gis shes par bya @221a * //
translated: one should strive in the five sciences.

original: phyir de la de brtson byed //
analyzed: phyir de la de brtson byed //
translated: One should strive in that.🔽

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: One should strive to eliminate it.

original: lhag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po chung yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can de dag la shas che ba dang rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po chung yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can de dag la shas che ba dang rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The excess is the greater and more frequent occurrence of desire, etc. in those who have the lineage of the bodhisattva, and in those who have the lineage of the śrāvaka, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the obscuration of those who practice desire, etc.

original: su dag yul ngan pa la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa gang yang rung ba shas che ba dang / rgyun du 'byung ba de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: su dag yul ngan pa la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa gang yang rung ba shas che ba dang / rgyun du 'byung ba de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who have a greater and more frequent occurrence of any of the desires, etc. even with regard to inferior objects, are those who practice desire, etc.

original: mnyam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can de dag nyid kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can de dag nyid kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: The equality is the obscuration of those who have the lineage of the bodhisattva and of those who have the lineage of the śrāvaka, etc.

original: mnyam pa ni de gnyi ga'i rnam pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni de gnyi ga'i rnam pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Equality is because there is no difference between the two.

original: cha mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cha mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the obscuration of those who practice equally.

original: su dag yul dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa skye'i /
analyzed: su dag yul dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa skye'i /
translated: Who are those who are like the land, giving rise to afflictions?🔽

original: rgyun du ni ma yin pa de dag ni cha mtshungs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du ni ma yin pa de dag ni cha mtshungs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who are like a country, in that the afflictions arise in them but not continuously, are “those who are like a part.🔽”

original: 'khor ba len pa dang gtong ba'i sgrib pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba len pa dang gtong ba'i sgrib pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The obscurations to taking up and abandoning samsara are the obscurations to the perfection of skill in means.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i dbang gis 'khor ba nye bar len pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis 'khor ba'i nyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje'i dbang gis 'khor ba nye bar len pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis 'khor ba'i nyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, through the power of compassion, takes up samsara and, through the power of wisdom, sees the faults of samsara as they are.

original: stong pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par sems can la lta bas skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: stong pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par sems can la lta bas skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Therefore, by emptiness, he takes up birth through his regard for sentient beings, which is free of afflictions.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: This is nonabiding nirvana,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not abide in either samsara or nirvana.

original: de'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pas non bzhin du 'khor ba nye bar len pa dang / nyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas snying rje med par 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pas non bzhin du 'khor ba nye bar len pa dang / nyes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas snying rje med par 'khor ba yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Its obscuration is the appropriation of cyclic existence while being oppressed by afflictions, and its fault is the abandonment of cyclic existence without compassion, after seeing its faults as they are.

original: gzhan dag na re snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyi bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mi shes pa ni 'dir sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyi bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mi shes pa ni 'dir sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say that ignorance is called an obscuration here because it is an obstruction to both compassion and wisdom.

original: yang na ji ltar dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po las /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po las /
translated: Or, as it is taught in the Great Heap of Jewels:

original: de'i bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la yang gnas la /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la yang gnas la /
translated: His thought abides in nirvana,

original: 'khor ba na yang sbyor bar gnas pa zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na yang sbyor bar gnas pa zhes bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: but his practice abides in cyclic existence.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the nonabiding nirvana of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis bltas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis bltas pa'i phyir /
translated: Therein, because of turning one's back on nirvana,

original: bsam pa dang sbyor bas 'khor ba la len te /
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor bas 'khor ba la len te /
translated: one takes up cyclic existence with thought and practice,

original: rigs med pa'i sems can bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs med pa'i sems can bzhin no //
translated: like a sentient being of the lineage of the incapable.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba la rgyab @221b kyis bltas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba la rgyab @221b kyis bltas pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, they give up cyclic existence by both attitude and application, since they turn their back on cyclic existence.🔽They give up cyclic existence by both attitude and application, since they turn their back on cyclic existence.🔽They give up cyclic existence by both attitude and application, since they turn their back on cyclic existence.

original: mya ngan las 'das par song ba'i bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gnyis kyis 'khor ba yang yongs su gtong ste /🔽nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽de ltar 'khor ba len pa dang de gtong ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par song ba'i bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gnyis kyis 'khor ba yang yongs su gtong ste / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams ji lta ba bzhin no // de ltar 'khor ba len pa dang de gtong ba yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa ste /
