analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las mtha' gcig tu ltung ba'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang chos kyi sku rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir /
translated: They give up cyclic existence by both attitude and application, since they turn their back on cyclic existence.🔽They give up cyclic

original: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas te /
translated: They do not dwell in nirvana like the sravakas and so on.

original: de ltar na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga la yang mi gnas so //
translated: Thus, they do not dwell in either cyclic existence or nirvana.🔽Here, these five obscurations are in order the obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / de gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bgegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag grangs bzhin no //🔽de ltar 'di dag ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du'o //🔽de la dang po dang tha ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam dang / de gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bgegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag grangs bzhin no // de ltar 'di dag ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthun mthun du'o // de la dang po dang tha ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.

original: dang 'og ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o //🔽gzhan gnyis ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: dang 'og ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyi sgrib pa'o // gzhan gnyis ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.🔽Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to nonabiding nirvana.

original: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib par bshad de /
analyzed: de la shes bya'i sgrib pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib par bshad de /
translated: Thus, these are obscurations to the bodhisattvas path and to the sravakas and so on path, to the application of both, to the result of both and to

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Moreover, it is understood to be non-defiled nescience.

original: gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la rnam pa du yod pa dang / rang bzhin ji lta bu dang gang gi bgegs su gyur pa mi shes te /🔽de'i phyir / nyon mongs mtshan nyid rnam dgu'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la rnam pa du yod pa dang / rang bzhin ji lta bu dang gang gi bgegs su gyur pa mi shes te / de'i phyir / nyon mongs mtshan nyid rnam dgu'o //
translated: One does not understand the afflictive obstructions that are obstructions to both in terms of how many kinds there are, what their individual natures are, and what they obstruct.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, The afflictions have nine characteristics.

original: sgrib ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrib ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Obstructions should be supplied.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The characteristics of the afflictions are the natures of the afflictions.

original: rnam pa dgu po de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the nine kinds?

original: de'i phyir kun du sbyor rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du sbyor rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, The fetters.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: They are fetters because they fetter one to various sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyang 'dod pa dang / gzugs @222a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyang 'dod pa dang / gzugs @222a * //
translated: Various sufferings are bodies included in the desire,

original: dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i lus te /
analyzed: dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i lus te /
translated: form, and formless realms.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de khams gsum dang ci rigs su sbyar ro //🔽de yang rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba nas /🔽ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de khams gsum dang ci rigs su sbyar ro // de yang rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba nas / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The three kinds of suffering are the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.🔽The fetters are the fetter of attachment, the fetter of repugnance, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the fetter of views, the fetter of jealousy, and the fetter of avarice.

original: de la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: de la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Herein, repugnance is hatred.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Jealousy is the inability to bear another’s success.

original: ser sna ni yo byad kun 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni yo byad kun 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Avarice is the grasping at possessions.

original: de gsum ni 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gsum ni 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
translated: These three are only in the realm of desire.

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni khams gsum gyi sred pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni khams gsum gyi sred pa'o //
translated: The fetter of attachment is craving in the three realms.🔽Similarly, the fetters of pride, ignorance, views, and grasping are in the three realms.

original: de bzhin du nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams ni khams gsum pa dag nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams ni khams gsum pa dag nyid do //
translated: The fetter of doubt is in the realms of desire and form.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba rnams ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / log par lta ba rnams ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and false views are the fetters of views.

original: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The overesteeming of mere morality and ascetic practice,

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: and the overesteeming of mere personal view are the fetters of esteem.

original: the tshom ni bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o //🔽gzhan khong khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom ni bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o // gzhan khong khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / nyon mongs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty about the truths and the Three Jewels.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: The other secondary afflictions such as anger are also the obscurations of affliction because they are the natural outflow of the afflictions and they become the afflictions.

original: phrag dog dang ser sna ni gtso bo yin pas kun du sbyor bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna ni gtso bo yin pas kun du sbyor bar bzung ngo //
translated: Envy and avarice are considered fetters because they are the principal ones.

original: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang 'di skad ces /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: koo shi ka lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Kausika, the fetters of gods and humans are envy and avarice.

original: de dag kyang gang la sgrib pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang la sgrib pa yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: skyo ba dang ni btang snyoms dang / de kho na ni mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: skyo ba dang ni btang snyoms dang / de kho na ni mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Discouragement, equanimity, and the vision of reality.

original: skyo ba ni yid 'byung ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: skyo ba ni yid 'byung ba'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: Discouragement is a synonym for disgust.

original: de bas na rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni kun du skyo ba la sgrib po zhes bya ba smos te /🔽des lus dang 'tsho ba dang / longs spyod dang bu smad la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzug med pa rnams la yang rjes su chags pas /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni kun du skyo ba la sgrib po zhes bya ba smos te / des lus dang 'tsho ba dang / longs spyod dang bu smad la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzug med pa rnams la yang rjes su chags pas /
translated: Therefore, it is said: the fetter of attachment is an obscuration to discouragement.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis nyen yang khams gsum la mi skyo'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis nyen yang khams gsum la mi skyo'o //
translated: Because of that, one is not discouraged by the sufferings of cyclic existence, since one is attached to the body, to possessions, to wife, children, and so on, and to the meditative absorptions and formless attainments.

original: khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni btang snyoms la sgrib ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni btang snyoms la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of hostility is an obscuration to equanimity.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so? Therefore, it is said:

original: des ni mi mthun pa zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: des ni mi mthun pa zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: by that, one is hostile.

original: yid @222b mi bde ba'i rgyu yin pas mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yid @222b mi bde ba'i rgyu yin pas mi mthun pa'o //
translated: It is hostile because it is the cause of mental unease.

original: khong khro ba'i gzhi ste khong khro ba'i rgyu la btang snyoms su byed cing mngon du mi byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i gzhi ste khong khro ba'i rgyu la btang snyoms su byed cing mngon du mi byed par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot be indifferent to the basis of anger, the cause of anger, and not manifest anger.

original: rjes su chags pa'i gzhi ni mi mthun pa med pas btang snyoms su mi nus pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i gzhi ni mi mthun pa med pas btang snyoms su mi nus pa ni /
translated: One cannot be indifferent to the basis of attachment, because there is no incompatibility.

original: rigs kyi khong khro ba'i gzhi ni mi mthun pa la yang khong khro ba ste ;
analyzed: rigs kyi khong khro ba'i gzhi ni mi mthun pa la yang khong khro ba ste ;
translated: The basis of anger is incompatibility.

original: btang snyoms su byed mi nus pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms su byed mi nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: One cannot be indifferent to that, because one cannot be indifferent to the basis of anger.

original: rjes su chags pa bas sdig che bar bstan pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa bas sdig che bar bstan pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word “also” is used to show that anger is a greater evil than attachment.

original: mnyam par 'jog pa na gal te 'du byed kyi btang snyoms thob na /
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa na gal te 'du byed kyi btang snyoms thob na /
translated: If one attains the equanimity of formative influence while in equipoise,

original: de ltar de'i sems mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de'i sems mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the mind becomes even.

original: gal te de'i khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor bshas che bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor bshas che bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the fetter of anger is strong,

original: de'i dbang gis khong khro ba'i rgyu de la btang snyoms mi thob ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis khong khro ba'i rgyu de la btang snyoms mi thob ste /
translated: then one does not attain equanimity toward the cause of anger.

original: de byung na bdag gi dmigs pa la gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byung na bdag gi dmigs pa la gdon mi za bar dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arises, then the object is certainly grasped.

original: de ltar rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor bas ni dben pa nyid mi 'thob po //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor bas ni dben pa nyid mi 'thob po //
translated: Thus, one does not attain solitude because of the fetter of passion.

original: khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor bas ni dben par gyur kyang ting nge 'dzin mi 'thob po //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor bas ni dben par gyur kyang ting nge 'dzin mi 'thob po //
translated: Even if one has attained solitude, one does not attain concentration because of the fetter of hostility.

original: lhag ma bdun po ni de kho na mthong ba la sgrib ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma bdun po ni de kho na mthong ba la sgrib ces bya ba ni /
translated: The remaining seven fetters are obscurations to the vision of reality.

original: ma nor bar mthong ba la sgrib po //
analyzed: ma nor bar mthong ba la sgrib po //
translated: They are obscurations to the vision of reality as it is.🔽How so?

original: ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi shes te dri ba'o //🔽de'i phyir de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi shes te dri ba'o // de'i phyir de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: The following is stated in order:

original: 'jig tshogs lta dang de'i gzhi dang // zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs lta dang de'i gzhi dang // zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: the afflicted view of the self, the basis of that,

original: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa la bsgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa la bsgrib pa yin no //
translated: The fetter of pride is an obscuration to the complete understanding of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal te /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal te /
translated: In this regard, pride is the inflation of the mind that is dependent on the afflicted view of the self.

original: de yang nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de yang nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa rnam pa bdun no //
translated: Moreover, it is sevenfold: pride, excessive pride, etc.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis dben par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis dben par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The thorough knowledge of the view of the transitory collection is the seeing of the selflessness of the person and the seeing of the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa'o //🔽de'i sgrib pa ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa'o // de'i sgrib pa ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The thorough knowledge of the view of the transitory collection is the seeing of the selflessness of the person and the seeing of the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽The fetter of pride is its obstruction,

original: de skye ba la ba gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba la ba gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obstructs the arising of the thorough knowledge of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de yang gang gi tshe ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: When and how is that?

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par kun du 'byung ba'i dbang gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med par kun du 'byung ba'i dbang gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because the pride thinking ‘I am’ that occurs with and without interruption at the time of clear realization is not abandoned.”

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs @223a * //🔽pa'i dus ni /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs @223a * // pa'i dus ni /
translated: The time of clear realization of the truths

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dus so //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dus so //
translated: is the time of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de la bar chad dang bcas pa ni gnyen pos bar du chod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bar chad dang bcas pa ni gnyen pos bar du chod pa'o //
translated: That which is accompanied by obstacles is interrupted by its antidote.

original: bar chad med pa ni gnyen pos bar du ma chod pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa ni gnyen pos bar du ma chod pa ste /
translated: That which is without obstacles is not interrupted by its antidote.

original: de yang gnyen po che ba dang chung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gnyen po che ba dang chung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the antidote is either greater or lesser.

original: ji srid du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du 'byung ba de srid du 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba med de /
analyzed: ji srid du nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du 'byung ba de srid du 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba med de /
translated: As long as the conceit “I am” occurs, accompanied by obstacles and without obstacles, there is no abandonment of the view of the transitory composite.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i stobs kyis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceit “I am” occurs by the power of the view of the transitory composite.

original: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
translated: The fetter of ignorance

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
translated: obstructs the thorough knowledge of the basis of the view of the transitory composite.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i gzhi ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i gzhi ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams te /
translated: The basis of the view of the transitory composite is the five appropriative aggregates,

original: de la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises with reference to them.

original: mdo'i sde las kyang ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo'i sde las kyang ji skad du /
translated: And in the sutra it says:🔽“What is the fetter of ignorance?

original: dge sbyong bram ze gang la la bdag dang bdag gi rjes su lta ba na /
analyzed: dge sbyong bram ze gang la la bdag dang bdag gi rjes su lta ba na /
translated: The Buddha said: Monks, brahmins, and others who view the self and what belongs to the self view the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la brten nas rjes su blta'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la brten nas rjes su blta'o //
translated: They view them in dependence on the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to zhes gsungs so //
translated: When they view them, they view them as the self or what belongs to the self.

original: yongs su shes pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the aggregates?🔽It is the knowledge that the aggregates are empty of a self and what belongs to the self, and that they are empty of the intrinsic nature imagined by the naïve.

original: phung po rnams la bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: phung po rnams la bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid dang / byis pa'i skye bos kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du mthong ba gang yin pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the knowledge that the aggregates are impermanent, painful, and without a self.

original: kun 'byung ba la sogs par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de dag yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la sogs par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de dag yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that the aggregates are the origin of suffering, etc.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa des nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa des nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddha said: Because of not thoroughly knowing the aggregates, the appropriation of the aggregates occurs.

original: ma rig pas brtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bsgribs pa'i phung po rnams la de yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pas brtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bsgribs pa'i phung po rnams la de yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aggregates are obscured by the aspects of investigation, etc.

original: ma rig pa ni phung po yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //🔽lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni phung po yongs su shes pa la sgrib po // lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
translated: Ignorance is the obscuration to the thorough knowledge of the aggregates.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
translated: The fetter of views is the obscuration to the thorough knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni lta ba la gsum ste ;
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni lta ba la gsum ste ;
translated: The fetter of views is threefold:

original: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba rnams so //🔽de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba rnams so // de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni /
translated: the view of the transitory aggregates, extreme views, and false views.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag gam bdag gir lta ba'o //🔽mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bdag tu mngon par brtag pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la bdag gam bdag gir lta ba'o // mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni bdag tu mngon par brtag pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am /
translated: The view of the transitory aggregates is the view of the five aggregates subject to clinging as a self or as something pertaining to a self.

original: @223b chad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: @223b chad par lta ba'o //
translated: Extreme views are the view of the very same thing imagined as a self as eternal or as subject to annihilation.

original: lta ba gang gi rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa'am /
analyzed: lta ba gang gi rgyu'am 'bras bu'am byed pa'am /
translated: False views are those views which deny causes, results, or actual entities,🔽or which distort the four noble truths.

original: yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa dang / log par kun du rtog pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa dang / log par kun du rtog pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the denial of existent things.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
translated: The knowledge of the truth of cessation is the aspects of peace, etc.

original: ji ltar de ni de la sgrib can /
analyzed: ji ltar de ni de la sgrib can /
translated: How is it an obscuration in regard to that?

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyis de la skrag pa dang / log par lta bas de la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyis de la skrag pa dang / log par lta bas de la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Hence he says: because of fear of that and because of the denial of that, respectively, through the two views of individuality and the two extremes and through the false view.

original: de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag gis bdag der med par 'gyur ro zhes 'gog pa la skrag par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag gis bdag der med par 'gyur ro zhes 'gog pa la skrag par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therein, through the two views of individuality and the two extremes, one is afraid of cessation, thinking: ‘the self will be annihilated’.

original: / log par lta bas kyang 'gog pa med do zhes skur pa 'debs so //
analyzed: / log par lta bas kyang 'gog pa med do zhes skur pa 'debs so //
translated: And through the false view, one denies cessation, thinking: ‘cessation does not exist’.

original: de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta bdag gis zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung bar yongs su mi shes la /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta bdag gis zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung bar yongs su mi shes la /
translated: Therein, through the two views of individuality and the two extremes, one does not understand the aspects of peace, excellence, definitive liberation and definitive release.

original: log par lta bas 'gog par yongs su mi shes te de ltar lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni 'gog pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib pa'o //🔽mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: log par lta bas 'gog par yongs su mi shes te de ltar lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni 'gog pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib pa'o // mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
translated: The fetter of views is the obscuration to the full understanding of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa la yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste zhes bya ba de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni /
translated: The fetter of clinging is the obscuration to the full understanding of the path.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin ba'o ;🔽/ de la lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin ba'o ; / de la lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The fetter of clinging is the fetter of clinging to false views and the fetter of clinging to mere rules and rituals.

original: lta ba dang lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la mchog la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa'o //🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /🔽tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: lta ba dang lta ba'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la mchog la sogs par lta ba gang yin pa'o // tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni / tshul khrims sam /
translated: Clinging to false views is the view that regards false views and the five aggregates that are the basis of false views as supreme.

original: brtul zhugs sam /🔽de gnyi ga'am /
analyzed: brtul zhugs sam / de gnyi ga'am /
translated: Clinging to mere rules and rituals is the view that regards mere rules and rituals and the five aggregates that are the basis of mere rules and rituals as supreme.

original: de dag gi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la /
translated: Clinging to false views is the view that regards false views and the five aggregates that are the basis of false views as supreme.🔽Clinging to mere rules and rituals is the view that regards mere rules and rituals and the five aggregates that are the basis of mere rules and rituals as supreme.

original: dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byin par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa dang grol ba dang / nges par 'byin par yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i lta ba gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that is the view of purity, liberation, and definite release is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: lam yongs su shes pa yang nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam yongs su shes pa yang nges par 'byin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the aspects of definite release, and so on.

original: ji ltar na mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba lam yongs su shes pa la sgrib ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba lam yongs su shes pa la sgrib ce na /
translated: How does the fetter of holding a view as paramount obstruct the knowledge of the path?

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan gyis dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “because one holds as paramount a purity that is based on another aspect.”

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis sam /🔽'dod pa'i bde ba'i @224a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis sam / 'dod pa'i bde ba'i @224a * //
translated: One holds as paramount a purity that is based on mere morality and asceticism,

original: gnas kyis sam /
analyzed: gnas kyis sam /
translated: or on the abode of the pleasure of desire,

original: dka' ba spyod pas sam /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pas sam /
translated: or on the practice of austerities,

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i shes pas dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i shes pas dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or on the knowledge of the Sāṃkhya and so on.

original: lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang gang gis dag par yid ches pa de nyid dam par mchog tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pas kyang gang gis dag par yid ches pa de nyid dam par mchog tu 'dzin to //
translated: Also, through holding a view as paramount, one holds as paramount that very view by which one believes in purity.

original: de ltar na mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor bas lam bor te rnam pa gzhan gyis dag par mchog tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ltar na mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor bas lam bor te rnam pa gzhan gyis dag par mchog tu 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, one abandons the path by the fetter of holding as paramount and holds as paramount by another aspect.

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of doubt obscures complete understanding of the Three Jewels.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How so? Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i yon tan la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i yon tan la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because one does not have full confidence in their virtues.

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni bden pa de dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni bden pa de dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
translated: The fetter of doubt is a state of two-mindedness about those truths and the Three Jewels.

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog la yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad phul du phyin pa dang / bsal ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnas su yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog la yon tan dang nyes pa thams cad phul du phyin pa dang / bsal ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnas su yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One completely understands the Buddha Jewel as the culmination of all virtues and the absence of all faults.

original: chos dkon mchog la 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dang gtan du bral ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog la 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dang gtan du bral ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: One completely understands the Dharma Jewel as that which liberates from the ocean of cyclic existence and is the nature of the complete absence of suffering and its causes.

original: de khong du chud par byed par yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de khong du chud par byed par yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One completely understands the Saṅgha Jewel as that which is endowed with the wisdom that realizes the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / der zhugs pa dang / bla na med pa'i sbyin gnas kyi zhing yin par yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu la gnas pa dang / der zhugs pa dang / bla na med pa'i sbyin gnas kyi zhing yin par yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One understands the Jewel of the Saṅgha as the field of merit par excellence, as the abode of the fruits of the religious praxis, and as the abode of those who have entered upon that [fruit].

original: bden pa dang mthong ba dang the tshom spang ba'i phyir shes nas dad pa rnyed pas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan la mngon par yid ches kyi the tshom ma spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa dang mthong ba dang the tshom spang ba'i phyir shes nas dad pa rnyed pas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan la mngon par yid ches kyi the tshom ma spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One obtains faith through understanding, because of the abandonment of doubt with regard to the Truths and the Path. One has confidence in the qualities of the Three Jewels, but one has not abandoned doubt.

original: de'i phyir the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the fetter of doubt is said to obscure the understanding of the Three Jewels.

original: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib ces bya'o //
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib ces bya'o //
translated: The fetter of envy is said to obscure the understanding of gain and honor.

original: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smos pa /
translated: Here, the cause is stated:

original: de'i nyes pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: because one does not see the fault in that.

original: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa ste /
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la chags pa ste /
translated: The fetter of envy is attachment to gain and honor.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la zhe sdang gi char gtogs pas sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la zhe sdang gi char gtogs pas sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: It is an inner disturbance of the mind that is a part of hatred, in regard to the excellence of others.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas yin par khong du chud pa ni yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la gnod pa thams cad kyi gnas yin par khong du chud pa ni yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of gain and honor is the understanding that they are the basis of all harm.

original: phrag dog gis ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yon tan thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / gnod pa sna @224b tshogs kyi rtsa bar gyur par mi shes pas /
analyzed: phrag dog gis ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yon tan thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / gnod pa sna @224b tshogs kyi rtsa bar gyur par mi shes pas /
translated: Because of jealousy, one does not understand that gain and honor are adverse to all virtues and are the root of various harms.

original: de'i phyir phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
translated: Therefore, the fetter of jealousy is an obscuration to the thorough knowledge of gain and honor.

original: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib po //
translated: The fetter of avarice is an obscuration to the thorough knowledge of fewness of wishes.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir yo byad la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir yo byad la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How so? Therefore he says: because of excessive attachment to goods.

original: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la lhag par chags pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la lhag par chags pa ste /
translated: Avarice is excessive attachment to goods.

original: 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pas 'tshog chas rnams la sems kun du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pas 'tshog chas rnams la sems kun du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of the mind by the articles of livelihood, which is included in passion.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa ni yo byad rnams las lhag par dben pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa ni yo byad rnams las lhag par dben pa'o //
translated: It is the extreme isolation from the articles of livelihood.

original: de la yon tan thams cad kyi gnas kyi dngos por yongs su rtogs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan thams cad kyi gnas kyi dngos por yongs su rtogs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The understanding of the basis of all virtues is the knowledge.

original: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la lhag par chags pas /
analyzed: ser sna ni yo byad rnams la lhag par chags pas /
translated: The stinginess is the excessive attachment to the articles of livelihood.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi gnas su yongs su mi shes te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi gnas su yongs su mi shes te /
translated: Because of that, there is no understanding of the basis of all virtues.

original: de'i phyir yo byad bsnyungs pa la sgrib po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yo byad bsnyungs pa la sgrib po zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the stinginess is an obscuration to the austerity of the articles of livelihood.

original: de la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni de kho na rtogs par byed par sbyor ba ni sgrib kyi /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni de kho na rtogs par byed par sbyor ba ni sgrib kyi /
translated: The fetters of attachment and hostility are obscurations to the application to the realization of thatness,

original: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to the others.

original: lhag ma rnams ni de kho na rtogs par byed par zhugs par byed pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni de kho na rtogs par byed par zhugs par byed pa la sgrib po //
translated: The remaining fetters are obscurations to the application to the realization of thatness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the order of these is as follows.

original: thar pa 'dod pas thog ma nyid du gdon mi za bar 'khor ba la sems skyo bar bya'o ;
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pas thog ma nyid du gdon mi za bar 'khor ba la sems skyo bar bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberation must first of all become disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: / de nas thams cad la btang snyoms su bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas thams cad la btang snyoms su bya'o //
translated: Then one should become indifferent to everything.

original: de nas gnod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnod pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Then one should understand the view of the transitory collection, since it is the root of all harm.

original: de'i 'og tu de'i gzhi la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i gzhi la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should understand the nature of suffering and origination in its basis.

original: de nas de 'gog pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de 'gog pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Then one should understand its cessation.

original: de'i 'og tu thob pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thob pa'i lam shes par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should understand the path that leads to its attainment.

original: de nas bden pa mthong ba dang yon tan de dag rtog pa'i phyir dkon mchog la shes nas dad pa 'thob po //
analyzed: de nas bden pa mthong ba dang yon tan de dag rtog pa'i phyir dkon mchog la shes nas dad pa 'thob po //
translated: Then, because one has seen the truths and has understood those qualities, one obtains faith that is born of insight into the Jewels.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i stobs nyid kyis kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa gnyis kyi nyes pa dang yon tan mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i stobs nyid kyis kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa gnyis kyi nyes pa dang yon tan mthong ba yin no //
translated: And by the power of having seen the truths, one sees the faults and benefits of the two extremes of indulgence and mortification with regard to wealth and honor.

original: de ltar bsgrib par bya ba'i chos kyi go rims kyi rgyus de'i sgrib pa'i go rims kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrib par bya ba'i chos kyi go rims kyi rgyus de'i sgrib pa'i go rims kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the order of the obscurations should be understood by the order of the phenomena that are obscured.

original: thams cad la yang thams cad sgrib pa nyid du srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la yang thams cad sgrib pa nyid du srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is possible for all to obscure all,

original: gzhi so sor nges pas sgrib par bshad pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi so sor nges pas sgrib par bshad pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not unreasonable to explain obscuration as determined by the individual bases?

original: @225a * // 'dir gzhi so sor nges par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: @225a * // 'dir gzhi so sor nges par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the individual bases are not determined,

original: so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir gtso bor byas te 'di bstan to //
analyzed: so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir gtso bor byas te 'di bstan to //
translated: but this is taught as the primary factor because they are present individually.

original: ci sgrib pa de zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci sgrib pa de zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are those obscurations exhausted?

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyi thun no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyi thun no //
translated: They are common to the bodhisattva and śrāvaka, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrib pa ni /
translated: The obscurations of the bodhisattvas

original: dge ba la sogs pa bcu la gzhan sgrib pa gang yin pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa yang gang yin mi shes te /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa bcu la gzhan sgrib pa gang yin pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa yang gang yin mi shes te /
translated: are any obscurations to the ten such as virtue, etc., and it is not known which are the virtues, etc.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / sbyor ba med dang skye mched min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sbyor ba med dang skye mched min //
translated: There is no application, no sense base,

original: rnal 'byor min pas gang bskyed dang // zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor min pas gang bskyed dang // zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscurations are stated in the verse:🔽“The obscurations are the non-generation of the roots of virtue, the generation of the roots of demerit, and the non-cultivation of the roots of virtue that have been generated.”

original: dge ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The virtues, etc. are stated in the verse:

original: dge dang byang chub yang dag 'dzin //
analyzed: dge dang byang chub yang dag 'dzin //
translated: “The virtues and enlightenment are the correct graspings.”

original: zhes bya ba la sgos pa don bcu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sgos pa don bcu'o //
translated: The obscurations are the ten topics.

original: de la dge ba ni byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa ste dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad do //
analyzed: de la dge ba ni byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa ste dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad do //
translated: Among them, the virtues are the causes of enlightenment, i.e., all the roots of virtue.

original: byang chub ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni de'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the result of those.

original: de la dge ba ni spyir bstan pa bas rab tu dbye ba dang / rang bzhin mi shes nas de'i phyir de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rtsom ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba ni spyir bstan pa bas rab tu dbye ba dang / rang bzhin mi shes nas de'i phyir de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rtsom ste /
translated: Since the virtues are taught in general, but their differentiation and nature are not known, in order to understand them, he composes this treatise.

original: yang dag 'dzin /
analyzed: yang dag 'dzin /
translated: The correct graspings are stated in the verse:

original: blo ldan 'khrul med sgrib pa med //
analyzed: blo ldan 'khrul med sgrib pa med //
translated: “The wise ones are without error, without obscurations,

original: bsngo dang mi skrag ser sna med //
analyzed: bsngo dang mi skrag ser sna med //
translated: without fear, and without stinginess.”

original: ces bya ba de dag ni dge bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba de dag ni dge bzhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the virtues.

original: byang chub kyang smos pa tsam gyis rang bzhin mi shes te /
analyzed: byang chub kyang smos pa tsam gyis rang bzhin mi shes te /
translated: Enlightenment is also not known by its mere mention.

original: de'i phyir de ni dbang ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dbang ngo zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is the power.

original: kha cig na re dge ba dang byang chub dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgrib pa rang gi rgyud yod par bshad pas /
analyzed: kha cig na re dge ba dang byang chub dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgrib pa rang gi rgyud yod par bshad pas /
translated: Some say: Just as virtue, enlightenment, and correct grasp, etc. are explained as obscurations to the existence of their own continuum,

original: 'dir rang gi rgyud yod pa nyid du shes kyi /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi rgyud yod pa nyid du shes kyi /
translated: here, obscuration is understood as the existence of their own continuum.

original: bstan pa dang bshad pa'i dngos por ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang bshad pa'i dngos por ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: But it is not as an object to be taught or explained.

original: skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Obscuration to arising is established as virtue.

original: de yang byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi thun yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi thun yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, virtue is common to all, such as the generation of the enlightenment mind, etc.

original: dge ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But virtue is to be generated.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa la sgrib pa dang rten la sogs pa la sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ste tha dad do //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa la sgrib pa dang rten la sogs pa la sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ste tha dad do //
translated: Obscuration to correct grasp, etc. and obscuration to the basis, etc. are obscurations to correct grasp, etc. and are distinct.

original: byang chub ni mi 'khrug pa dang / thob par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub ni mi 'khrug pa dang / thob par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Enlightenment is unshakable and is to be attained, therefore,

original: de'i gnas pa la sgrib pa dang / thob par bya ba la sgrib pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas pa la sgrib pa dang / thob par bya ba la sgrib pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: obscuration to its abiding and obscuration to its attainment are established.

original: de bas na de rang gi rgyud du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de rang gi rgyud du yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in one's own stream.

original: de dag gi go rims kyang mdor na dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus @225b par bsgrubs nas byang chub thob par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims kyang mdor na dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus @225b par bsgrubs nas byang chub thob par bya'o //
translated: In brief, the order of these is as follows: having completed all the roots of virtue, one should attain enlightenment.

original: rgyas par ni thog ma nyid du byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par ni thog ma nyid du byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: In detail, first one should generate the thought of enlightenment,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: de nas sems bskyed pa dang mthun par sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sems bskyed pa dang mthun par sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Then, in accordance with the generation of the thought, one should practice giving and so forth,

original: des byang chub sems dpar mngon no //
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpar mngon no //
translated: because by that one is known as a bodhisattva.

original: de nas bskal pa grangs med par goms par byas te /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas bsam par rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bskal pa grangs med par goms par byas te / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas bsam par rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, having practiced for a countless eon,

original: gang zag dang chos la nor ba'i gnyen por ma nor ba'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la nor ba'i gnyen por ma nor ba'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam bskyed par bya'o //
translated: one should generate the path of insight, which is the antidote to the error of the person and the thing, in order to purify the intention by accumulating the collections of merit and knowledge.

original: de nas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sgrib pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba bsgom pa'i lam mthar phyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sgrib pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba bsgom pa'i lam mthar phyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to be endowed with the special purity, one should perfect the path of cultivation, which is distinguished by being free from obscurations.

original: de nas nyan thos la sogs pa las 'da' bar sbyor bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bsags pa de dag thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyan thos la sogs pa las 'da' bar sbyor bas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bsags pa de dag thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should dedicate all the roots of virtue, mundane and supramundane, that have been accumulated through the practice of transcending the śrāvakas and so forth, to enlightenment.

original: de nas gnas de thob pa dang / byang chub chen por bsam par mi byed pas /
analyzed: de nas gnas de thob pa dang / byang chub chen por bsam par mi byed pas /
translated: Then, having attained that stage, one should not think of great enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba rnams la skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bstan pa zab cing rgya che ba rnams la skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and thus one will not be afraid of the profound and vast teachings of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: de nas mang du thos pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos rgya cher ston to //
translated: Then, having become learned and realized, one should extensively teach the Dharma in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: de nas 'dul ba yongs su smin nas de dag rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir dbang ste /
analyzed: de nas 'dul ba yongs su smin nas de dag rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir dbang ste /
translated: Then, when the disciples are fully ripened, in order to liberate them, there is the empowerment.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob po //
translated: They attain buddhahood.

original: 'dir sgrib pa sum cu dang / bsgrib par bya ba dge ba la sogs pa'i don bcu bshad bas de'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa de rnams la gang la sgrib pa du yod pa mi shes nas dris pa dang de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir sgrib pa sum cu dang / bsgrib par bya ba dge ba la sogs pa'i don bcu bshad bas de'i phyir dge ba la sogs pa de rnams la gang la sgrib pa du yod pa mi shes nas dris pa dang de'i phyir /
translated: Here, the thirty obscurations and the ten topics such as virtue are explained. Therefore, since it is not known how many obscurations there are to those virtues and so on, it is asked.🔽And in response to that, it is said:

original: de dag gi ni sgrib pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag gi ni sgrib pa rnams //
translated: Their obscurations

original: gsum gsum dag tu shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum gsum dag tu shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: should be known as threefold.🔽Therein, the three obscurations are:

original: de la sgrib pa gsum zhes bya ba la sbyor ba med pa ni rtsom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa gsum zhes bya ba la sbyor ba med pa ni rtsom pa med pa'o //
translated: Lack of application is non-engagement.

original: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na /🔽bag med pa'ang le lo'i nyon mongs pa gang gis mi sbyor ba ste /🔽nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa gang zhe na / bag med pa'ang le lo'i nyon mongs pa gang gis mi sbyor ba ste / nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: What is the obscuration here?🔽It is heedlessness, by which one does not apply oneself due to the affliction of laziness.

original: nyon mongs par gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang du mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gang du mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is possessing the seeds of affliction, or the specific state of being afflicted, in which one does not apply oneself.

original: rgyun du ma chud pa'am gus par mi @226a * //
analyzed: rgyun du ma chud pa'am gus par mi @226a * //
translated: Do not be inconsistent or disrespectful.🔽

original: sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ste /
translated: It is not a practice because it is not continuous or respectful.

original: chung bas na sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'i //
analyzed: chung bas na sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'i //
translated: It is not a practice because it is small.

original: sbyor ba med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no practice,

original: de la sgrib par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgrib par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that there is an obstruction to that.

original: skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba ni /
translated: The non-basis is the opposite of the basis.

original: byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skye ba'i sgo gsung rab gang yin pa de skye mched de /
analyzed: byang chub dang byang chub thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skye ba'i sgo gsung rab gang yin pa de skye mched de /
translated: The basis is the scriptures, which are the door to the arising of enlightenment and the roots of virtue that lead to the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de las gzhan pa ni skye mched ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni skye mched ma yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the non-basis.
